verses.latin: In principio creavit Deus caelum et terram.
verses.english: In the beginning, God created the universe and the earth.

verses.latin:
Terra autem erat inanis et vacua,
et tenebrae erant super faciem abyssi:
et spiritus Dei ferebatur super aquas.
verses.english:
The earth wasn't finished yet.
The matter of the earth was present but not yet formed or inhabited, and it was dark,
and God's Spirit was there, hovering over the unformed earth.

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus: Fiat lux. Et facta est lux.
verses.english: God then created light by saying "Let there be light!"

verses.latin:
Et vidit Deus lucem quod esset bona:
et divisit lucem ac tenebras.
verses.english:
God saw that the light was good
and caused the light to travel through the darkness of space.

verses.latin:
Appellavitque lucem Diem, et tenebras Noctem:
factumque est vespere et mane, dies unus.
verses.english:
He called the time when it is bright "day",
and the time when it is dark "night". The first ever evening and morning passed—the first day of all of history.

verses.latin:
Dixit quoque Deus: Fiat firmamentum in medio aquarum:
et dividat aquas ab aquis.
verses.english: And God said: "Let there be an atmosphere to separate Earth from the rest of creation."

verses.latin:
Et fecit Deus firmamentum,
divisitque aquas quae erant sub firmamento,
ab his quae erant super firmamento:
et factum est ita.
verses.english:
So God made the atmosphere
between the unformed Earth
and the rest of the universe that was still being formed,
and the Earth was separated from the rest of the universe.

verses.latin:
Vocavitque Deus firmamentum, Caelum:
et factum est vespere et mane, dies secundus.
verses.english:
He called the atmosphere "the sky".
Evening and morning then came, the second day.

verses.latin:
Dixit vero Deus: Congregentur aquae quae sub caelo sunt in locum unum:
et appareat arida. Et factum est ita.
verses.english:
God said "Let the oceans and land of the earth appear and take their proper places."
And it was immediately so.

verses.latin:
Et vocavit Deus aridam, Terram:
congregationesque aquarum appellavit, Maria.
Et vidit Deus quod esset bonum.
verses.english:
And God called the oceans "the sea"
and the dry ground "land",
and God saw that it was good.

verses.latin:
Et ait: Germinet terra herbam virentem, et facientem semen,
et lignum pomiferum faciens fructum juxta genus suum,
cujus semen in semetipso sit super terram.
Et factum est ita.
verses.english:
And God said, “Let the earth sprout every sort of plant.
Let there be all types of grasses, herbs, and trees, including those that produce fruit.
Let the plants produce seeds that grow into the same species of plant.”
After God said this, the earth was filled with plant life.

verses.latin: Et protulit terra herbam virentem, et facientem semen juxta genus suum, lignumque faciens fructum, et habens unumquodque sementem secundum speciem suam. Et vidit Deus quod esset bonum.
verses.english: The earth then produced lush plant life. It brought forth all types of grasses and herbs, each with seeds that would reproduce its own kind. It also brought forth trees that produced fruit, each with its own seeds that would reproduce its own kind. God saw that this was good.

verses.latin: Et factum est vespere et mane, dies tertius.
verses.english: Evening and morning passed; it was the third day.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Deus: Fiant luminaria in firmamento caeli, et dividant diem ac noctem, et sint in signa et tempora, et dies et annos:
verses.english: God then said, "Let there be sources of light in the sky to separate day from night. Let them serve as indicators for marking holy days, seasons, days, and years.

verses.latin: ut luceant in firmamento caeli, et illuminent terram. Et factum est ita.
verses.english: Let them shine in the sky to illuminate the earth." And so it was.

verses.latin: Fecitque Deus duo magna luminaria: luminare majus, ut praeesset diei: et luminare minus, ut praeesset nocti: et stellas.
verses.english: God created two great sources of light: the sun, the greater light, to govern the day, and the moon, the lesser light, to govern the night. He also created the stars.

verses.latin: Et posuit eas Deus in firmamento caeli, ut lucerent super terram,
verses.english: God placed these sources of light in the sky to shine upon the earth,

verses.latin: et praeessent diei ac nocti, et dividerent lucem ac tenebras. Et vidit Deus quod esset bonum.
verses.english: and to govern the day and the night, and to separate the light from the darkness. God saw that this was good.

verses.latin: Et factum est vespere et mane, dies quartus.
verses.english: Evening and morning passed; it was the fourth day.

verses.latin: Dixit etiam Deus: Producant aquae reptile animae viventis, et volatile super terram sub firmamento caeli.
verses.english: God also said, "Let the waters teem with every type of living creature, and let birds fly above the earth, across the sky."

verses.latin: Creavitque Deus cete grandia, et omnem animam viventem atque motabilem, quam produxerant aquae in species suas, et omne volatile secundum genus suum. Et vidit Deus quod esset bonum.
verses.english: So God created the great sea monsters and every other living creature that moves, with which the waters teem, each according to its species. He also created every winged bird according to its species. God saw that this was good.

verses.latin: Benedixitque eis Deus, dicens: Crescite, et multiplicamini, et replete aquas maris: avesque multiplicentur super terram.
verses.english: God blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful, multiply, and fill the waters of the seas. And let the birds multiply on the earth."

verses.latin: Et factum est vespere et mane, dies quintus.
verses.english: Evening and morning passed; it was the fifth day.

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus: Producat terra animam viventem in genere suo, jumenta, et reptilia, et bestias terrae secundum species suas. Et factum est ita.
verses.english: God said, "Let the earth bring forth living creatures according to their kinds: cattle, creatures that move along the ground, and wild animals, each according to its species." And so it was.

verses.latin: Et fecit Deus bestias terrae juxta species suas, et jumenta, et omne reptile terrae in genere suo. Et vidit Deus quod esset bonum.
verses.english: God made the wild animals of the earth according to their species, the cattle according to their species, and all creatures that move along the ground according to their species. God saw that this was good.

verses.latin: Et ait: Faciamus hominem ad imaginem et similitudinem nostram: et praesit piscibus maris, et volatilibus caeli, et bestiis, universaeque terrae, omnique reptili quod movetur in terra.
verses.english: Then God said, "Let Us make man in Our image, according to Our likeness. Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, over the cattle, over all the earth, and over every creature that moves along the ground."

verses.latin: Et creavit Deus hominem ad imaginem suam: ad imaginem Dei creavit illum, masculum et feminam creavit eos.
verses.english: So God created man in His own image; in the image of God, He created him. He created them male and female.

verses.latin: Benedixitque illis Deus, et ait: Crescite, et multiplicamini, et replete terram, et subjicite eam, et dominamini piscibus maris, et volatilibus caeli, et universis animantibus, quae moventur super terram.
verses.english: God blessed them and said to them, "Be fruitful and multiply. Fill the earth and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living creature that moves on the earth."

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus: Ecce dedi vobis omnem herbam afferentem semen super terram, et universa ligna quae habent in semetipsis sementem generis sui, ut sint vobis in escam:
verses.english: Then God said, "Look, I have given you every seed-bearing plant on the face of the entire earth, and every tree whose fruit contains seed. These will be your food.

verses.latin: et cunctis animantibus terrae, omnique volucri caeli, et universis quae moventur in terra, et in quibus est anima vivens, ut habeant ad vescendum. Et factum est ita.
verses.english: And to every beast of the earth, to every bird of the sky, and to every creature that moves along the ground—everything that has the breath of life in it—I have given every green plant for food." And so it was.

verses.latin: Viditque Deus cuncta quae fecerat, et erant valde bona. Et factum est vespere et mane, dies sextus.
verses.english: God looked at everything He had made, and indeed, it was very good. Evening and morning passed; it was the sixth day.

verses.latin: Igitur perfecti sunt caeli et terra, et omnis ornatus eorum.
verses.english: So, the universe and the earth, and all that fills them, were finished.

verses.latin: Et complevit Deus die septimo opus suum quod fecerat: et requievit die septimo ab universo opere quod patrarat.
verses.english: By the seventh day, God had finished all the work of creation He had been doing. He ceased His work on the seventh day, resting from everything He had made.

verses.latin: Et benedixit diei septimo, et sanctificavit illum: quia in ipso cessaverat ab omni opere suo quod creavit et fecerat.
verses.english: And God blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on that day He had finished all His work of creation.

verses.latin: Hae sunt generationes caeli et terrae, quando creatae sunt, in die quo fecit Dominus Deus caelum et terram,
verses.english: This is the historical account of the universe and the earth at their creation, at the time when the Lord God made the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: et omne virgultum agri antequam oreretur in terra, omnemque herbam regionis prius quam germinaret: non enim pluerat Dominus Deus super terram, et homo non erat qui operaretur terram:
verses.english: There was no plant yet growing in the field, nor had any herb of the region sprouted. For the Lord God had not yet caused rain to fall upon the earth, and there was no man to cultivate the land.

verses.latin: sed fons ascendebat e terra, irrigans universam superficiem terrae.
verses.english: Instead, a spring of water would rise up from the earth, watering the entire surface of the ground.

verses.latin: Formavit igitur Dominus Deus hominem de limo terrae, et inspiravit in faciem ejus spiraculum vitae, et factus est homo in animam viventem.
verses.english: So the Lord God formed man from the dust of the ground, and He breathed into his face the breath of life, and thus man became a living soul.

verses.latin: Plantaverat autem Dominus Deus paradisum voluptatis a principio: in quo posuit hominem quem formaverat.
verses.english: Then the Lord God had planted a garden of delight from the beginning in the East, and there He placed the man whom He had formed.

verses.latin: Produxitque Dominus Deus de humo omne lignum pulchrum visu, et ad vescendum suave lignum etiam vitae in medio paradisi, lignumque scientiae boni et mali.
verses.english: And the Lord God caused to grow from the ground every tree that was pleasing to the eye and good for food. He also placed the tree of life in the middle of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

verses.latin: Et fluvius egrediebatur de loco voluptatis ad irrigandum paradisum, qui inde dividitur in quatuor capita.
verses.english: A river flowed out of the place of delight to water the garden, and from there it divided into four branches.

verses.latin: Nomen uni Phison: ipse est qui circuit omnem terram Hevilath, ubi aurum nascitur:
verses.english: The name of the first is Pishon; it is the one that flows around the entire land of Havilah, where gold is found.

verses.latin: et aurum terrae illius optimum est: ibique invenitur bdellium, et lapis onychinus.
verses.english: The gold of that land is of excellent quality. Bdellium (a fragrant resin) and the onyx stone are also found there.

verses.latin: Et nomen fluvii secundi Gehon: ipse est qui circuit omnem terram Aethiopiae.
verses.english: The name of the second river is Gihon; it is the one that flows around the entire land of Cush (Ethiopia).

verses.latin: Nomen vero fluminis tertii Tigris: ipse vadit contra Assyrios. Fluvius autem quartus ipse est Euphrates.
verses.english: The name of the third river is Tigris; it flows eastward toward Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Dominus Deus hominem, et posuit eum in paradiso voluptatis, ut operaretur et custodiret illum.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God took the man and placed him in the Garden of Delight to cultivate and keep it.

verses.latin: Praecepitque ei dicens: Ex omni ligno paradisi comede:
verses.english: And the Lord God gave the man this command, saying: "From every tree of the garden you may freely eat.

verses.latin: de ligno autem scientiae boni et mali ne comedas: in quocumque enim die comederis ex eo, morte morieris.
verses.english: But from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat; for on the day that you eat from it, you will surely die."

verses.latin: Dixit quoque Dominus Deus: Non est bonum esse hominem solum: faciamus ei adjutorium simile sibi.
verses.english: Then the Lord God said: "It is not good for man to be alone. I will make him a helper suitable for him."

verses.latin: Formatis igitur Dominus Deus de humo cunctis animantibus terrae, et universis volatilibus caeli, adduxit ea ad Adam ut videret quid vocaret ea: omne enim quod vocavit Adam animae viventis, ipsum est nomen ejus.
verses.english: So, the Lord God, having formed out of the ground all the beasts of the earth and all the birds of the sky, brought them to Adam to see what he would call them. And whatever Adam called each living creature, that was its name.

verses.latin: Appellavitque Adam nominibus suis cuncta animantia, et universa volatilia caeli, et omnes bestias terrae: Adae vero non inveniebatur adjutor similis ejus.
verses.english: Adam gave names to all the livestock, and to the birds of the sky, and to all the beasts of the field. But for Adam himself, no suitable helper was found.

verses.latin: Immisit ergo Dominus Deus soporem in Adam: cumque obdormisset, tulit unam de costis ejus, et replevit carnem pro ea.
verses.english: So the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam. And while he was sleeping, God took one of his ribs and then closed up the flesh in its place.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit Dominus Deus costam quam tulerat de Adam in mulierem: et adduxit eam ad Adam.
verses.english: And the Lord God formed the rib, which He had taken from Adam, into a woman, and He brought her to Adam.

verses.latin: Dixitque Adam: Hoc nunc os de ossibus meis, et caro de carne mea: haec vocabitur Virago, quoniam de viro sumpta est.
verses.english: Then Adam said: "This at last is bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh! She shall be called 'Woman' because she was taken out of Man."

verses.latin: Quam ob rem relinquet homo patrem suum et matrem suam, et adhaerebit uxori suae: et erunt duo in carne una.
verses.english: Therefore, a man will leave his father and his mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.

verses.latin: Erat autem uterque nudus, Adam scilicet et uxor ejus: et non erubescebant.
verses.english: And the man and his wife were both naked, but they felt no shame.

verses.latin: Sed et serpens erat callidior cunctis animantibus terræ quæ fecerat Dominus Deus. Qui dixit ad mulierem: Cur præcepit vobis Deus ut non comederetis de omni ligno paradisi?
verses.english: Now, the serpent was the most cunning creature among all the animals the Lord God had made on the earth. It came to the woman and said, 'Why did God give you a command that you should not eat from *any* tree in this entire garden?' —the serpent twisted God's actual prohibition, making it sound like they were forbidden from everything.

verses.latin: Cui respondit mulier: De fructu lignorum quæ sunt in paradiso vescimur:
verses.english: The woman answered the serpent, 'We may eat the fruit from the trees throughout this garden;'

verses.latin: de fructu vero ligni quod est in medio paradisi præcepit nobis Deus ne comederemus, et ne tangeremus illud, ne forte moriamur.
verses.english: but from the fruit of the tree that stands in the very center of the garden, God has strictly commanded us not to eat, nor even to touch it—an addition the woman made to God's original command—lest we die.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem serpens ad mulierem: Nequaquam morte moriemini.
verses.english: But the serpent said to the woman, 'No, you will not die at all!'

verses.latin: Scit enim Deus quod in quocumque die comederitis ex eo, aperientur oculi vestri, et eritis sicut dii, scientes bonum et malum.
verses.english: For God knows that on the very day you eat from it, your eyes will be opened, and you will become like gods, knowing both good and evil, just as He does.'

verses.latin: Vidit ergo mulier quod bonum esset lignum ad vescendum, et pulchrum oculis, aspectuque delectabile: et tulit de fructu illius, et comedit: deditque viro suo, qui comedit.
verses.english: Therefore, the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was beautiful to the eyes, and that it was delightful to look at. She then took some of its fruit and ate it; and she also gave some to her husband, and he ate it.

verses.latin: Et aperti sunt oculi amborum: cumque cognovissent se esse nudos, consuerunt folia ficus, et fecerunt sibi perizomata.
verses.english: And the eyes of both of them were indeed opened, not to wisdom but to shame; and when they realized they were naked, they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves to hide their nakedness.

verses.latin: Et cum audissent vocem Domini Dei deambulantis in paradiso ad auram post meridiem, abscondit se Adam et uxor ejus a facie Domini Dei in medio ligni paradisi.
verses.english: And when they heard the voice of the Lord God, Who was walking about in the garden during the cool afternoon breeze, Adam and his wife immediately hid themselves from the presence of the Lord God, concealing themselves among the trees of the garden.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Dominus Deus Adam, et dixit ei: Ubi es?
verses.english: And the Lord God called to Adam and said to him, 'Where are you?'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Vocem tuam audivi in paradiso, et timui, eo quod nudus essem, et abscondi me.
verses.english: He answered, 'I heard Your voice in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid myself.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei: Quis enim indicavit tibi quod nudus esses, nisi quod ex ligno de quo præceperam tibi ne comederes, comedisti?
verses.english: And God said to him, 'Who told you that you were naked, unless it was because you had eaten from the very tree about which I commanded you not to eat?'

verses.latin: Dixitque Adam: Mulier quam dedisti sociam mihi, dedit mihi de ligno, et comedi.
verses.english: And Adam said, 'The woman You gave to be my companion—she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus Deus ad mulierem: Quid hoc fecisti? Quæ respondit: Serpens suasit mihi, et comedi.
verses.english: And the Lord God said to the woman, 'What is this that you have done?' And she replied, 'The serpent cleverly deceived me, and so I ate.'

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus Deus ad serpentem: Quia fecisti hoc, maledictus es inter omnia animantia, et bestias terræ: super pectus tuum gradieris, et terram comedes cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ.
verses.english: And the Lord God said to the serpent, 'Because you have done this, you are cursed above all living creatures and all beasts of the earth. You shall crawl on your belly, and you shall metaphorically eat the dust of the earth—meaning, you shall always be humbled and defeated—all the days of your life.'

verses.latin: Inimicitias ponam inter te et mulierem, et semen tuum et semen illius: ipsa conteret caput tuum, et tu insidiaberis calcaneo ejus.
verses.english: I will put enmities, a spiritual warfare, between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. She, the Woman, shall crush your head—a prophecy of Mary and her Son, Jesus Christ, triumphing over you—and you, in turn, shall lie in wait for her heel, attempting to wound Him.

verses.latin: Ad mulierem quoque dixit: Multiplicabo ærumnas tuas, et conceptus tuos: in dolore paries filios, et sub viri potestate eris, et ipse dominabitur tui.
verses.english: To the woman He also said, 'I will greatly multiply your sorrows and your painful conceptions. In great pain you shall give birth to children; and you shall be subject to your husband's authority, and he shall rule over you.'

verses.latin: Ad Adam vero dixit: Quia audisti vocem uxoris tuæ, et comedisti de ligno, ex quo præceperam tibi ne comederes, maledicta est terra in opere tuo: in laboribus comedes ex ea cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ.
verses.english: And to Adam He said, 'Because you listened to the voice of your wife, and ate from the tree concerning which I specifically commanded you, "You shall not eat from it," therefore, the very ground is now cursed because of your deed. You shall eat from it only through hard labor and toil all the days of your life.'

verses.latin: Spinas et tribulos germinabit tibi, et comedes herbam terræ.
verses.english: Thorns and thistles shall the earth bring forth for you, and you shall eat the wild plants of the field to survive.

verses.latin: In sudore vultus tui vesceris pane, donec revertaris in terram de qua sumptus es: quia pulvis es et in pulverem reverteris.
verses.english: By the sweat of your face you shall eat bread, until you return to the very ground from which you were taken; for you are dust, and to dust you shall return in death.

verses.latin: Et vocavit Adam nomen uxoris suæ, Heva: eo quod mater esset cunctorum viventium.
verses.english: And Adam called the name of his wife 'Eve'—meaning 'life-giver'—because she would be the mother of all who live.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque Dominus Deus Adæ et uxori ejus tunicas pelliceas, et induit eos.
verses.english: And the Lord God also made garments of animal skins for Adam and his wife, and He clothed them with these, providing a more lasting covering than their fig leaves and foreshadowing future atonement.

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus Deus: Ecce Adam quasi unus ex nobis factus est, sciens bonum et malum: nunc ergo ne forte mittat manum suam, et sumat etiam de ligno vitæ, et comedat, et vivat in æternum.
verses.english: And the Lord God said, 'Behold, Adam has now become like one of Us—meaning, like the divine beings in heaven—by knowing good and evil in a fallen way. Now, therefore, lest he reach out his hand and also take from the Tree of Life, and eat, and live forever in this fallen state—'

verses.latin: Et emisit eum Dominus Deus de paradiso voluptatis, ut operaretur terram de qua sumptus est.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God sent Adam out from the Garden of Eden—the Garden of Pleasure—so that he might work the very ground from which he was taken, as a consequence of his sin.

verses.latin: Et ejecit Adam: et collocavit ante paradisum voluptatis cherubim, et flammeum gladium atque versatilem, ad custodiendam viam ligni vitæ.
verses.english: And so He drove Adam out; and at the eastern side of the Garden of Pleasure, He stationed Cherubim and a flaming sword that turned every way, to guard the path to the Tree of Life and prevent humanity from reaching it in their fallen state.

verses.latin: Adam vero cognovit uxorem suam Hevam: quae concepit et peperit Cain, dicens: Possedi hominem per Deum.
verses.english: Adam knew his wife, Eve. She conceived and gave birth to Cain, saying, "I have gotten a man through God."

verses.latin: Rursumque peperit fratrem ejus Abel. Fuit autem Abel pastor ovium, et Cain agricola.
verses.english: Again, she gave birth to his brother, Abel. Abel became a shepherd of sheep, while Cain was a tiller of the ground.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post multos dies, ut offerret Cain de fructibus terrae munera Domino.
verses.english: After a period of many days, Cain brought an offering to the Lord from the produce of the earth.

verses.latin: Abel quoque obtulit de primogenitis gregis sui, et de adipibus eorum: et respexit Dominus ad Abel, et ad munera ejus.
verses.english: Abel also offered from the firstborn of his flock and from their fat portions. The Lord looked with favor upon Abel and his offering.

verses.latin: Ad Cain vero, et ad munera illius non respexit: iratusque est Cain vehementer, et concidit vultus ejus.
verses.english: But upon Cain and his offering, He did not look with favor. Cain became extremely angry, and his face fell.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Quare iratus es? et cur concidit vultus tuus?
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Cain, "Why are you angry? Why has your face fallen?"

verses.latin: Nonne si bene egeris, recipies? Sin autem male, statim in foribus peccatum aderit: sed sub te erit appetitus ejus, et tu dominaberis illius.
verses.english: If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is waiting at the door, and its desire is for you, but you must master it.

verses.latin: Et dixit Cain ad Abel fratrem suum: Egrediamur foras. Cumque essent in agro, consurrexit Cain adversus Abel fratrem suum, et interfecit eum.
verses.english: Cain then spoke to his brother Abel, saying, "Let us go out to the field." When they were in the field, Cain attacked his brother Abel and murdered him.

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus ad Cain: Ubi est Abel frater tuus? Qui respondit: Nescio: num custos fratris mei sum ego?
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Cain, "Where is your brother Abel?" He answered, "I do not know. Am I my brother's keeper?"

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum: Quid fecisti? Vox sanguinis fratris tui clamat ad me de terra.
verses.english: And He said to him, "What have you done? The voice of your brother's blood is crying out to me from the earth!"

verses.latin: Nunc igitur maledictus eris super terram, quae aperuit os suum, et suscepit sanguinem fratris tui de manu tua.
verses.english: Now, therefore, you are cursed from the earth, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.

verses.latin: Cum operatus fueris eam, non dabit tibi fructus suos: vagus et profugus eris super terram.
verses.english: When you cultivate the ground, it will no longer yield its produce to you. You shall be a restless wanderer on the earth.

verses.latin: Dixitque Cain ad Dominum: Major est iniquitas mea, quam ut veniam merear.
verses.english: And Cain said to the Lord, "My punishment is too great for me to bear."

verses.latin: Ecce ejicis me hodie a facie terrae, et a facie tua abscondar, et ero vagus et profugus in terra: omnis igitur qui invenerit me, occidet me.
verses.english: Behold, today you are driving me from the face of the earth, and from your presence I shall be hidden. I shall be a restless wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Dominus: Nequaquam ita fiet: sed omnis qui occiderit Cain, septuplum punietur. Posuitque Dominus Cain signum, ut non eum interficeret omnis qui invenisset eum.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to him, "Not so! If anyone kills Cain, he will suffer vengeance seven times over." And the Lord put a protective mark on Cain, so that no one who found him would kill him.

verses.latin: Egressusque Cain a facie Domini, habitavit profugus in terra Naid, ad orientalem plagam Eden.
verses.english: So Cain went out from the presence of the Lord and lived as an exile in the land of Nod, to the east of Eden.

verses.latin: Cognovit autem Cain uxorem suam, quae concepit, et peperit Enoch: et aedificavit civitatem, vocavitque nomen ejus ex nomine filii sui, Enoch.
verses.english: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to Enoch. Cain then built a city and named it Enoch, after his son.

verses.latin: Natus est autem Enoch Irad: et Irad genuit Maviael, et Maviael genuit Mathusael, et Mathusael genuit Lamech.
verses.english: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad begot Maviael. Maviael begot Mathusael, and Mathusael begot Lamech.

verses.latin: Qui accepit duas uxores: nomen uni Ada, et nomen alteri Sella.
verses.english: Lamech took two wives. The name of the first was Ada, and the name of the second was Sella.

verses.latin: Et peperit Ada Jabal: ipse fuit pater habitantium in tentoriis, atque pastorum.
verses.english: Ada gave birth to Jabal. He became the father of those who dwell in tents and keep livestock.

verses.latin: Nomen vero fratris ejus Jubal: ipse fuit pater canentium cithara et organo.
verses.english: His brother's name was Jubal. He was the father of all who play the lyre and the pipe.

verses.latin: Sella quoque peperit Tubalcain, qui fuit malleator et faber in cuncta opera aeris et ferri. Soror vero Tubalcain, Noema.
verses.english: Sella also gave birth to Tubalcain, who was an instructor and smith in every kind of bronze and iron work. The sister of Tubalcain was Noema.

verses.latin: Dixitque Lamech uxoribus suis Adae et Sellae: Audite vocem meam, uxores Lamech, et auscultate sermonem meum: quoniam occidi virum in vulnus meum, et adolescentulum in livor meum.
verses.english: Then Lamech said to his wives, Ada and Sella: "Hear my voice, wives of Lamech; listen to my speech. For I have killed a man who wounded me, and a young man who bruised me."

verses.latin: Septuplum ultio dabitur de Cain: de Lamech vero septuagies septies.
verses.english: If vengeance for Cain was sevenfold, then for Lamech it will be seventy-sevenfold.

verses.latin: Cognovit adhuc Adam uxorem suam: et peperit filium, vocavitque nomen ejus Seth, dicens: Posuit mihi Deus semen aliud pro Abel, quem occidit Cain.
verses.english: Adam knew his wife again, and she gave birth to a son and named him Seth, saying, "God has appointed for me another child in place of Abel, whom Cain murdered."

verses.latin: Sed et Seth natus est filius, quem vocavit Enos: hic cœpit invocare nomen Domini.
verses.english: To Seth also a son was born, whom he named Enos. It was then that people began to invoke the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Hic est liber generationis Adam. In die qua creavit Deus hominem, ad similitudinem Dei fecit illum.
verses.english: This is the record of Adam's lineage. At the time when God created mankind, He made him in God's own likeness.

verses.latin: Masculum et feminam creavit eos: et benedixit illis, et appellavit nomen eorum Adam, in die qua creati sunt.
verses.english: He created them as male and female. He blessed them, and He called their collective name 'Mankind' (Adam), at the time they were created.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Adam centum triginta annis, et genuit ad imaginem et similitudinem suam, et appellavit nomen ejus Seth.
verses.english: Adam lived for one hundred and thirty years, and then he begot a son in his own image and likeness, whom he named Seth.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt dies Adam, postquam genuit Seth, octingenti anni: et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Seth, Adam lived for eight hundred more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Adam, quos vixit, nongenti triginta anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Adam lived for a total of nine hundred and thirty years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit quoque Seth centum quinque annis, et genuit Enos.
verses.english: Seth also lived for one hundred and five years, and then he begot Enos.

verses.latin: Vixitque Seth postquam genuit Enos, octingentis septem annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Enos, Seth lived for eight hundred and seven more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Seth, nongenti duodecim anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Seth lived for a total of nine hundred and twelve years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Enos nonaginta annis, et genuit Cainan.
verses.english: Enos lived for ninety years, and then he begot Cainan.

verses.latin: Vixitque Enos postquam genuit Cainan, octingentis quindecim annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Cainan, Enos lived for eight hundred and fifteen more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Enos, nongenti quinque anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Enos lived for a total of nine hundred and five years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Cainan septuaginta annis, et genuit Malaleel.
verses.english: Cainan lived for seventy years, and then he begot Malaleel.

verses.latin: Vixitque Cainan postquam genuit Malaleel, octingentis quadraginta annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Malaleel, Cainan lived for eight hundred and forty more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Cainan, nongenti decem anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Cainan lived for a total of nine hundred and ten years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Malaleel sexaginta quinque annis, et genuit Jared.
verses.english: Malaleel lived for sixty-five years, and then he begot Jared.

verses.latin: Et vixit Malaleel postquam genuit Jared, octingentis triginta annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Jared, Malaleel lived for eight hundred and thirty more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Malaleel, octingenti nonaginta quinque anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Malaleel lived for a total of eight hundred and ninety-five years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit quoque Jared centum sexaginta duobus annis, et genuit Enoch.
verses.english: Jared also lived for one hundred and sixty-two years, and then he begot Enoch.

verses.latin: Et vixit Jared postquam genuit Enoch, octingentis annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Enoch, Jared lived for eight hundred more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Jared, nongenti sexaginta duo anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Jared lived for a total of nine hundred and sixty-two years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Enoch sexaginta quinque annis, et genuit Mathusalem.
verses.english: Enoch lived for sixty-five years, and then he begot Methuselah.

verses.latin: Et ambulavit Enoch cum Deo: et vixit Enoch postquam genuit Mathusalem, trecentis annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: And Enoch walked closely with God. After he begot Methuselah, Enoch lived for three hundred more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Enoch, trecenti sexaginta quinque anni.
verses.english: Enoch lived for a total of three hundred and sixty-five years.

verses.latin: Et ambulavit Enoch cum Deo, et non apparuit: quia tulit illum Deus.
verses.english: Enoch continued to walk closely with God, and then he was no longer seen, because God took him from the earth.

verses.latin: Vixit quoque Mathusalem centum octoginta septem annis, et genuit Lamech.
verses.english: Methuselah also lived for one hundred and eighty-seven years, and then he begot Lamech.

verses.latin: Et vixit Mathusalem postquam genuit Lamech, septingentis octoginta duobus annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Lamech, Methuselah lived for seven hundred and eighty-two more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Mathusalem, nongenti sexaginta novem anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Methuselah lived for a total of nine hundred and sixty-nine years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Lamech centum octoginta duobus annis, et genuit filium:
verses.english: Lamech lived for one hundred and eighty-two years, and then he begot a son.

verses.latin: Et appellavit nomen ejus Noe, dicens: Iste consolabitur nos ab operibus et laboribus nostris in terra, quam maledixit Dominus.
verses.english: He named the boy Noah, saying, 'This son will bring us comfort from our toil and from the hard labor of our hands, which comes from the earth that the Lord God has cursed.'

verses.latin: Vixitque Lamech postquam genuit Noe, quingentis nonaginta quinque annis, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After he begot Noah, Lamech lived for five hundred and ninety-five more years, during which time he also begot other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt omnes dies Lamech, septingenti septuaginta septem anni: et mortuus est.
verses.english: Lamech lived for a total of seven hundred and seventy-seven years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Noe cum quingentorum annorum fuisset, genuit Sem, Cham, et Japheth.
verses.english: When Noah was five hundred years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.latin: Cumque coepissent homines multiplicari super terram, et filias procreassent,
verses.english: And when human beings began to multiply on the earth, and they had given birth to daughters,

verses.latin: videntes filii Dei filias hominum quod essent pulchræ, acceperunt sibi uxores ex omnibus quas elegerant.
verses.english: the sons of God saw that the daughters of men were beautiful, and they chose wives for themselves from all of them whom they desired.

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus: Non permanebit spiritus meus in homine in æternum, quia caro est: et erunt dies illius centum viginti annorum.
verses.english: And God said, "My Spirit will not always strive within man, because man is merely flesh. Therefore, his days will be limited to one hundred and twenty years."

verses.latin: Gigantes autem erant super terram in diebus illis: et postquam ingressi sunt filii Dei ad filias hominum, illæque genuerunt, isti sunt potentes a sæculo viri famosi.
verses.english: Now, giants were on the earth in those days—and even after—when the sons of God had relations with the daughters of men, and they bore children. These were the mighty ones of ancient times, men of renown and fame.

verses.latin: Videns autem Deus quod multa malitia hominum esset in terra, et cuncta cogitatio cordis intenta esset ad malum omni tempore:
verses.english: But God saw that the wickedness of man was great on the earth, and that every intention of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually and without ceasing.

verses.latin: Tædæque eum pænituit quod hominem fecisset in terra. Et tactus dolore cordis intrinsecus,
verses.english: And God regretted that He had made man on the earth. He was grieved in His heart by man's evil.

verses.latin: delebo, inquit, hominem, quem creavi, a facie terræ, ab homine usque ad animantia, a reptili usque ad volucres cæli: pænitet enim me fecisse eos.
verses.english: God said, "I will blot out man whom I have created from the face of the earth—from man to beast, from creeping thing to the birds of the sky—for I regret that I have made them."

verses.latin: Noe vero invenit gratiam coram Domino.
verses.english: But Noah found grace and favor in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt generationes Noe: Noe vir justus atque perfectus fuit in generationibus suis, cum Deo ambulavit.
verses.english: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man, blameless and upright in his generations; Noah walked with God.

verses.latin: Genuitque tres filios, Sem, Cham et Japheth.
verses.english: And Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.latin: Corrupta est autem terra coram Deo: et repleta est iniquitate.
verses.english: The earth, however, was corrupt before God; the earth was filled with iniquity and violence.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Deus terram esse corruptam (omnis quippe caro corruperat viam suam super terram),
verses.english: When God saw that the earth was corrupted (for all flesh had corrupted its way upon the earth—their moral path was depraved),

verses.latin: dixit ad Noe: Finis universæ carnis venit coram me: eo quod repleta sit terra iniquitate a facie eorum: et ego disperdam eos cum terra.
verses.english: God said to Noah, "The end of all flesh has come before me; for the earth is filled with iniquity and violence because of them. And behold, I will destroy them with the earth."

verses.latin: Fac tibi arcam de lignis lævigatis: mansiunculas in arca facies, et bitumine linies intrinsecus et extrinsecus.
verses.english: Make yourself an ark of smooth, polished gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ark, and you shall pitch it with asphalt inside and out to make it watertight.

verses.latin: Et sic facies eam: trecentorum cubitorum erit longitudo arcæ, quinquaginta cubitorum latitudo, et triginta cubitorum altitudo illius.
verses.english: And this is how you shall make it: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits. (A cubit is approximately 18 inches, so about 450 feet long, 75 feet wide, 45 feet high).

verses.latin: Fenestram in arca facies, et in cubito consummabis summitatem ostii: ostium vero arcæ pones ex latere: tabulata in ea facies inferiora, secunda et tertia.
verses.english: You shall make a window for the ark, and you shall finish it to a cubit above; and the door of the ark you shall set in its side. You shall make lower, second, and third decks in it.

verses.latin: Ecce ego inducam aquas diluvii super terram, ut interficiam omnem carnem, in qua spiritus vitæ est subter cælum, universa quæ in terra sunt morientur.
verses.english: For behold, I, myself, am bringing a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh in which is the spirit of life from under the sky. Everything that is on the earth shall die.

verses.latin: Tecum autem firmabo pactum meum: et ingredieris arcam tu et filii tui, uxor tua et uxores filiorum tuorum tecum.
verses.english: But I will establish My covenant with you; and you shall go into the ark, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons' wives with you.

verses.latin: Et ex cunctis animantibus universæ carnis bina facies intra arcam, ut vivant tecum: masculini sexus et feminini erunt.
verses.english: And from every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ark, to keep them alive with you; they shall be male and female.

verses.latin: De volucribus secundum genus suum, et de jumentis in genere suo, et de omni reptili terræ juxta genus suum: bina de omnibus ingredientur tecum, ut possint vivere.
verses.english: Of birds after their kind, and of livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after its kind, two of every sort shall come to you, so they may live.

verses.latin: Tolle igitur tecum ex omnibus escis, quæ mandi possunt, et sic comportabis in navi: et erunt tam tibi, quam illis in cibum.
verses.english: And you shall take for yourself every sort of food that is eaten, and you shall gather it into the ark. And it shall be food for you and for them.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Noe omnia quæ præceperat illi Deus.
verses.english: Thus Noah did; according to all that God had commanded him, so he did.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Ingredere tu et omnis domus tua in arcam: te enim vidi justum coram me in generatione hac.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Noah, saying, "Go into the ark, you and your whole household. I have seen that you are righteous before me in this generation."

verses.latin: Ex omnibus animantibus mundis tolle septena, masculum et feminam: de animantibus vero immundis duo, masculum et feminam.
verses.english: "From all of the clean animals, take seven pairs—a male and a female of each. But from the unclean animals, take only two—one male and one female of each."

verses.latin: Sed et de volucribus caeli septena, masculum et feminam, ut salvetur semen super faciem universae terrae.
verses.english: "And from the birds of the sky, take seven pairs of each, a male and a female. This is so that their offspring may be preserved on the face of the entire earth after the flood."

verses.latin: Adhuc enim et post dies septem ego pluam super terram quadraginta diebus et quadraginta noctibus: et delebo omnem substantiam quam feci de superficie terrae.
verses.english: "For in exactly seven days, I will send rain upon the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will then wipe out every living thing that I have made from the face of the earth."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Noë omnia quae praeceperat illi Dominus.
verses.english: So Noah did everything that the Lord had commanded him to do.

verses.latin: Eratque sexcentorum annorum quando aquae diluvii inundaverunt super terram.
verses.english: Noah was six hundred years old when the floodwaters began to swell over the earth.

verses.latin: Ingressus est autem Noë et filii ejus, uxor ejus et uxores filiorum ejus cum eo in arcam propter aquas diluvii.
verses.english: Noah entered the ark because of the floodwaters. His sons, his wife, and his sons' wives also entered with him.

verses.latin: De animantibus quoque mundis et immundis, et de volucribus, et de cunctis quae moventur super terram,
verses.english: All the animals, both clean and unclean, and all the birds, and all the creeping creatures that move upon the earth—

verses.latin: duo et duo ingressa sunt ad Noë in arcam, masculum et feminam, sicut praeceperat Dominus Noë.
verses.english: —they entered the ark with Noah, two by two, a male and a female of each, just as the Lord had commanded Noah.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent septem dies, aquae diluvii inundaverunt super terram.
verses.english: After the seven days had passed, the floodwaters began to swell over the earth.

verses.latin: Anno sexcentesimo vitae Noë, mense secundo, septima decima die mensis, rupti sunt omnes fontes abyssi magnae, et cataractae caeli apertae sunt:
verses.english: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, on the seventeenth day of the second month of that year, all the subterranean fountains of the great deep burst forth. At the same time, the floodgates of the sky were opened wide.

verses.latin: et facta est pluvia super terram quadraginta diebus et quadraginta noctibus.
verses.english: And heavy rain fell upon the earth for forty days and forty nights without stopping.

verses.latin: In ipso die ingressus est Noë, Sem, Cham et Japheth filii ejus, uxor illius, et tres uxores filiorum ejus cum eis in arcam.
verses.english: On that same day, Noah, and his sons Shem, Ham, and Japheth, along with Noah's wife and his three daughters-in-law, all entered the ark.

verses.latin: Ipsi et omne animal juxta genus suum, et omne jumentum in genere suo, et omne quod movetur super terram in genere suo, cunctumque volucre secundum genus suum, universi aves, omnesque volucres.
verses.english: With them went every kind of wild animal, every kind of domestic animal, every kind of creeping creature that moves on the earth, and every kind of bird and winged creature—all of them according to their own species.

verses.latin: Ingressae sunt ad Noë in arcam, bina et bina ex omni carne, in qua erat spiritus vitae.
verses.english: They entered the ark with Noah, two by two, from every living creature that had the breath of life in it.

verses.latin: Et quae ingressae sunt, masculus et femina ex omni carne introierunt, sicut praeceperat ei Dominus: et clausit Dominus post eum janua.
verses.english: Those that entered were male and female from every kind of living creature, just as the Lord had commanded Noah. Then the Lord himself shut the door securely behind Noah.

verses.latin: Factumque est diluvium quadraginta diebus super terram: et multiplicatae sunt aquae, et elevaverunt arcam in altum a terra.
verses.english: The flood continued for forty days upon the earth. The waters swelled, lifting the ark high, so it was raised up from the ground.

verses.latin: Vehementerque invaluerunt, et impleverunt omnia in superficie terrae: arca vero ferebatur super aquas.
verses.english: The waters became exceedingly mighty and covered everything on the surface of the earth. But the ark floated securely on the surface of the waters.

verses.latin: Et aquae praevaluerunt nimis super terram: opertique sunt omnes montes excelsi sub universo caelo.
verses.english: The waters prevailed with extreme might over the earth. All the high mountains that were under the entire sky were completely covered by the flood.

verses.latin: Quindecim cubitis altior fuit aqua super montes, quos operuerat.
verses.english: The water rose fifteen cubits (about twenty-two feet) above the highest mountains, completely submerging them.

verses.latin: Consumptaque est omnis caro quae movebatur super terram, volucrum, animantium, bestiarum, omniumque reptilium quae reptant super terram, et universi homines.
verses.english: Every living creature that moved on the earth perished: all birds, all wild animals, all domestic beasts, all creeping creatures that crawled on the earth, and all mankind.

verses.latin: Et cuncta in quibus spiraculum vitae est in terra, mortua sunt.
verses.english: Everything on dry land that had the breath of life in its nostrils died.

verses.latin: Et delevit omnem substantiam quae erat super terram, ab homine usque ad pecus, tam reptilia quam volucres caeli: et deleta sunt de terra. Remansit vero solus Noë, et qui cum eo erant in arca.
verses.english: God wiped out every living thing that was on the surface of the earth, from man to domestic animal, and all creeping creatures, and all birds of the sky. They were all utterly destroyed from the earth. Only Noah remained alive, along with those who were with him in the ark.

verses.latin: Obtinueruntque aquae terram centum quinquaginta diebus.
verses.english: The waters covered the earth and remained at their height for one hundred and fifty days.

verses.latin: Recordatus autem Dominus Noe, et omnium animantium, et universorum jumentorum, quae erant cum eo in arca: adduxit spiritum super terram, et imminutae sunt aquae.
verses.english: But the Lord took Noah and all the living creatures and all the cattle that were with him in the ark to heart. He sent a powerful wind across the earth, and the floodwaters began to recede.

verses.latin: Et clausi sunt fontes abyssi, et cataractae caeli: et prohibita est pluvia de caelo.
verses.english: And the underground springs that supplied the floodwaters were closed, and the floodgates of the sky were shut. The rain from the sky was stopped.

verses.latin: Reversaeque sunt aquae de terra euntes et redeuntes: et coeperunt minui post centum quinquaginta dies.
verses.english: The waters continued to recede from the earth, constantly flowing back and forth. After one hundred and fifty days, they began to significantly diminish.

verses.latin: Et requievit arca mense septimo, vigesima septima die mensis, super montes Armeniae.
verses.english: And in the seventh month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat (which are in Armenia).

verses.latin: At vero aquae ibant et decrescebant usque ad decimum mensem: decimo enim mense, prima die mensis, apparuerunt cacumina montium.
verses.english: However, the waters continued to recede and diminish until the tenth month. On the first day of the tenth month, the tops of the mountains became visible.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent quadraginta dies, aperiens Noe fenestram arcae, quam fecerat, dimisit corvum.
verses.english: And it happened that after forty days had passed, Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made, and he released a raven.

verses.latin: Qui egrediebatur et non revertebatur, donec siccaretur aquae super terram.
verses.english: The raven flew out and did not return to the ark, as it waited for the waters upon the earth to dry completely.

verses.latin: Emisit quoque columbam post eum, ut videret si jam cessassent aquae super faciem terrae.
verses.english: Then Noah also sent out a dove after the raven, to see if the waters had subsided from the surface of the earth.

verses.latin: Quae cum non invenisset ubi requiesceret pes ejus, reversa est ad eum in arcam: eo quod aquae essent super universam terram: extenditque manum, et apprehensam intulit in arcam.
verses.english: But the dove could not find any place to rest its foot, because the waters still covered the entire surface of the earth. So it returned to Noah in the ark. Noah reached out his hand, took the dove, and brought it back inside the ark.

verses.latin: Expectavitque nihilominus septem alios dies: et rursum dimisit columbam ex arca.
verses.english: Noah waited for seven more days, and again he released the dove from the ark.

verses.latin: At illa venit ad eum ad vesperam, portans ramum olivae virentibus foliis in ore suo: intellexit ergo Noe quod jam cessassent aquae super terram.
verses.english: And the dove came back to him in the evening, carrying a fresh olive branch with green leaves in its beak. So Noah understood that the waters had finally receded from the earth.

verses.latin: Expectavitque nihilominus septem alios dies: et emisit columbam, quae non est reversa ultra ad illum.
verses.english: Noah waited for seven more days, and then he released the dove again. This time, it did not return to him.

verses.latin: Igitur sexcentesimo primo anno, primo mense, prima die mensis, imminutae sunt aquae super terram: et aperiens Noe tectum arcae, aspexit, et vidit quod siccata esset superficies terrae.
verses.english: Therefore, in the six hundred and first year of Noah's life, in the first month, on the first day of that month, the waters had receded from the earth. Noah opened the covering of the ark, looked out, and saw that the surface of the land was dry.

verses.latin: Mense secundo, septima et vigesima die mensis, arefacta est terra.
verses.english: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the entire earth was dry.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Deus ad Noe, dicens:
verses.english: Then God spoke to Noah, saying:

verses.latin: Egredere de arca tu et uxor tua, filii tui et uxores filiorum tuorum tecum.
verses.english: 'Come out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and your sons' wives with you.

verses.latin: Omnia animantia, quae sunt tecum ex omni carne, tam in volatilibus quam in jumentis et reptilibus, quae reptant super terram, educ tecum: et ingredimini super terram, et crescite, et multiplicamini super illam.
verses.english: 'Bring out with you all the living creatures that are with you, from every kind of flesh: the birds, the cattle, and all the creeping things that crawl upon the earth. Go forth onto the earth, and grow in number, and multiply upon it.'

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo Noe, et uxor sua, et filii ejus, et uxores filiorum ejus cum illo.
verses.english: So Noah went out, and his wife, and his sons, and his sons' wives with him.

verses.latin: Sed et omnia animantia, et universa reptilia, et universa volatilia, cunctaque quae moventur super terram, egressa sunt de arca per cognationes suas.
verses.english: And all the living creatures, all the creeping things, and all the birds, everything that moves upon the earth, came out of the ark according to their kinds.

verses.latin: Aedificavit autem Noe altare Domino: et tollens de cunctis pecoribus et volucribus mundis, obtulit holocausta super altare.
verses.english: Then Noah built an altar to the Lord. And taking from every clean animal and every clean bird, he offered burnt offerings on the altar.

verses.latin: Odoratusque est Dominus odorem suavitatis, et locutus est ad eum: Nequaquam ultra maledicam terrae propter homines: quia cogitatio et sensus humani cordis in malum prona sunt ab adolescentia sua: igitur non percutiam ultra omnem animam viventem, sicut feci.
verses.english: And the Lord smelled the pleasing aroma of the sacrifice, and He said in His heart: 'Never again will I curse the earth because of humans, for the intention and the inclination of the human heart are prone to evil from its youth. Therefore, I will never again strike down every living thing as I have done.

verses.latin: Cunctis diebus terrae, sementis et messis, frigus et calor, aestas et hiems, nox et dies non quiescent.
verses.english: 'For all the days the earth endures, planting and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, and day and night shall never cease.'

verses.latin: Benedixitque Deus Noe et filiis ejus, et dixit ad eos: Crescite et multiplicamini, et replete terram.
verses.english: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, "Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the entire earth."

verses.latin: Et terror vester ac tremor sit super cuncta animalia terræ, et super omnes volucres cæli, cum universis quæ moventur in terra: omnes pisces maris manui vestræ traditi sunt.
verses.english: And your powerful presence and authority shall be upon all the animals of the land, and upon all the birds of the sky, with all the creatures that move upon the earth; all the fish of the sea are now given into your control.

verses.latin: Et omne quod movetur et vivit, erit vobis in cibum: quasi holera ligni dedi vobis omnia.
verses.english: Every moving, living thing will be food for you. Just as I gave you the green plants before the flood, I have now given you all these things to eat.

verses.latin: Excepta carne in sanguine, quam non comedetis.
verses.english: But you shall not eat the flesh of an animal with its blood still in it, because its life is in its blood.

verses.latin: Sanguinem enim animarum vestrarum requiram de manu cunctarum bestiarum, et de manu hominis, de manu viri et fratris ejus requiram animam hominis.
verses.english: For I will certainly demand an account for the blood that holds your life; I will demand it from every wild beast, and from the hand of man. Indeed, from the hand of every man and his brother, I will demand an account for the life of a human being.

verses.latin: Quicumque effuderit humanum sanguinem, fundetur sanguis illius: ad imaginem quippe Dei factus est homo.
verses.english: Whoever sheds human blood, his blood shall also be shed in return; for indeed, God made man in His own divine image and likeness.

verses.latin: Vos autem crescite et multiplicamini, et ingredimini super terram, et implemini ex ea.
verses.english: But as for you, be fruitful and multiply; spread out over the earth and fill it.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Deus ad Noe, et ad filios ejus cum eo, dicens:
verses.english: Then God spoke to Noah and to his sons who were with him, saying:

verses.latin: Ecce ego statuam pactum meum vobiscum, et cum semine vestro post vos:
verses.english: "Behold, I am now establishing my solemn covenant with you and with your descendants who will come after you."

verses.latin: Et ad omnem animam viventem quæ est vobiscum, tam in volucribus quam in jumentis et in omni bestia terræ vobiscum, cunctis quæ egresse sunt de arca, et universis animantibus terræ.
verses.english: "And with every living creature that is with you—the birds, the livestock, and every wild beast of the earth that is with you—all that came out of the ark, and indeed, all the living creatures of the earth."

verses.latin: Statuam pactum meum vobiscum, et nequaquam ultra interficietur omnis caro aquarum diluvii, neque erit deinceps diluvium dissipans terram.
verses.english: "I establish my covenant with you: never again shall all living creatures be cut off by the waters of a flood; nor shall there ever again be a flood to destroy the entire earth."

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus: Hoc signum fœderis mei, quod do inter me et vos, et ad omnem animam viventem quæ est vobiscum in futuras generationes:
verses.english: And God said, "This is the sign of my solemn covenant, which I now give between me and you, and between me and every living creature that is with you, for all future generations:"

verses.latin: Arcum meum ponam in nubibus, et erit signum fœderis inter me et inter terram.
verses.english: "I will place my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be a sign of the covenant between me and the entire earth."

verses.latin: Cumque obduxero cælum nubibus, apparebit arcus meus in nubibus:
verses.english: "And whenever I bring clouds over the sky, my rainbow will appear in those clouds."

verses.latin: Et recordabor fœderis mei vobiscum, et cum omni anima vivente quæ carnem vegetat: et non erunt ultra aquæ diluvii ad delendum universam carnem.
verses.english: "And I will remember my covenant that is between me and you, and with every living creature that possesses life; never again shall the waters of a flood destroy all living creatures."

verses.latin: Erit igitur arcus in nubibus, et videbo illum, et recordabor fœderis sempiterni, quod initum est inter Deum et omnem animam viventem universæ carnis super terram.
verses.english: "So the rainbow will be in the clouds, and I will look at it and remember the everlasting covenant, which was established between God and every living creature of all flesh upon the earth."

verses.latin: Dixitque Deus ad Noe: Hoc erit signum fœderis, quod constitui inter me et omnem carnem super terram.
verses.english: And God said to Noah, "This is the sign of the covenant which I have established between me and all living creatures upon the entire earth."

verses.latin: Erant ergo filii Noe, qui egressi sunt de arca, Sem, Cham, et Japheth: Cham ipse est pater Chanaan.
verses.english: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the one who became the father of Canaan.

verses.latin: Tres isti sunt filii Noe: et ab his disseminata est omnis terra.
verses.english: These three are the sons of Noah, and from these three, the entire earth was populated.

verses.latin: Cœpitque Noe vir agricola exercere terram, et plantavit vineam.
verses.english: Noah, a farmer, was the first to cultivate the land and he planted a vineyard.

verses.latin: Bibensque vinum inebriatus est, et denudatus in tabernaculo suo.
verses.english: He drank some wine and became drunk, and was lying uncovered inside his tent.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset Cham pater Chanaan, verenda patris sui, nuntiavit duobus fratribus suis foras.
verses.english: And when Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father's nakedness, he went out and told his two brothers.

verses.latin: At vero Sem et Japheth pallium imposuerunt humeris suis, et incedentes retrorsum, operuerunt verenda patris sui: faciesque eorum aversæ erant, et patris virilia non viderunt.
verses.english: But Shem and Japheth took a cloak, laid it on both their shoulders, and walking backward, they covered their father's nakedness. Their faces were turned away so they did not see their father's nakedness.

verses.latin: Evigilans autem Noe a vino, cum didicisset quæ fecerat ei filius suus minor,
verses.english: When Noah awoke from his wine and learned what his younger son—Ham—had done to him,

verses.latin: Ait: Maledictus Chanaan, servus servorum erit fratribus suis.
verses.english: He said, "Cursed be Canaan! He shall be the lowest of servants to his brothers."

verses.latin: Dixitque: Benedictus Dominus Deus Sem, et erit Chanaan servus ejus.
verses.english: Then he said, "Blessed be the Lord God of Shem! And Canaan shall be his servant."

verses.latin: Dilatet Deus Japheth, et habitet in tabernaculis Sem, et sit Chanaan servus ejus.
verses.english: "May God enlarge Japheth, and may he dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall also be his servant."

verses.latin: Vixit autem Noe post diluvium trecentis quinquaginta annis.
verses.english: Noah lived for three hundred and fifty years after the great flood.

verses.latin: Et impleti sunt omnes dies ejus nongentorum quinquaginta annorum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: And all the days of Noah's life were nine hundred and fifty years; then he died.

verses.latin: Haec sunt generationes filiorum Noe, Sem, Cham, et Japheth: et nati sunt eis filii post diluvium.
verses.english: These are the descendants of Noah's sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Children were born to them after the great flood that reset humanity.

verses.latin: Filii Japheth: Gomer, et Magog, et Madai, et Javan, et Tubal, et Mosoch, et Thiras.
verses.english: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Mosoch, and Thiras.

verses.latin: Filii autem Gomer: Aschenez, et Riphath, et Thogorma.
verses.english: The sons of Gomer were Aschenez, Riphath, and Thogorma.

verses.latin: Filii autem Javan: Elisa, et Tharsis, Cetthim, et Dodanim.
verses.english: The sons of Javan were Elisa, Tharsis, Cetthim, and Dodanim.

verses.latin: Ab his divisae sunt insulae Gentium in terris suis, unusquisque secundum linguam suam et familias suas in nationibus suis.
verses.english: From these descendants, the peoples of the nations spread out to their own lands, each according to their language, their families, and their nations.

verses.latin: Filii Cham: Chus, et Mesraim, et Phuth, et Chanaan.
verses.english: The sons of Ham were Chus, Mesraim, Phuth, and Chanaan.

verses.latin: Filii autem Chus: Saba, et Hevila, et Sabatha, et Regma, et Sabatacha. Filii Regma: Saba, et Dadan.
verses.english: The sons of Chus were Saba, Hevila, Sabatha, Regma, and Sabatacha. The sons of Regma were Saba and Dadan.

verses.latin: Porro Chus genuit Nemrod: iste cœpit esse potens in terra.
verses.english: Furthermore, Chus was the father of Nemrod. This Nemrod began to be a mighty leader on the earth.

verses.latin: Et erat robustus venator coram Domino. Ob hoc dictum est proverbium: Quasi Nemrod robustus venator coram Domino.
verses.english: He was a powerful hunter, a great man in the sight of the Lord. For this reason, it became a saying: 'Like Nemrod, a powerful hunter in the sight of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Fuit autem principium regni ejus Babylon, et Arach, et Achad, et Chalanne in terra Sennaar.
verses.english: The beginning of his kingdom was Babylon, and Arach, and Achad, and Chalanne, in the land of Sennaar.

verses.latin: De terra illa egressus est Assur, et ædificavit Niniven, et plateas civitatis, et Calach,
verses.english: From that land, Assur went forth, and he built Ninive, and its city squares, and Calach.

verses.latin: Resen quoque inter Niniven et Calach: haec est civitas magna.
verses.english: He also built Resen, which is between Ninive and Calach. This is a great city.

verses.latin: At vero Mesraim genuit Ludim, et Anamim, et Laabim, Nephthuim,
verses.english: Indeed, Mesraim was the father of Ludim, Anamim, Laabim, and Nephthuim.

verses.latin: et Phetrusim, et Casluim: de quibus egressi sunt Philisthiim, et Caphtorim.
verses.english: And also Phetrusim and Casluim, from whom the Philisthiim and Caphtorim descended.

verses.latin: Chanaan vero genuit Sidonem primogenitum suum, Hethæum,
verses.english: And Chanaan was the father of Sidon, his firstborn son, and also Hethæum.

verses.latin: et Jebusæum, et Amorrhæum, Gergesæum,
verses.english: And also the Jebusæum, Amorrhæum, and Gergesæum.

verses.latin: Hevæum, et Aracæum, et Sinæum,
verses.english: Also the Hevæum, Aracæum, and Sinæum.

verses.latin: et Aradium, Samaræum, et Hamathæum: et post hæc disseminati sunt populi Chananæorum.
verses.english: And the Aradium, Samaræum, and Hamathæum. After this, the peoples of the Chananæans spread out.

verses.latin: Factique sunt termini Chanaan venientibus a Sidone Geraram usque Gazam, donec ingrediaris Sodomam et Gomorrham, et Adamam, et Seboim usque Lesa.
verses.english: The territory of Chanaan extended from Sidon, going towards Gerara as far as Gaza, and then to Sodom, Gomorrham, Adama, and Seboim, reaching as far as Lesa.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Cham in cognationibus, et linguis, et regionibus, et gentibus suis.
verses.english: These are the descendants of Ham, organized by their family groups, languages, regions, and nations.

verses.latin: De Sem quoque nati sunt, patre omnium filiorum Heber, fratre Japheth majoris.
verses.english: And children were also born to Shem, who was the father of all the descendants of Heber, and the elder brother of Japheth.

verses.latin: Filii Sem: Ælam, et Assur, et Arphaxad, et Lud, et Aram.
verses.english: The sons of Shem were Ælam, Assur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.

verses.latin: Filii Aram: Us, et Hul, et Gether, et Mes.
verses.english: The sons of Aram were Us, Hul, Gether, and Mes.

verses.latin: At vero Arphaxad genuit Sala, de quo Sala natus est Heber.
verses.english: Indeed, Arphaxad was the father of Sala, and from Sala, Heber was born.

verses.latin: Et Heber nati sunt duo filii: nomen uni Phaleg, eo quod in diebus ejus divisa sit terra: et nomen fratris ejus Jectan.
verses.english: To Heber, two sons were born. The name of one was Phaleg, because in his days the peoples of the earth were divided and spread out. And his brother's name was Jectan.

verses.latin: Qui Jectan genuit Elmodad, et Salaph, et Asarmoth, et Jare,
verses.english: This Jectan was the father of Elmodad, Salaph, Asarmoth, and Jare.

verses.latin: et Aduram, et Uzal, et Decla,
verses.english: And Aduram, Uzal, and Decla.

verses.latin: et Ebal, et Abimaël, et Saba,
verses.english: And Ebal, Abimaël, and Saba.

verses.latin: et Ophir, et Hevila, et Jobab: omnes isti filii Jectan.
verses.english: And Ophir, Hevila, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Jectan.

verses.latin: Et facta est habitatio eorum de Messa pergentibus usque Sephar, montem orientalem.
verses.english: Their dwelling place extended from Messa, as one travels towards Sephar, a mountain in the east.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Sem secundum cognationes, et linguas, et regiones in gentibus suis.
verses.english: These are the descendants of Shem, according to their family groups, languages, regions, and nations.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt familiæ Noe, juxta populos et nationes suas. Ab his divisae sunt gentes in terra post diluvium.
verses.english: These are the family groups descended from Noah, according to their peoples and nations. From these, the nations of the earth spread out and divided after the great flood.

verses.latin: Erat autem orbis terræ labii unius, et sermonum eorumdem.
verses.english: At that time, everyone on the whole earth spoke the same language, using the same words and expressions.

verses.latin: Cumque proficiscerentur de oriente, invenerunt campum in terra Sennaar, et habitaverunt in eo.
verses.english: As people migrated from the east, they discovered a vast plain in the land called Shinar and chose to settle there.

verses.latin: Dixitque alter ad proximum suum: Venite, faciamus lateres, et coquamus eos igni. Habueruntque lateres pro saxis, et bitumen pro cimento.
verses.english: Then people said to each other, 'Let us make bricks and burn them very thoroughly to make them strong.' They used these bricks instead of stones, and they used bitumen, a natural asphalt, as their mortar.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Venite, faciamus nobis civitatem, et turrim cujus culmen pertingat ad cælum: et celebremus nomen nostrum antequam dividamur in universas terras.
verses.english: They also said, 'Come, let us build a great city for ourselves, and a tower that reaches so high it seems to touch the sky. This will establish our name and legacy, preventing us from being scattered across the face of the whole world.'

verses.latin: Descendit autem Dominus ut videret civitatem, et turrim quam ædificabant filii Adam.
verses.english: But then the Lord came down from His sublime dwelling —not because He needed to, but to observe the city and the tower that the children of Adam were building.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Ecce unus est populus, et unum labium omnibus: et hoc cœperunt facere, nec desistent a cogitationibus suis, donec eas opere compleant.
verses.english: And the Lord said, 'See, they are one people, and they all speak a single language. This is only the beginning of what they plan to do; they will not stop pursuing their intentions until they have achieved them through their actions.'

verses.latin: Venite igitur, descendamus, et confundamus ibi linguam eorum, ut non intelligat unusquisque vocem proximi sui.
verses.english: Then He said, 'Come, let Us —the Holy Trinity— descend and there confuse their language, so that no one will be able to understand what his neighbor is saying.'

verses.latin: Atque ita divisit eos Dominus ex illo loco in universas terras: et cessaverunt ædificare civitatem.
verses.english: And in this way, the Lord scattered them from that place across the face of the whole earth. Because of this, they stopped building the city.

verses.latin: Et idcirco vocatum est nomen ejus Babel, quia ibi confusum est labium universæ terræ: et inde dispersit eos Dominus super faciem cunctarum regionum.
verses.english: That is why the place was called Babel —meaning 'confusion'— because there the Lord confused the language of the entire world. From that place, the Lord scattered them across the face of all the regions of the earth.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt generationes Sem: Sem centum annorum erat quando genuit Arphaxad, biennio post diluvium.
verses.english: These are the descendants of Shem. Shem was one hundred years old when his son Arphaxad was born, two years after the great flood.

verses.latin: Et vixit Sem, postquam genuit Arphaxad, quingentos annos: genuitque filios et filias.
verses.english: After Arphaxad was born, Shem lived for another five hundred years, and during this time, he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Arphaxad quoque vixit triginta quinque annis, et genuit Sala.
verses.english: Arphaxad lived for thirty-five years, and then he became the father of Sala.

verses.latin: Vixitque Arphaxad, postquam genuit Sala, trecentos tres annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Sala was born, Arphaxad lived for another three hundred and three years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Sala quoque vixit triginta annis, et genuit Heber.
verses.english: Sala lived for thirty years, and then he became the father of Heber.

verses.latin: Vixitque Sala, postquam genuit Heber, quadringentos tres annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Heber was born, Sala lived for another four hundred and three years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Heber quoque vixit triginta quatuor annis, et genuit Phaleg.
verses.english: Heber lived for thirty-four years, and then he became the father of Peleg.

verses.latin: Vixitque Heber, postquam genuit Phaleg, quadringentos triginta annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Peleg was born, Heber lived for another four hundred and thirty years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Phaleg quoque vixit triginta annis, et genuit Ragau.
verses.english: Peleg lived for thirty years, and then he became the father of Reu.

verses.latin: Vixitque Phaleg, postquam genuit Ragau, ducentos novem annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Reu was born, Peleg lived for another two hundred and nine years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Ragau quoque vixit triginta duo annis, et genuit Sarug.
verses.english: Reu lived for thirty-two years, and then he became the father of Serug.

verses.latin: Vixitque Ragau, postquam genuit Sarug, ducentos septem annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Serug was born, Reu lived for another two hundred and seven years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Sarug quoque vixit triginta annis, et genuit Nachor.
verses.english: Serug lived for thirty years, and then he became the father of Nahor.

verses.latin: Vixitque Sarug, postquam genuit Nachor, ducentos annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Nahor was born, Serug lived for another two hundred years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Nachor quoque vixit viginti novem annis, et genuit Thare.
verses.english: Nahor lived for twenty-nine years, and then he became the father of Terah.

verses.latin: Vixitque Nachor, postquam genuit Thare, centum decem et novem annos, et genuit filios et filias.
verses.english: After Terah was born, Nahor lived for another one hundred and nineteen years, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Thare quoque vixit septuaginta annis, et genuit Abram, et Nachor, et Aran.
verses.english: Terah lived for seventy years, and then he became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt autem generationes Thare: Thare genuit Abram, Nachor, et Aran. Porro Aran genuit Loth.
verses.english: Now, these are the descendants of Terah. Terah was the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. And Haran became the father of Lot.

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem Aran, ante patrem suum Thare, in terra nativitatis suæ, in Ur Chaldæorum.
verses.english: However, Haran died in the land where he was born, in Ur of the Chaldeans, while his father Terah was still alive.

verses.latin: Duxerunt autem Abram et Nachor uxores: nomen uxoris Abram, Sarai: et nomen uxoris Nachor, Melcha, filia Aran patris Melchæ, et patris Jeschæ.
verses.english: Abram and Nahor both took wives. Abram’s wife was named Sarai. Nahor’s wife was named Milcah, who was the daughter of Haran —meaning Milcah was also Haran's daughter, and the sister of Iscah.

verses.latin: Fuit autem Sarai sterilis, nec habebat liberos.
verses.english: However, Sarai was infertile and unable to have children.

verses.latin: Tulit itaque Thare Abram filium suum, et Loth filium Aran, filium filii sui, et Sarai nurum suam, uxorem Abram filii sui, et eduxit eos de Ur Chaldæorum, ut irent in terram Chanaan: veneruntque usque Haran, et habitaverunt ibi.
verses.english: So Terah gathered his son Abram, and his grandson Lot —who was Haran's son— and his daughter-in-law Sarai, who was Abram's wife. He led them out of Ur of the Chaldeans, intending to travel to the land of Canaan. But when they reached a place called Haran, they settled there instead.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt dies Thare ducentorum quinque annorum, et mortuus est Thare in Haran.
verses.english: Terah lived for a total of two hundred and five years, and he died in Haran.

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus ad Abram: Egredere de terra tua, et de cognatione tua, et de domo patris tui, et veni in terram quam monstravero tibi.
verses.english: The Lord said to Abram, "Go out from your country, and away from your relatives, and away from your father's household. Come instead into the land that I will show you."

verses.latin: Faciamque te in gentem magnam, et benedicam tibi, et magnificabo nomen tuum, et eris benedictus.
verses.english: "I will make you into a great nation, and I will bless you, and I will make your name great, and you will be a blessing for others."

verses.latin: Benedicam benedicentibus tibi, et maledicam maledicentibus tibi: et in te benedicentur universae cognationes terrae.
verses.english: "I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse those who curse you. Through you, all the families of the earth will receive blessings."

verses.latin: Egressus est itaque Abram sicut praeceperat ei Dominus, et abiit cum eo Lot. Septuaginta quinque annorum erat Abram cum egrederetur de Haran.
verses.english: So Abram immediately went out just as the Lord had commanded him; Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he went out from Haran, ready to begin his journey of faith.

verses.latin: Tulit quoque Abram Sarai uxorem suam, et Lot filium fratris sui, universamque substantiam quam possederant, et animas quas fecerant in Haran: et egressi sunt ut irent in terram Chanaan. Cumque venissent in terram Chanaan,
