verses.english: Abram also took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their possessions which they had acquired, and all the people they had gained while in Haran. They set out to go into the land of Canaan. And when they came into the land of Canaan,

verses.latin: pertransivit Abram terram usque ad locum Sichem, usque ad convallem illustrem: Chananaeus autem tunc habitabat in terra.
verses.english: Abram passed through the land as far as the place called Shechem, to the prominent valley. At that time, the Canaanites were living in that land, presenting an initial challenge for Abram.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem Dominus Abram, et dixit ei: Semini tuo dabo terram hanc. Qui aedificavit ibi altare Domino, qui apparuerat ei.
verses.english: Then the Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, "I will give this very land to your descendants." So Abram, in an act of worship and thanksgiving, built an altar there to the Lord, who had appeared to him.

verses.latin: Et inde transgrediens ad montem, qui erat contra orientalem plagam Bethel, tetendit ibi tabernaculum suum, ab occidente habens Bethel, et ab oriente Ai. Aedificavit quoque ibi altare Domino, et invocavit nomen Domini.
verses.english: From there, he moved on to the mountain which was to the east of Bethel. He pitched his tent there, having the city of Bethel on his west and the city of Ai on his east. He also built another altar there to the Lord and called upon the name of the Lord, continuing his journey of faith and worship.

verses.latin: Profectusque est Abram ultra, et ibat per loca meridiana.
verses.english: And Abram journeyed further, continuing to move toward the southern regions of the land.

verses.latin: Facta est autem fames in terra: descenditque Abram in Aegyptum, ut peregrinaretur ibi: praevaluerat enim fames in terra.
verses.english: However, a severe famine occurred in the land where Abram was. So Abram went down into Egypt to reside there as a foreigner, for the famine in the land had become extremely severe.

verses.latin: Cumque jam ingrederetur Aegyptum, dixit Sarai uxori suae: Novi quod pulchra sis mulier,
verses.english: When he was about to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, "I know that you are a very beautiful woman."

verses.latin: et quod cum te viderint Aegyptii, dicturi sunt: Uxor ipsius est: et interficient me, et te reservabunt.
verses.english: "When the Egyptians see you, they will surely say, 'She is his wife.' Then they will kill me to take you, but they will spare your life."

verses.latin: Dic ergo, obsecro te, quod soror mea sis: ut bene sit mihi propter te, et vivat anima mea ob gratiam tui.
verses.english: "Please say that you are my sister, so that it may go well with me because of you, and that my life may be spared on account of your beauty."

verses.latin: Cum itaque ingressus esset Abram Aegyptum, viderunt Aegyptii mulierem quod esset pulchra nimis.
verses.english: So when Abram had entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was exceedingly beautiful, just as Abram had feared.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt principes Pharaoni, et laudaverunt eam apud illum: et sublata est mulier in domum Pharaonis.
verses.english: And the princes of Pharaoh saw her and praised her to Pharaoh. Then the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house, an act which would later bring divine judgment.

verses.latin: Egiusque bene pro Abram ob illam. Fueruntque ei oves, et boves, et asini, et servi, et ancillae, et cameli.
verses.english: And because of Sarai, Pharaoh treated Abram well. Abram received sheep, oxen, male donkeys, menservants, maidservants, and camels, enriching him greatly.

verses.latin: Flagellavit autem Dominus Pharaonem plagis maximis, et domum ejus propter Sarai uxorem Abram.
verses.english: But the Lord, in His divine intervention, struck Pharaoh and his entire household with severe plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife, revealing her true relationship to Abram.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Pharao Abram, et dixit ei: Quidnam est hoc quod fecisti mihi? Quare non indicasti mihi quod uxor tua esset?
verses.english: So Pharaoh called Abram and, angered by the deception, said, "What is this you have done to me? Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?"

verses.latin: Quam ob rem dixisti, soror mea est, ut tollerem eam mihi in uxorem? Nunc igitur ecce conjux tua est, accipe eam, et vade.
verses.english: "Why did you say, 'She is my sister,' leading me to take her as my wife? Now, here is your wife. Take her and go, leave my land!"

verses.latin: Praecepitque Pharao super Abram viris: et deduxerunt eum, et uxorem ejus, et omnia quae habebat.
verses.english: And Pharaoh gave orders to his men concerning Abram, and they escorted him out, along with his wife and all that he had acquired while in Egypt.

verses.latin: Igitur ascendit Abram de Aegypto ipse et uxor ejus et omnia quae habebat et Loth cum eo in australem plagam.
verses.english: So Abram went up from Egypt, with his wife and all their possessions. Lot also went with him to the southern region.

verses.latin: Erat autem dives valde in possessione auri et argenti et jumentorum.
verses.english: Now Abram was very rich with gold, silver, and many livestock.

verses.latin: Reversusque est per iter quo venerat a meridie usque ad locum Bethel ubi prius fixerat tabernaculum inter Bethel et Ai.
verses.english: He returned by the same route he had taken from the south, all the way to Bethel, to the place where he had first pitched his tent between Bethel and Ai.

verses.latin: In loco altaris quem fecerat prius et invocavit ibi nomen Domini.
verses.english: It was where he had built an altar earlier, and there Abram worshipped the Lord, invoking His name.

verses.latin: Sed et Loth qui cum Abram erat habebat pecora et tentoria et boves.
verses.english: However, Lot, who was traveling with Abram, also had his own flocks, tents, and herds.

verses.latin: Nec poterat eos capere terra ut simul habitarent erat quippe substantia eorum multa et non poterant simul habitare.
verses.english: The land could not sustain them living together, because their possessions were so many that they could not dwell in the same area.

verses.latin: Unde et facta est rixa inter pastores gregum Abram et pastores gregum Loth: eo tempore Cananaeus et Pherezaeus habitabant in terra.
verses.english: This led to a quarrel between Abram’s herdsmen and Lot’s herdsmen. At that time, the Canaanites and the Perizzites also inhabited the land.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Abram ad Loth ne sit quaeso jurgium inter me et te et inter pastores meos et pastores tuos fratres enim sumus.
verses.english: So Abram said to Lot, “Please, let there be no quarreling between you and me, nor between my herdsmen and your herdsmen, for we are brothers.”

verses.latin: Nonne universa terra coram te est recede a me obsecro si ad sinistram ieris ego ad dexteram ero si tu dexteram elegeris ego ad sinistram vadam.
verses.english: “Is not the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you choose the left, I will go to the right. If you choose the right, I will go to the left.”

verses.latin: Sublevatis itaque Loth oculis vidit omnem circa regionem Jordanis quae universa irrigabatur antequam subverteret Dominus Sodomam et Gomorram sicut paradisus Domini et sicut Aegyptus venientibus in Segor.
verses.english: So Lot, raising his eyes, saw the entire region of the Jordan Plain, which was completely irrigated—this was before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah. It was like the Garden of the Lord, and like Egypt as you go toward Zoar.

verses.latin: Elegitque sibi Loth regionem Jordanis et recessit ab oriente et divisi sunt alterutrum ab altero.
verses.english: Therefore, Lot chose for himself the entire Jordan Plain, and he moved eastward, and they were separated from one another.

verses.latin: Abram habitavit in terra Chanaan Loth vero moratus est in oppidis quae erant circa Jordanem et tabernacula fixit usque ad Sodomam.
verses.english: Abram remained in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled in the cities near the Jordan and pitched his tents as far as Sodom.

verses.latin: Homines autem Sodomitae pessimi erant et peccatores ante Dominum nimis.
verses.english: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked, and they were great sinners against the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Abram postquam divisus est Loth ab eo Leva oculos tuos et vide a loco in quo nunc es ad aquilonem et meridiem ad orientem et occidentem.
verses.english: And after Lot had separated from him, the Lord said to Abram, “Lift your eyes and look from the place where you now are, to the north, to the south, to the east, and to the west.”

verses.latin: Omnem terram quam conspicis tibi dabo et semini tuo usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: “For all the land that you see, I will give to you and to your descendants forever.”

verses.latin: Et faciam semen tuum sicut pulverem terrae si quis potest hominum numerare pulverem terrae semen quoque tuum numerabit.
verses.english: “And I will make your descendants like the dust of the earth. If anyone can number the dust of the earth, then your descendants will also be numbered.”

verses.latin: Surge et perambula terram in longitudine et in latitudine sua quia tibi daturus sum eam.
verses.english: “Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its breadth, for I am about to give it to you.”

verses.latin: Movens igitur Abram tabernaculum suum venit et habitavit juxta convallem Mambre quae est in Hebron aedificavitque ibi altare Domino.
verses.english: So Abram moved his tent and came to dwell by the Oak of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and there he built an altar to the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus Amraphel regis Sennaar, et Arioch regis Ponti, et Chodorlahomor regis Elamitarum, et Thadal regis gentium,
verses.english: Now, it happened during the time of Amraphel, who was king of Sennaar; and Arioch, who was king of Pontus; and Chedorlaomer, who was king of the Elamites; and Tidal, who was king of nations—

verses.latin: congregati sunt omnes reges isti in vallem Silvestrem, quae nunc est Mare Salis.
verses.english: —all these kings gathered together in the Forest Valley, which is now known as the Salt Sea.

verses.latin: Omnes hi convenerunt in vallem Silvestrem, quae est Mare Salis.
verses.english: All of these rulers came together in the Forest Valley, which is the Salt Sea.

verses.latin: Duodecim annis servierant Chodorlahomor: et tertiodecimo anno rebellaverunt ei.
verses.english: For twelve years, these kings from the Forest Valley had served Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year, they rebelled against him.

verses.latin: Igitur quartodecimo anno venit Chodorlahomor, et reges qui cum eo erant: percusseruntque Raphaim in Astaroth Carnaim, et Zuzim cum eis, et Emim in Save Cariathaim,
verses.english: So, in the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer came with the kings who were allied with him. They attacked the Rephaim people in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzim people were with them, and also the Emim people in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

verses.latin: et Chorraeos in montibus Seir, usque ad campestria Pharan, quae est in solitudine.
verses.english: and they also attacked the Horite people in the mountains of Seir, extending all the way to the plains of Paran, which is in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Reversique venerunt ad fontem Misphat, quae est Cades: et percusserunt omnem regionem Amalecitarum, et Amorrhaeum qui habitabat in Asasonthamar.
verses.english: Then, turning back, they arrived at the spring of Misphat, which is also called Kadesh. There, they struck down all the territory of the Amalekite people, and also the Amorite people who were living in Hazazonthamar.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt rex Sodomorum, et rex Gomorrhae, et rex Adamae, et rex Seboim, et rex Balae, quae est Segor: et direxerunt adversus eos aciem in valle Silvestri,
verses.english: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela—which is also called Zoar—marched out. They arranged their battle lines against Chedorlaomer and his allies in the Forest Valley,

verses.latin: contra Chodorlahomor regem Elamitarum, et Thadal regem gentium, et Amraphel regem Sennaar, et Arioch regem Ponti: quatuor reges adversus quinque.
verses.english: —they were facing Chedorlaomer, king of the Elamites, Tidal, king of nations, Amraphel, king of Sennaar, and Arioch, king of Pontus. It was four kings against five.

verses.latin: Vallis autem Silvestris habebat puteos multos bituminis. Itaque rex Sodomorum et Gomorrhae terga verterunt, et ibi ceciderunt: qui vero reliqui erant, ad montem fugebant.
verses.english: The Forest Valley had many tar pits. So, the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and their soldiers fell into the pits. Those who remained alive ran away into the mountains.

verses.latin: Tuleruntque omnem substantiam Sodomorum et Gomorrhae, et universa quae ad cibum pertinent, et abierunt.
verses.english: The victorious kings took all the possessions of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their provisions of food, and then they left.

verses.latin: Tulerunt etiam Loth, et substantiam ejus de Sodomis, filium fratris Abram, et abierunt.
verses.english: They also took Lot, Abram's brother's son, and all his possessions from Sodom, and then they left.

verses.latin: Et ecce unus, qui evaserat, nuntiavit Abram Hebraeo, qui habitabat in valle Mambre Amorrhaei fratris Escol, et fratris Aner: hi enim erant foederati Abram.
verses.english: Then, one of the people who had escaped from the battle came and reported all this to Abram the Hebrew. Abram was living in the valley of Mamre the Amorite, who was a brother of Eshcol and a brother of Aner. These men, Mamre, Eshcol, and Aner, were allied with Abram.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Abram, captum videlicet Loth fratrem suum, numeravit expeditos vernaculos suos trecentos decem et octo: et persecutus est usque Dan.
verses.english: When Abram heard that his brother's son, Lot, had been captured, he immediately assembled his three hundred and eighteen trained servants, who had been born in his household. He then pursued the kings' army all the way to Dan.

verses.latin: Et divisis sociis, irruit super eos nocte: percussitque eos, et persecutus est eos usque Hoba, quae est ad levam Damasci.
verses.english: He divided his men into groups and attacked the enemy by night. He struck them down and pursued them all the way to Hobah, which is located to the north of Damascus.

verses.latin: Reduxitque omnem substantiam, et Loth fratrem suum cum substantia illius, uxores quoque et populum.
verses.english: Abram recovered all the captured possessions. He also brought back Lot, his nephew, along with Lot's possessions, and all the women and the people who had been taken captive.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem rex Sodomorum in occursum ejus, postquam reversus est a caede Chodorlahomor, et regum qui cum eo erant, in vallem Save, quae fuit vallis regum.
verses.english: After Abram returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him in the valley of Shaveh, which was known as the King's Valley.

verses.latin: At vero Melchisedech rex Salem, proferens panem et vinum, erat enim sacerdos Dei altissimi,
verses.english: But then, Melchizedek, who was king of Salem, and also a priest of God Most High, came out. He brought bread and wine for Abram.

verses.latin: benedixit ei, et ait: Benedictus Abram Deo excelso, qui creavit caelum et terram.
verses.english: He blessed Abram, saying, 'May Abram be blessed by God Most High, who created the universe and the earth!'

verses.latin: Et benedictus Deus excelsus, quo protegente, hostes tui in manibus tuis sunt. Dedique ei decimas ex omnibus.
verses.english: And blessed be God Most High, who protected you and delivered your enemies into your power!' And then Abram gave Melchizedek a tenth of all the spoils he had recovered.

verses.latin: Dixit autem rex Sodomorum ad Abram: Da mihi animas, caetera tolle tibi.
verses.english: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, 'Give me the people who were rescued, but you may keep all the remaining possessions for yourself.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Abram ad regem Sodomorum: Levo manum meam ad Dominum Deum excelsum, possessorem caeli et terrae,
verses.english: Abram replied to the king of Sodom, 'I raise my hand in an oath to the Lord God Most High, the One who possesses the universe and the earth—'

verses.latin: ne a filo quidem usque ad corrigiam caligae, aliquid ex omnibus quae tua sunt, tollam: ne dicas, Ego ditavi Abram:
verses.english: —I will not take anything that belongs to you, not even a single thread or a sandal strap. I do this so that you cannot say, 'I am the one who made Abram rich.'

verses.latin: Exceptis his, quae comederunt juvenes, et partibus virorum qui mecum venerunt, Aner, Escol et Mambre: isti accipient partes suas.
verses.english: However, I will not take anything for myself, except for the food my young men have already eaten. But as for Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre, the men who came with me, they will certainly take their rightful share of the spoils.

verses.latin: His dictis factum est verbum Domini ad Abram per visionem dicens: Noli timere, Abram, ego protector tuus sum, et merces tua magna nimis.
verses.english: After these things, the Lord God spoke to Abram, appearing to him in a vision. He said: 'Do not be afraid, Abram, for I am your protector, and your reward will be exceedingly great.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Abram: Domine Deus, quid dabis mihi? Ego absque liberis ingredior, et filius procurator domus meae est iste Damascus Eliezer.
verses.english: Abram responded: 'Lord God, what can You give me? I am going on without an heir, and the one who manages my household, Eliezer of Damascus, is the only one who could inherit from me.'

verses.latin: Addiditque Abram: Mihi non dedisti semen, et ecce vernaculus meus haeres meus est.
verses.english: And Abram added: 'You have given me no children, and behold, a servant born in my house is now my heir.'

verses.latin: Statimque sermo Domini factus est ad eum dicens: Non erit hic haeres tuus, sed qui egredietur de utero tuo, ipsum habebis haeredem.
verses.english: Immediately, the Lord's word came to him, saying: 'This man will not be your heir. Instead, one who comes forth from your own body — he will be your heir.'

verses.latin: Edúxitque eum foras, et ait illi: Suspice caelum, et numera stellas si potes. Et dixit ei: Sic erit semen tuum.
verses.english: Then God led Abram outside and said to him: 'Look up at the sky and count the stars, if you can.' And He said to him: 'So numerous will your descendants be.'

verses.latin: Credidit Abram Deo, et reputatum est illi ad justitiam.
verses.english: Abram believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Ego Dominus qui edúxi te de Ur Chaldaeorum ut darem tibi terram istam et possideres eam.
verses.english: Then God said to him: 'I am the Lord, Who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land so that you may possess it.'

verses.latin: At ille ait: Domine Deus, unde scire possum quod possessurus sim eam?
verses.english: But Abram said: 'Lord God, how can I know that I will possess it?'

verses.latin: Et respondens Dominus: Sume, inquit, mihi vaccam triennem, et capram trimam, et arietem annorum trium, turturem quoque et pullum columbae.
verses.english: And the Lord responded, saying: 'Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, also a turtledove, and a young pigeon.'

verses.latin: Qui tulit universa haec, et divisit per mediam partem, et utrasque partes contra se invicem posuit: aves autem non divisit.
verses.english: So Abram brought all these to God. He cut the animals in half down the middle and laid each half opposite the other half. But he did not cut the birds in half.

verses.latin: Descendéruntque volucres super cadavera, et abigebat eas Abram.
verses.english: Then birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.

verses.latin: Cumque sol occumberet, sopor irruit super Abram, et horror magnus et tenebrosus invasit eum.
verses.english: As the sun was setting, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great, dreadful darkness enveloped him.

verses.latin: Dictumque est ad eum: Scito praenoscens quia peregrinum futurum sit semen tuum in terra non sua, et subjicient eos servituti, et affligent quadringentis annis.
verses.english: And it was said to him: 'Know for certain that your descendants will be foreigners in a land not their own. They will be enslaved and afflicted for four hundred years.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen gentem cui servituri sunt ego judicabo: et post haec egredientur cum magna substantia.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, I will judge the nation whom they will serve. And after this, they will come out with great possessions.'

verses.latin: Tu autem ibis ad patres tuos in pace, sepultus in bona senectute.
verses.english: 'But you yourself will go to your ancestors in peace, buried in a good old age.'

verses.latin: In quarta autem generatione revertentur huc: necdum enim completae sunt iniquitates Amorrhaeorum usque ad praesens tempus.
verses.english: 'And in the fourth generation, they will return here, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete enough for them to be dispossessed.'

verses.latin: Cum ergo occubuísset sol, et caligo esset orta, apparuit caminus fumans, et lampas ignis transiens inter divisiones illas.
verses.english: So when the sun had set, and it was very dark, behold, a smoking brazier and a flaming torch appeared, passing between the halves of the divided animals.

verses.latin: In illo die pepigit Dominus foedus cum Abram, dicens: Semini tuo dabo terram hanc, a flumine Aegypti usque ad fluvium magnum Euphraten,
verses.english: On that very day, the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying: 'To your descendants I will give this land, from the river of Egypt all the way to the great river Euphrates—'

verses.latin: Cineos et Cenezaeos et Cedmonaeos,
verses.english: '—including the land of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,'

verses.latin: et Hethaeos et Pherezaeos et Raphaim,
verses.english: '—and the Hittites, the Perizzites, and the Rephaim,'

verses.latin: et Amorrhaeos et Chananaeos, et Gergesaeos et Jebusaeos.
verses.english: '—and the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.'

verses.latin: Sarai autem uxor Abram non genuerat ei liberos. Habens ancillam Aegyptiam nomine Agar.
verses.english: Sarai, Abram's wife, had not borne him any children. Now, she had an Egyptian maidservant named Hagar.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, ut, cum esset Abraham nonaginta et novem annorum, apparuerit ei Dominus, dixitque ad eum: Ego Deus omnipotens: ambula coram me, et esto perfectus.
verses.english: It came to pass that when Abraham was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said to him: “I am God Almighty. Walk and live your life in My presence, and strive for perfection.”

verses.latin: Ponamque foedus meum inter me et te, et multiplicabo te vehementer nimis.
verses.english: I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will multiply your descendants beyond measure.

verses.latin: Cecidit Abram pronus in faciem suam: locutus estque ad eum Deus, dicens:
verses.english: Abram fell down, prostrate on his face, and God continued to speak to him, saying:

verses.latin: Ego sum, et pactum meum tecum: erisque pater multarum gentium.
verses.english: “I am He, and this is My covenant with you: you will be the father of many nations.”

verses.latin: Nec ultra vocabitur nomen tuum Abram: sed Abraham erit nomen tuum: quia patrem multarum gentium constitui te.
verses.english: “Your name will no longer be called Abram. Instead, your name will be Abraham, because I have made you the father of many nations.”

verses.latin: Crescere te faciam vehementissime: et ponam te in gentibus, regesque ex te egredientur.
verses.english: “I will make you incredibly fruitful, and I will make you into many nations, and kings will come forth from you.”

verses.latin: Et statuam pactum meum inter me et te, et inter semen tuum post te in generationibus suis, foedere sempiterno: ut sim Deus tuus, et seminis tui post te.
verses.english: “And I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and your descendants after you, throughout their generations, as an everlasting covenant: that I may be your God, and the God of your descendants after you, forever.”

verses.latin: Daboque tibi et semini tuo terram peregrinationis tuae, omnem terram Chanaan in possessionem sempiternam, et ero Deus eorum.
verses.english: “And I will give to you and your descendants the land where you now live as an alien—all the land of Canaan—as an everlasting possession, and I will be their God.”

verses.latin: Dixit rursus Deus ad Abraham: Tu ergo custodibis pactum meum, et semen tuum post te in generationibus suis.
verses.english: God also said to Abraham: “You, therefore, shall keep My covenant, you and your descendants after you throughout their generations.”

verses.latin: Hoc est pactum meum, quod observabitis inter me et vos, et semen tuum post te: circumcidetur ex vobis omne masculinum.
verses.english: “This is My covenant, which you shall observe, between Me and you, and your descendants after you: every male among you shall be circumcised.”

verses.latin: Et circumcidetis carnem præputii vestri, ut sit in signum fœderis inter me et vos.
verses.english: “You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and it will be a visible sign of the covenant between Me and you.”

verses.latin: Infans octo dierum circumcidetur in vobis, omne masculinum in generationibus vestris: tam is qui empticius est, et non est de stirpe vestra.
verses.english: “Every male among you, in your generations, shall be circumcised when he is eight days old, including those born in your household and those bought with money, who are not of your direct lineage.”

verses.latin: Et vernaculus, et empticius, circumcidetur: eritque pactum meum in carne vestra in fœdus sempiternum.
verses.english: “Both those born in your household and those bought with money must be circumcised. My covenant will be visibly marked in your flesh as an everlasting covenant.”

verses.latin: Masculinum, cujus præputii caro non fuerit circumcisa, delebitur anima illa de populo suo: quia pactum meum irritum fecit.
verses.english: “Any uncircumcised male, whose foreskin has not been circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from his people, because he has broken My covenant and rendered it null and void.”

verses.latin: Dixit quoque Deus ad Abraham: Sarai uxorem tuam non vocabis Sarai, sed Sara erit nomen ejus.
verses.english: God also said to Abraham: “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her Sarai; rather, her name shall be Sarah.”

verses.latin: Et benedicam ei, et ex illa dabo tibi filium: benedicamque illi, et erit in nationes, et reges populorum ex illa nascentur.
verses.english: “I will bless her, and indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she will become the mother of nations, and kings of peoples will be born from her.”

verses.latin: Cecidit Abraham in faciem suam, et risit, dicens in corde suo: Putasne centenario nascetur filius? et Sara nonagenaria pariet?
verses.english: Abraham fell on his face and laughed within his heart, saying to himself: “Will a son indeed be born to a man who is a hundred years old? And will Sarah, who is ninety years old, actually give birth?”

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Deum: Utinam Ismahel vivat coram te!
verses.english: And Abraham said to God: “Oh, that Ishmael might live and thrive in Your presence!”

verses.latin: Et ait Deus: Certe Sara uxor tua pariet tibi filium, vocabisque nomen ejus Isaac: et statuam pactum meum illi in fœdus sempiternum, et semini ejus post eum.
verses.english: Then God said: “No, truly, Sarah your wife will bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac. I will establish My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant, and with his descendants after him.”

verses.latin: Super Ismahel quoque exaudivi te: ecce benedicam ei, et crescere faciam, et multiplicabo eum vehementissime: duodecim duces generabit, et faciam illum in gentem magnam.
verses.english: “And concerning Ishmael, I have also heard your prayer. Behold, I will bless him, and I will make him fruitful, and I will multiply him exceedingly. He will become the father of twelve princes, and I will make him into a great nation.”

verses.latin: Pactum autem meum statuam ad Isaac, quem pariet tibi Sara in tempore isto, in anno altero.
verses.english: “But My covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this appointed time, in the coming year.”

verses.latin: Cumque cessasset loqui cum eo, ascendit Deus ab Abraham.
verses.english: When God had finished speaking with Abraham, He then ascended from him.

verses.latin: Tulit itaque Abraham Ismahelem filium suum, et omnes vernaculos domus suæ, universosque quos emerat, cunctos masculos de viris domus suæ: et circumcidit carnem præputii eorum confestim in ipsa die, sicut præceperat ei Deus.
verses.english: So Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all those born in his household, and all those whom he had bought—every male among the men of his household—and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins immediately on that very day, just as God had commanded him.

verses.latin: Abraham nonaginta et novem annorum erat, quando præputii sui carnem circumcidit.
verses.english: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.

verses.latin: Et Ismahel filius ejus tredecim annorum erat, quando circumcisus est.
verses.english: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised.

verses.latin: In eadem die circumcisus est Abraham, et Ismahel filius ejus.
verses.english: On that very same day, Abraham was circumcised, and Ishmael his son with him.

verses.latin: Et omnes viri domus ejus, tam vernaculi, quam empticii et alienigenæ, simul circumcisi sunt.
verses.english: And all the men of his household—both those born in his house, and those bought with money, and even foreigners living among them—were circumcised with him at the same time.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem ei Dominus in convalle Mambre sedenti in ostio tabernaculi sui in ipso fervore diei.
verses.english: The Lord then appeared to him in the valley of Mamre, as he sat at the door of his tent during the hottest part of the day.

verses.latin: Cumque levasse esset oculos suos, apparuerunt ei tres viri stantes prope eum: quos cum vidisset, cucurrit in occursum eorum de ostio tabernaculi, et adoravit in terram.
verses.english: And when he lifted his eyes, three men stood near him. When he saw them, he ran from the door of his tent to meet them, and bowed down to the ground.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Domine, si inveni gratiam in oculis tuis, ne transeas servum tuum.
verses.english: And he said: "My Lord, if I have found favor in your sight, do not pass by your servant."

verses.latin: Afferam pauxillum aquae, et lavate pedes vestros, et requiescite sub arbore.
verses.english: Let me bring a little water, and you may wash your feet and then rest yourselves under this tree.

verses.latin: Et ponam buccellam panis, et confortate cor vestrum: postea transibitis, quia idcirco declinastis ad servum vestrum. Qui dixerunt: Fac ut locutus es.
verses.english: And I will bring a piece of bread, so you can refresh yourselves. After that, you may continue on your way, because that is why you have turned aside to your servant." And they said: "Do as you have spoken."

verses.latin: Festinavit Abraham in tabernaculum ad Saram, dixitque ei: Accelera, tria sata similae commisce, et fac subcinericios panes.
verses.english: Abraham hurried to his tent to Sarah, and said to her: "Quickly, take three measures of fine flour, knead it, and make flat bread."

verses.latin: Et ipse ad armenta cucurrit, et tulit inde vitulum tenerrimum et optimum, deditque puero: qui festinavit et coxit illum.
verses.english: And he himself ran to the herd and took from there a very tender and choice calf, and gave it to a young man, who quickly prepared and cooked it.

verses.latin: Tulit quoque butyrum et lac, et vitulum quem coxerat, et posuit coram eis: ipse vero stabat juxta eos sub arbore.
verses.english: He also brought butter and milk, and the calf which he had prepared, and set them before them. But he himself stood by them under the tree.

verses.latin: Cumque comedissent, dixerunt ad eum: Ubi est Sara uxor tua? Respondit: Ecce in tabernaculo est.
verses.english: And when they had eaten, they said to him: "Where is Sarah your wife?" He responded: "Behold, she is in the tent."

verses.latin: Cui dixit: Revertens veniam ad te hoc tempore, vita comite, et habebit filium Sara uxor tua. Quo audito, Sara risit post ostium tabernaculi.
verses.english: And one of them said to him: "I will surely return to you at this time next year, if life continues as it is, and your wife Sarah will have a son." When Sarah heard this, she laughed to herself behind the door of the tent.

verses.latin: Erant autem ambo senes, et provectae aetatis, et desierat Sara fieri more mulierum.
verses.english: Now both Abraham and Sarah were old and advanced in age, and Sarah had ceased to have the monthly custom of women.

verses.latin: Ridetur ergo Sara occulte, dicens: Postquam consenui, et dominus meus senex est, voluptati operam dabo?
verses.english: So Sarah laughed to herself, saying: "After I have become old, and my master is also old, shall I indeed have pleasure, or bear a child?"

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Abraham: Quare risit Sara, dicens: Num vere paritura sum anus?
verses.english: And the Lord said to Abraham: "Why did Sarah laugh, saying: 'Shall I truly bear a child, being an old woman?'"

verses.latin: Numquid difficile est Deo quidquam? Juxta idem tempus revertar, vita comite, et habebit Sara filium.
verses.english: Is anything too difficult for God? I will return at the same time next year, if life continues as it is, and Sarah will have a son.

verses.latin: Negavit Sara, dicens: Non risi: timore perterrita. Dixit Dominus: Non est ita, sed risisti.
verses.english: Sarah denied it, saying: "I did not laugh," because she was terrified. The Lord said: "It is not so; but you did laugh."

verses.latin: Igitur cum surrexissent inde viri, aspexerunt contra Sodomam: et Abraham simul gradiebatur, deducens eos.
verses.english: Then, when the men rose from there, they looked toward Sodom. And Abraham walked with them, accompanying them on their way.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus: Num celare potero Abraham quae gesturus sum?
verses.english: And the Lord said: "Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do?"

verses.latin: Abraham quippe futurus est in gentem magnam, et robustissimam, et benedicentur in illo omnes nationes terrae.
verses.english: For Abraham will surely become a great and very powerful nation, and in him, all the nations of the earth will be blessed.

verses.latin: Scio enim quod praecepturus sit filiis suis, et domui suae post se, ut custodiant viam Domini, et faciant justitiam et judicium: ut adducat Dominus super Abraham quidquid locutus est ad eum.
verses.english: For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him to keep the way of the Lord and to do righteousness and justice, so that the Lord may bring upon Abraham everything He has spoken to him.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Dominus: Clamor Sodomorum et Gomorrae multiplicatus est, et peccatum eorum aggravatum est nimis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord said: "The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah has greatly increased, and their sin has become exceedingly grievous."

verses.latin: Descendam, et videbo utrum clamorem qui venit ad me opere compleverint, an non est ita: ut sciam.
verses.english: I will go down and see if they have indeed carried out the full measure of the outcry that has come to me, or if it is not so; so that I may know with certainty.

verses.latin: Converteruntque se inde viri, et abierunt Sodomam: Abraham vero adhuc stabat coram Domino.
verses.english: So the men turned away from there and went toward Sodom. But Abraham still stood before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et appropinquans dixit: Numquid perdes justum cum impio?
verses.english: And Abraham approached and said: "Will you truly destroy the righteous along with the wicked?"

verses.latin: Si forte fuerint quinquaginta justi in civitate, perdes eos? et non parces loco propter quinquaginta justos, si fuerint in eo?
verses.english: If there are perhaps fifty righteous people in the city, will you destroy them? And will you not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous people who are in it?

verses.latin: Absit a te, ut rem hanc facias, et perdas justum cum impio, fiatque justus sicut impius, absit a te. Qui judicas omnem terram, nequaquam facies judicium hoc.
verses.english: Far be it from you to do such a thing as this, to slay the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous are treated like the wicked. Far be it from you! Shall not the Judge of all the earth do what is just?

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus: Si invenero Sodomis quinquaginta justos in medio civitatis, dimittam omnem locum propter illos.
verses.english: And the Lord said: "If I find fifty righteous people in Sodom within the city, I will spare the entire place for their sake."

verses.latin: Et respondens Abraham ait: Ecce coepi loqui ad Dominum meum, cum sim pulvis et cinis.
verses.english: And Abraham responded and said: "Behold, I have dared to speak to my Lord, though I am but dust and ashes."

verses.latin: Quid si minus quinquaginta justis quinque fuerint? Parces, propter quinque, omni civitati? Et ait: Non delebo, si invenero ibi quadraginta quinque.
verses.english: What if there are five fewer than fifty righteous people? Will you destroy the entire city because of those five?" And He said: "I will not destroy it if I find forty-five there."

verses.latin: Rursumque locutus est ad eum: Si forte inventi fuerint ibi quadraginta, quid facies? Ait: Non percutiam propter quadraginta.
verses.english: And he spoke to Him again: "What if forty righteous people are found there?" He said: "I will not strike it for the sake of the forty."

verses.latin: Ne, quaeso, inquit, irascaris, Domine, si loquar: quid si inventi fuerint ibi triginta? Respondit: Non faciam, si invenero ibi triginta.
verses.english: Then he said: "Please, Lord, do not be angry if I speak again: what if thirty righteous people are found there?" He answered: "I will not do it if I find thirty there."

verses.latin: Quia, inquit, coepi, loquar ad Dominum meum: quid si inventi fuerint ibi viginti? Dixit: Non delebo propter viginti.
verses.english: And he said: "Since I have begun, I will speak to my Lord again: what if twenty righteous people are found there?" He said: "I will not destroy it for the sake of the twenty."

verses.latin: Obsecro, inquit, ne irascaris, Domine, si loquar adhuc semel: quid si inventi fuerint ibi decem? Respondit: Non delebo propter decem.
verses.english: Then he said: "I beg you, Lord, do not be angry if I speak just one more time: what if ten righteous people are found there?" He answered: "I will not destroy it for the sake of the ten."

verses.latin: Abiitque Dominus, postquam cessavit loqui ad Abraham: et Abraham reversus est in locum suum.
verses.english: And the Lord departed after He had finished speaking with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his own place.

verses.latin: Veneruntque duo angeli Sodomam vespere, et Lot sedebat in foribus civitatis. Videns autem eos, surrexit, et ivit obviam eis: adoravitque pronus in terram.
verses.english: Two angels arrived in the city of Sodom in the evening. Lot was sitting at the city gate, where people conducted legal and civic matters. When he saw them, he stood up and went out to meet them, bowing down with his face to the ground as a sign of deep respect and humility.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Obsecro, domini, declinate in domum pueri vestri, et manete ibi: lavate pedes vestros, et mane proficiscimini viam vestram. Qui dixerunt: Minime, sed in platea manebimus.
verses.english: And Lot said, 'Please, sirs, come to your servant's house and stay the night there. You can wash your feet, and then depart on your journey in the morning.' But they replied, 'No, we will stay in the public square.'

verses.latin: Compulit autem eos multum: et declinaverunt ad illum, ingressique sunt domum ejus. Fecitque eis convivium, et azyma coxit: et comederunt.
verses.english: But Lot urged them strongly, so they turned aside and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them, baking unleavened bread, and they ate.

verses.latin: Prius quam irent cubitum, viri civitatis, Sodomae, circumsteterunt domum, a puero usque ad senem, omnis populus simul.
verses.english: Before they lay down to sleep, the men of the city of Sodom surrounded the house—every single person, from the youngest boy to the oldest man.

verses.latin: Vocaveruntque Lot, et dixerunt ei: Ubi sunt viri qui introierunt ad te nocte? educ illos huc, ut cognoscamus eos.
verses.english: They called out to Lot and said to him, 'Where are the men who came to your house tonight? Bring them out to us, so that we may know them intimately in a sinful way.'

verses.latin: Egressusque Lot ad eos, clausit ostium post se, et ait:
verses.english: Lot went out to them, closing the door behind him, and said,

verses.latin: Nolite, quaeso, fratres mei, agere nequiter.
verses.english: 'Please, my brothers, do not act so wickedly.'

verses.latin: Habeo duas filias virgines, quas ad vos adducam, et abutimini illis sicut placuerit vobis, dummodo viris istis nihil inrogetis, quia ingressi sunt sub umbram tecti mei.
verses.english: 'Look, I have two virgin daughters. I will bring them out to you, and you may do to them whatever you please. But do nothing to these men, for they have come under the protection of my roof.'

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Recede illuc. Et rursum: Ingressus es, inquiunt, ut advena: num judicare? Te ipsum ergo nunc magis affligemus quam illos. Et vim faciebant homini Lot vehementissime: jamque prope erat ut effringerent ostium.
verses.english: But they shouted back, 'Stand back!' And again they said, 'You came here as a foreigner, and now you want to judge us? We will treat you worse than we will treat them!' And they pressed violently against Lot, and were already close to breaking down the door.

verses.latin: Protendentes autem viri manum, intraxerunt ad Lot, et clauserunt ostium.
verses.english: Then the men inside (the angels) stretched out their hands, pulled Lot back into the house, and shut the door.

verses.latin: Et eos qui foris erant, caecos percusserunt ab omni minimo usque ad maximum, ita ut ostium invenire non possent.
verses.english: And they struck the men outside with blindness, from the youngest to the oldest, so that they could not find the door anymore.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad Lot: Habes hic quempiam ex tuis? socerum, et filios, et filias, et omnes qui tui sunt, educ de civitate hac:
verses.english: Then the angels said to Lot, 'Do you have anyone else here who belongs to you? Your son-in-law, your sons, your daughters, and everyone else who is yours—bring them out of this city.'

verses.latin: Delere enim nos sumus locum istum, eo quod increverit clamor eorum coram Domino, qui misit nos ut perdamus illos.
verses.english: 'For we are about to destroy this place, because the outcry against them has grown so great before the Lord, who has sent us to destroy them.'

verses.latin: Egressus itaque Lot, locutus est ad generos suos, qui accepturi erant filias ejus, et dixit: Surgite, egredimini de loco isto, quia delebit Dominus civitatem hanc. Et visus est eis quasi ludens loqui.
verses.english: So Lot went out and spoke to his future sons-in-law, who were going to marry his daughters. He said, 'Get up, get out of this place, because the Lord is about to destroy this city.' But he seemed to them to be joking.

verses.latin: Cumque illucesceret, coegerunt eum angeli, dicentes: Surge, et tolle uxorem tuam, et duas filias quas habes, ne simul pereas in scelere civitatis.
verses.english: When the dawn was breaking, the angels urged Lot, saying, 'Get up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here with you, so that you do not perish along with the city in its wickedness.'

verses.latin: Cunctante illo, apprehenderunt manum ejus, et manum uxoris, ac duarum filiarum ejus, eo quod parceret Dominus illi. Edxeruntque eum, et posuerunt extra civitatem.
verses.english: When Lot hesitated, the angels grasped his hand, his wife's hand, and the hands of his two daughters, because the Lord had mercy on him. They led him out and placed him outside the city.

verses.latin: Et cum eduxissent eos foras, dixerunt: Salva animam tuam: noli respicere post tergum, neque subsistas in omni circa regione: sed in monte salvate, ne et tu simul pereas.
verses.english: When they had led them outside, one of the angels said, 'Escape for your life! Do not look back behind you, and do not stop anywhere in the surrounding plain. Escape to the mountains, so that you do not perish along with everyone else!'

verses.latin: Dixitque Lot ad eos: Quæso, Domine mi, non ita.
verses.english: And Lot said to them, 'Oh no, my Lord, please do not make me do that!'

verses.latin: Ecce invenit servus tuus gratiam coram te, et magnificasti misericordiam tuam quam fecisti mecum, ut salvares animam meam: nec possum in monte salvari, ne forte apprehendat me malum, et moriar.
verses.english: 'Look, your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have shown great mercy to me by saving my life. But I cannot escape to the mountains, for fear that some evil might overtake me there, and I will die.'

verses.latin: Est vicina haec civitas, ad quam possum fugere, et parva est: obsecro, ut salver in ea, et vivet anima mea: Parva est enim.
verses.english: 'See, there is this nearby town to which I can flee, and it is a small one. Please, let me escape there so that my life may be saved, for it is indeed a very small town.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Ecce etiam in hoc gratiam faciei tuae suscepi, ut non subvertam urbem pro qua locutus es.
verses.english: And the angel said to him, 'See, I have granted your request in this matter as well, that I will not overthrow the town for which you have pleaded.'

verses.latin: Salvare ibi cito, quia non potero quidquam facere donec illuc ingrediaris. Idcirco vocatum est nomen urbis illius Segor.
verses.english: 'Hurry and escape there, because I can do nothing until you arrive there.' That is why the name of that city was called Zoar, meaning 'small.'

verses.latin: Sol egressus est super terram, et Lot ingressus est Segor.
verses.english: The sun had risen over the earth when Lot entered Zoar.

verses.latin: Igitur Dominus pluit super Sodomam et Gomorram sulphur et ignem a Domino de caelo.
verses.english: Then the Lord rained down sulfur and fire upon Sodom and Gomorrah—from the Lord, out of the sky.

verses.latin: Et subvertit civitates has, et omnem circa regionem, universos habitatores urbium, et cuncta terræ virentia.
verses.english: And He overthrew those cities, and all the surrounding plain, along with all the inhabitants of the cities, and every living thing growing on the ground.

verses.latin: Respiciensque uxor ejus post tergum, versa est in statuam salis.
verses.english: But Lot's wife looked back behind him, and she was turned into a pillar of salt.

verses.latin: Abraam vero de nocte consurgens, abiit ad locum ubi steterat prius cum Domino:
verses.english: But Abraham, rising early in the morning, went to the place where he had previously stood before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et intuitus est contra Sodomam et Gomorram, et universam terram regionis illius: viditque ascendere favillam de terra quasi fornacis fumum.
verses.english: And he looked out toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and across the entire land of that region. He saw smoke ascending from the earth, like the smoke from a furnace.

verses.latin: Cum enim subverteret Deus civitates regionis illius, recordatus est Abrahae: et liberavit Lot de subversione urbium, in quibus habitavit.
verses.english: When God overthrew the cities of that region, He remembered Abraham, and rescued Lot from the destruction of the cities where he had lived.

verses.latin: Ascenditque Lot de Segor, et mansit in monte, duæ quoque filiæ ejus cum eo, eo quod timuerat morari in Segor. Et mansit in spelunca ipse et duæ filiæ ejus secum.
verses.english: Then Lot went up out of Zoar and settled in the mountains, with his two daughters, because he was afraid to stay in Zoar. He lived in a cave, he and his two daughters with him.

verses.latin: Dixitque major ad minorem: Pater noster senex est, et nemo est in terra qui ingrediatur ad nos juxta morem universæ terræ.
verses.english: And the older daughter said to the younger, 'Our father is old, and there is no man left in this land to come in to us according to the custom of all the earth, to take us as wives and have children with us.'

verses.latin: Veni, inebriemus eum vino, dormiamusque cum eo, ut servemus de patre nostro semen.
verses.english: 'Come, let us make our father drunk with wine, and let us lie with him, so that we may preserve offspring through our father.'

verses.latin: Itaque potum dederunt patri suo nocte illa: ingressaque major, dormivit cum patre suo. Ille vero nescivit et quando recubuit, et quando surrexit.
verses.english: So they gave their father wine to drink that night. Then the older daughter went in and lay with her father, but he did not know when she lay down or when she got up.

verses.latin: Altera die dixit major ad minorem: Ecce dormivi heri cum patre meo: inebriemus eum etiam hac nocte, et dormies cum eo, ut salvemus semen de patre nostro.
verses.english: The next day, the older daughter said to the younger, 'See, I lay with my father last night. Let us make him drunk with wine tonight as well, and you go in and lie with him, so that we may preserve offspring through our father.'

verses.latin: Dederuntque et illa nocte patri suo vinum, et ingressa minor dormivit cum eo: et hanc quoque non sensit quando accubuit, et quando surrexit.
verses.english: So they gave their father wine to drink that night also. And the younger daughter went in and lay with him, but he also did not know when she lay down or when she got up.

verses.latin: Conceperunt ergo duæ filiæ Lot de patre suo.
verses.english: Thus, Lot's two daughters conceived children by their father.

verses.latin: Peperitque major filium, et vocavit nomen ejus Moab: hic est pater Moabitarum usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: The older daughter gave birth to a son and named him Moab. He is the ancestor of the Moabites to this very day.

verses.latin: Minor quoque peperit filium, et vocavit nomen ejus Ammon, id est, filium populi mei: hic est pater Ammonitarum usque hodie.
verses.english: The younger daughter also gave birth to a son and named him Ben-Ammi, which means 'son of my people.' He is the ancestor of the Ammonites to this very day.

verses.latin: Profectus inde Abraham in terram australem, habitavit inter Cades et Sur, et peregrinatus est in Gerara.
verses.english: Abraham then departed from that place and journeyed into the land to the south. He settled between Kadesh and Shur, and then lived for a time as a foreign visitor in Gerar.

verses.latin: Et dixit de Sara uxore sua: Soror mea est. Misit ergo Abimelech rex Gerarae, et tulit eam.
verses.english: He said about Sarah, his wife, 'She is my sister.' So Abimelech, the king of Gerar, sent for Sarah and took her for himself.

verses.latin: Venit autem Deus ad Abimelech per somnium noctis, et ait illi: Ecce morieris propter mulierem quam tulisti, quae habet virum.
verses.english: But God came to Abimelech in a dream during the night and said to him, 'Indeed, you will certainly die because of the woman you have taken, for she is already married to another man.'

verses.latin: Abimelech vero non tetigerat eam, et ait: Domine, gentem ignoratam et justam interficies?
verses.english: But Abimelech had not had relations with her, and he said, 'Lord, will You destroy an innocent and righteous people?'

verses.latin: Nonne ipse dixit mihi: Soror mea est: et ipsa: Frater meus est? In simplicitate cordis mei, et munditia manuum mearum feci hoc.
verses.english: Did he not himself tell me, 'She is my sister,' and did she herself not say, 'He is my brother'? I did this with a sincere heart and clean hands, believing them.

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Deus: Et ego scio quod simplici corde feceris: et ideo prohibui te ne peccares mihi, et non dimisi te ut tangeres eam.
verses.english: And God said to him, 'Yes, I also know that you acted with a sincere heart, and therefore I prevented you from committing this sin against Me. I did not permit you to have relations with her.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur redde uxorem viri: quia propheta est, et orabit pro te, et vives: si autem nolueris reddere, scito quod morte morieris tu, et omnia quae tua sunt.
verses.english: Now, therefore, restore the man's wife — Abraham's wife — because he is a prophet of God, and he will intercede for you, and your life will be spared. But if you are unwilling to return her, know that you yourself will certainly die, along with everyone and everything belonging to you.

verses.latin: Statimque de nocte consurgens Abimelech, vocavit omnes servos suos: et locutus est omnes sermones istos in auribus eorum, timuitque omnis populus vehementer.
verses.english: Immediately, Abimelech got up in the night and called all his servants. He related everything that had been said to them, and all the people became very fearful.

verses.latin: Vocavit autem Abimelech et Abraham, et dixit ei: Quid fecisti nobis? et quid peccavimus in te, ut induceres super me et super regnum meum peccatum grande? opera quae non debuisti facere, fecisti nobis.
verses.english: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said to him, 'What is this that you have done to us? What offense have we committed against you that you would bring such a great sin upon me and my kingdom? You have done deeds to us that should never have been done.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Abimelech ad Abraham: Quid vidisti, ut hoc faceres?
verses.english: And Abimelech said to Abraham, 'What possible reason did you have for doing this?'

verses.latin: Respondit Abraham: Timui mecum dicens: Forsitan non est timor Dei in loco isto: et interficient me propter uxorem meam.
verses.english: Abraham answered, 'I was afraid, thinking to myself, 'Perhaps there is no reverence for God in this place, and they would kill me to take my wife.''

verses.latin: Etenim vere et soror mea est, filia patris mei est, et non matris: et duxi eam uxorem.
verses.english: Moreover, she is truly my sister; she is my father's daughter, though not my mother's, and I married her.

verses.latin: Cumque abstraxisset me Deus de domo patris mei, dixi ad eam: Hanc misericordiam facies mecum: in omni loco ad quem ingrediemur, dices: Frater tuus sum.
verses.english: When God called me to leave my father's house, I said to her, 'Do this favor for me: in every place we go, you must say, 'He is my brother.''

verses.latin: Tulit igitur Abimelech oves et boves, et servos et ancillas, et dedit Abrahae: et reddidit illi Saram uxorem suam.
verses.english: So Abimelech took flocks and herds, male and female servants, and gave them to Abraham; and he gave back Sarah, his wife, to him.

verses.latin: Et ait Abimelech: Ecce terra mea coram te est: ubicumque tibi placuerit, habita.
verses.english: And Abimelech said, 'Look, my land is at your disposal; live wherever you wish.'

verses.latin: Sarae quoque dixit: Ecce mille argenteos dedi fratri tuo: hoc erit tibi in velamen oculorum, et apud omnes justitiam: et ubicumque ieris, memento te fuisse deprehensam.
verses.english: And to Sarah he also said, 'Look, I have given a thousand pieces of silver to your brother. Let this be a public vindication for you among all who witnessed this, and wherever you go, let it be a reminder of what happened.'

verses.latin: Oravit itaque Abraham Deum: et sanavit Deus Abimelech et uxorem et ancillas ejus, et pepererunt.
verses.english: So Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech, his wife, and his female servants so that they were able to conceive children.

verses.latin: Concluderat enim Dominus omnem vulvam domus Abimelech, propter Saram uxorem Abrahae.
verses.english: For the Lord had indeed sealed every womb in Abimelech's household because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.

verses.latin: Vidit autem Dominus Saram, sicut promiserat, et implevit quod locutus est.
verses.english: The Lord had remembered Sarah, just as He promised. And He brought to pass everything He had spoken.

verses.latin: Et concepit, et peperit ei filium in senectute sua, tempore quo praedixerat ei Deus.
verses.english: And she conceived and gave birth to a son in her old age, at the very time God had predicted to her.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Abraham nomen filii sui, quem genuit ei Sara, Isaac:
verses.english: And Abraham called the name of his son, whom Sarah had borne to him, Isaac.

verses.latin: et circumcidit eum octavo die, sicut praeceperat ei Deus.
verses.english: And he circumcised Isaac on the eighth day, just as God had commanded him.

verses.latin: Cum centum esset annorum, quando natus est ei Isaac filius suus.
verses.english: Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Sara: Risum fecit mihi Deus: quicumque audierit, conridet me.
verses.english: And Sarah said, "God has given me a reason to laugh! Everyone who hears about this will laugh with me."

verses.latin: Et rursus: Quis auditurum credidisset Abraham, quod Sara lactaret filium, et peperisse illum jam seni?
verses.english: And again she said, "Who would have believed Abraham when he said that Sarah would nurse a child, and that she would give birth to him in her old age?"

verses.latin: Crevit igitur puer, et ablactatus est. Fecitque Abraham grande convivium in die ablactationis ejus.
verses.english: So the boy grew, and he was weaned from his mother's milk. And Abraham made a great feast on the day of his weaning.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Sara filium Agar Aegyptiae ludentem cum Isaac filio suo,
verses.english: But when Sarah saw the son of Hagar, the Egyptian woman, making fun of Isaac her son,

verses.latin: dixit ad Abraham: Ejice ancillam hanc et filium ejus: non enim haeres erit filius ancillae cum filio meo Isaac.
verses.english: she said to Abraham, "Cast out this slave-woman and her son, for the son of this slave-woman shall not inherit along with my son Isaac."

verses.latin: Dura res valde visa est Abraham pro filio suo.
verses.english: This matter seemed very difficult to Abraham because it involved his son.

verses.latin: Cui dixit Deus: Non tibi videatur asperum super puero et super ancilla tua: omnia quæ dixit tibi Sara, audi vocem ejus: quia in Isaac vocabitur tibi semen.
verses.english: But God said to him, "Do not let this seem harsh to you concerning the boy and your slave-woman. Whatever Sarah has said to you, listen to her voice, for in Isaac your lineage will be called forth."

verses.latin: Sed et filium ancillæ faciam in gentem magnam, quia semen tuum est.
verses.english: But I will also make the son of the slave-woman into a great nation, because he is your descendant too.

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque Abraham mane, et tollens panem et utrem aquæ, imposuit scapulæ ejus, et puerum tradidit. Dimisitque illam. Quæ cum abisset, errabat in solitudine Bersabee.
verses.english: So Abraham rose early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and put them on her shoulder, and he sent the boy with her. Then he sent her away. And when she had gone, she wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

verses.latin: Cumque consumpta esset aqua in utre, abjecit puerum subter unam arborum, quæ ibi erant:
verses.english: And when the water in the bottle was used up, she cast the boy under one of the trees that were there.

verses.latin: et abiit, et sedit contra: procul quantum potest jacere sagitta. Dixit enim: Non videbo morientem puerum. Et sedens contra, levavit vocem suam, et flevit.
verses.english: Then she went and sat down opposite him, as far away as an arrow can be shot. For she said, "I will not see the boy die." And as she sat opposite him, she lifted her voice and wept.

verses.latin: Exaudivit autem Deus vocem pueri: et vocavit Angelus Dei de cælo Agar, dicens: Quid agis Agar? Noli timere: exaudivit enim Deus vocem pueri de loco in quo est.
verses.english: Now God heard the voice of the boy. And the Angel of God called to Hagar from the sky, saying, "What troubles you, Hagar? Do not be afraid, for God has heard the voice of the boy from the place where he is."

verses.latin: Surge, tolle puerum, et tene manum ejus: quia in gentem magnam faciam illum.
verses.english: Rise, take the boy, and hold his hand, for I will make him into a great nation.

verses.latin: Aperuitque Deus oculos ejus: qui videns puteum aquæ viventis, abiit, et implevit utrem, deditque puero bibere.
verses.english: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of living water. So she went and filled the bottle and gave the boy to drink.

verses.latin: Et fuit Deus cum illo: qui crevit, et moratus est in solitudine, factusque juvenis sagittarius.
verses.english: And God was with him, and he grew, and he lived in the wilderness, becoming a young archer.

verses.latin: Habitavitque in deserto Pharan, et accepit illi mater sua uxorem de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: And he lived in the desert of Paran, and his mother found him a wife from the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Eodem tempore Abimelech, et Phicol princeps exercitus ejus, locuti sunt ad Abraham, dicentes: Deus tecum est in universis quæ agis.
verses.english: At that same time, Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in all that you do."

verses.latin: Jura ergo mihi per Deum, ne noceas mihi, et posteris meis, stirpique meæ: sed juxta misericordiam, quam feci tibi, facies mihi, et terræ in qua commoratus es advena.
verses.english: Therefore, swear to me now by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my descendants, nor with my lineage. But according to the kindness I have shown to you, you will show kindness to me and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner.

verses.latin: Dixitque Abraham: Ego jurabo.
verses.english: And Abraham said, "I will swear."

verses.latin: Et increpavit Abraham Abimelech super puteo aquæ, quem vi abstulerant servi ejus.
verses.english: Then Abraham complained to Abimelech about a well of water which Abimelech's servants had taken by force.

verses.latin: Responditque Abimelech: Nescio quis fecerit hoc: nec tu mihi aliquid indicasti, et ego non audivi, nisi hodie.
verses.english: And Abimelech answered, "I do not know who did this. You did not tell me anything, and I did not hear of it until today."

verses.latin: Tulit itaque Abraham oves et boves, et dedit Abimelech: pepigeruntque ambo fœdus.
verses.english: So Abraham took sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech. And both of them made a covenant.

verses.latin: Et statuit Abraham septem agnas de grege seorsum.
verses.english: And Abraham set aside seven ewe-lambs from the flock.

verses.latin: Cui dixit Abimelech: Quid sibi volunt septem agnæ istæ, quas stare fecisti seorsum?
verses.english: And Abimelech said to him, "What do these seven ewe-lambs mean, which you have set aside?"

verses.latin: At ille: Septem, inquit, agnas accipies de manu mea: ut sint in testimonium mihi, quoniam ego fodi puteum istum.
verses.english: And he said, "You shall accept these seven ewe-lambs from my hand, that they may be a witness for me that I dug this well."

verses.latin: Ob hanc causam vocatus est locus ille Bersabee: quia ibi uterque juravit.
verses.english: Because of this reason, that place was called Beersheba, which means 'well of the oath', because there both of them swore an oath.

verses.latin: Et inierunt fœdus in Bersabee. Surrexit autem Abimelech, et Phicol princeps exercitus ejus, reversique sunt in terram Palæstinorum.
verses.english: So they made a covenant in Beersheba. Then Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, rose up and returned to the land of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Plantavitque Abraham nemus in Bersabee, et invocavit ibi nomen Domini Dei æterni.
verses.english: And Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and there he called upon the name of the Lord, the Eternal God.

verses.latin: Et peregrinatus est in terra Palæstinorum dies multos.
verses.english: And he sojourned in the land of the Philistines for many days.

verses.latin: His igitur gestis, tentavit Deus Abraham, et dixit ad eum: Abraham, Abraham. Ille respondit: Ecce ego.
verses.english: After these things had happened, God put Abraham to the test. God said to him, 'Abraham! Abraham!' Abraham answered, 'Here I am.'

verses.latin: Tollat filium tuum unigenitum, quem diligis, Isaac, et vade in terram visionis, atque offer illum ibi in holocaustum super unum montium quem monstravero tibi.
verses.english: God said, 'Take your son, your only son, Isaac—the son whom you love—and go to the land of vision. There, offer him as a burnt offering upon one of the mountains that I will show you.'

verses.latin: Igitur Abraham de nocte consurgens, stravit asinum suum, ducens secum duos juvenes, et Isaac filium suum: cumque concidisset ligna in holocaustum, abiit ad locum quem præceperat ei Deus.
verses.english: So, Abraham got up before dawn and saddled his donkey. He took two of his servants with him, and his son Isaac. Abraham cut the wood for the burnt offering and then set off for the place God had told him about.

verses.latin: Die autem tertio, elevatis oculis, vidit locum procul.
verses.english: On the third day of their journey, Abraham looked up and saw the place in the distance.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad pueros suos: Expectate hic cum asino: ego et puer illuc usque properantes, postquam adoraverimus, revertemur ad vos.
verses.english: Abraham told his servants, 'You two stay here with the donkey. My son and I will go up to the mountain to worship, and then we will come back to you.' —This implies Abraham's faith that Isaac would be returned to him.

verses.latin: Tulit quoque ligna holocausti, et imposuit super Isaac filium suum: ipse vero portabat in manibus ignem et cultrum. Cumque duo pergerent simul,
verses.english: Then Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and laid it upon his son Isaac’s shoulders. Abraham himself carried the fire and the knife in his hands. And so, the two of them walked on together.

verses.latin: dixit Isaac patri suo: Pater mi. At ille respondit: Quid vis, fili? Ecce, inquit, ignis et ligna: ubi est victima holocausti?
verses.english: Isaac spoke to his father Abraham, saying, 'My father!' Abraham answered, 'What is it, my son?' Isaac said, 'Here are the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?'

verses.latin: Dixitque Abraham: Deus providebit sibi victimam holocausti, fili mi. Pergebant ergo ambo pariter.
verses.english: Abraham replied, 'My son, God Himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering.' And so, the two of them walked on together.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad locum quem ostenderat ei Deus: in quo ædificavit Abraham altare, et desuper composuit ligna. Cumque alligasset Isaac filium suum, posuit eum in altare super struem lignorum.
verses.english: When they arrived at the place God had shown him, Abraham built an altar there. He arranged the wood upon it. Then, Abraham bound his son Isaac and placed him on the altar, on top of the wood.

verses.latin: Extenditque manum, et arripuit cultrum, ut immolaret filium suum.
verses.english: Abraham then reached out his hand and took the knife, ready to sacrifice his son.

verses.latin: Et ecce angelus Domini de caelo clamavit dicens: Abraham, Abraham. Qui respondit: Ecce ego.
verses.english: But behold, an angel of the Lord called to him from the sky, saying, 'Abraham! Abraham!' Abraham answered, 'Here I am!'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei: Non extendas manum tuam super puerum, neque facias illi quidquam: nunc cognovi quod times Deum, et non pepercisti unigenito filio tuo propter me.
verses.english: The angel said, 'Do not lay a hand on the boy, and do not do anything to him! Now I know that you truly revere God, for you did not withhold your only son from Me.'

verses.latin: Levavit Abraham oculos suos, viditque retro arietem inter vepres hærentem cornibus, quem assumens obtulit holocaustum pro filio.
verses.english: Abraham looked up and saw a ram behind him, caught by its horns in a thicket. So Abraham took the ram and offered it as a burnt offering instead of his son.

verses.latin: Appellavitque nomen loci illius, Dominus videt. Unde usque hodie dicitur: In monte Dominus videt.
verses.english: Abraham called the name of that place, 'The Lord Will Provide.' —Using the prophetic sense of 'sees'. That is why, to this day, people say, 'On the mountain, the Lord will provide.'

verses.latin: Clamavit autem angelus Domini ad Abraham secundo de caelo, dicens:
verses.english: Then the angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time from the sky,

verses.latin: Per memetipsum juravi, dicit Dominus: quia fecisti hanc rem, et non pepercisti filio tuo unigenito:
verses.english: saying, 'By Myself I have sworn, declares the Lord. Because you have done this and have not withheld your only son—'

verses.latin: benedicam tibi, et multiplicabo semen tuum sicut stellas caeli, et velut arenam quæ est in littore maris: possidebit semen tuum portas inimicorum suorum.
verses.english: '—I will surely bless you and multiply your descendants as countless as the stars in the sky and the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will possess the gates of their enemies.'

verses.latin: Et benedicentur in semine tuo omnes gentes terræ, quia obedisti voci meæ.
verses.english: 'Through your offspring, all the nations of the earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed My voice.'

verses.latin: Reversus est Abraham ad pueros suos, et Abierunt Bersabee simul, et habitavit ibi.
verses.english: Then Abraham returned to his servants, and together they went to Beersheba. And Abraham settled there.

verses.latin: His itaque gestis, nuntiatum est Abraham dicens: Ecce Melcha quoque peperit filios Nahor fratri tuo.
verses.english: After these events, Abraham received a message, saying, 'Listen! Your brother Nahor’s wife, Milcah, has also given birth to sons!'

verses.latin: Hus primogenitum, et Buz fratrem ejus, et Camuel patrem Syrorum,
verses.english: These are their names: Huz, his firstborn, Buz, his brother, and Kemuel, who became the father of the Aramean people.

verses.latin: et Cased, et Azau, Pheldas quoque, et Jedlaph, et Bathuel, ex quo natus est Rebecca.
verses.english: Also Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel. It was from Bethuel that Rebekah was born.

verses.latin: Octo istos genuit Melcha, Nahor fratri Abraham.
verses.english: These eight sons Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

verses.latin: Et concubina illius, nomine Reuma, peperit Tabee, et Gaham, et Thahas, et Maacha.
verses.english: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore children: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

verses.latin: Vixitque Sara centum viginti septem annis.
verses.english: And Sarah lived for one hundred and twenty-seven years.

verses.latin: Et mortua est in civitate Arbee, quae est Hebron in terra Chanaan: venitque Abraham ut plangeret et fleret eam.
verses.english: And she died in the city of Arbee, which is Hebron in the land of Canaan. So Abraham came to mourn and to weep for her.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexisset a mortui officio, locutus est ad filios Heth, dicens:
verses.english: After Abraham had finished with his duties concerning the deceased, he spoke to the sons of Heth, saying:

verses.latin: Advena et peregrinus sum apud vos: date mihi possessionem sepulchri apud vos, ut sepeliam mortuum meum.
verses.english: “I am a foreigner and a sojourner among you. Grant me a place to bury my dead among you, so that I can bury my deceased wife.”

verses.latin: Responderuntque filii Heth ad Abraham, dicentes:
verses.english: And the sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying:

verses.latin: Audi nos, domine: princeps Dei es apud nos: in optimis sepulchris nostris sepeli mortuum tuum, nullusque te prohibebit, quin in sepulchro suo mortuum tuum sepelias.
verses.english: “Listen to us, my lord. You are a mighty leader sent by God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our burial places. No one among us will refuse you from burying your dead in his own burial place.”

verses.latin: Surrexit Abraham, et adoravit populum terrae, filios videlicet Heth:
verses.english: Abraham then stood up and bowed down respectfully before the people of the land, that is, the sons of Heth.

verses.latin: et locutus est ad eos, dicens: Si placet animae vestrae ut sepeliam mortuum meum, audite me, et intercedite pro me apud Ephron filium Seor:
verses.english: And he spoke to them, saying, “If you are truly willing for me to bury my dead, then hear me and intercede for me with Ephron, the son of Zohar.”

verses.latin: ut det mihi speluncam duplicem, quam habet in extrema parte agri sui, pecunia plena tradet mihi eam coram vobis in possessionem sepulchri.
verses.english: “Tell him to give me the double-chambered cave that he owns at the far end of his field. He must sell it to me for its full price in silver, in your presence, so that I may possess it as a burial place.”

verses.latin: Habitabat autem Ephron in medio filiorum Heth. Et respondit Ephron ad Abraham, cunctis audientibus qui ingrediebantur portam civitatis illius, dicens:
verses.english: Now Ephron was dwelling among the sons of Heth. And Ephron answered Abraham in the hearing of all those who were entering the gate of his city, saying:

verses.latin: Nequaquam, mi domine, sed magis tu accipe agrum, et speluncam quae in illo est, gratis tibi do, praesentibus filiis populi mei, sepeli mortuum tuum.
verses.english: “By no means, my lord! I give you the field itself, and the cave which is in it, freely to you. In the presence of the sons of my people, you may bury your dead.”

verses.latin: Adoravit Abraham coram populo terrae:
verses.english: Abraham then bowed down before the people of the land.

verses.latin: et locutus est ad Ephron in audientia populi terrae, dicens: Obsecro te, ut audias me: pecuniam pro agro tribuo tibi: suscipe eam, et sic sepeliam mortuum meum apud te.
verses.english: And he spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “I beg you, hear me! I will give you money for the field. Accept it from me, and so I may bury my dead there with you.”

verses.latin: Responditque Ephron:
verses.english: And Ephron answered him:

verses.latin: Mi domine, audi me: terra centum argenti talentis aestimanda est: hoc est pretium inter me et te: et quid est tantum? Sepeli mortuum tuum.
verses.english: “My lord, hear me. The land is valued at one hundred talents of silver. What is that amount between you and me? Just bury your dead.”

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Abraham, appendit pecuniam quam postulaverat Ephron, centum scilicet siclos argenti publici ponderis.
verses.english: When Abraham heard this, he weighed out the money that Ephron had demanded: one hundred shekels of silver, according to the standard public weight.

verses.latin: Confirmatusque est ager Ephronis, in quo erat spelunca duplex, respiciens Mambre, tam ipse, quam spelunca et omnes arbores ejus per circuitum:
verses.english: And so, Ephron's field, which contained the double-chambered cave facing Mamre, was legally transferred. Both the field itself, the cave, and all the trees within its boundaries, were legally confirmed.

verses.latin: Abrahae in possessionem, videntibus filiis Heth, et cunctis qui ingrediebantur portam civitatis illius.
verses.english: It was transferred to Abraham as a permanent possession, witnessed by the sons of Heth and all who entered the gate of that city.

verses.latin: Atque ita sepelivit Abraham Saram uxorem suam in spelunca agri duplici, quae respiciebat Mambre, haec est Hebron in terra Chanaan.
verses.english: And so Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the double-chambered cave of the field that faced Mamre, which is Hebron in the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: Et confirmatus est ager et spelunca quae in eo erat, Abrahae in possessionem sepulchri a filiis Heth.
verses.english: And the field, along with the cave within it, was legally confirmed to Abraham by the sons of Heth as a permanent burial possession.

verses.latin: Erat autem Abraham senex, et dierum multorum: et Dominus in omnibus benedixerat ei.
verses.english: Abraham was now very old and had lived many years, and the Lord had blessed him in everything he did and possessed.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad servum suum, primogenitum domus suae, qui praeerat omnibus quae habebat:
verses.english: He said to his senior servant, the one in charge of his entire household, and who managed all of Abraham's possessions:

verses.latin: Jura, inquit, per Dominum Deum caeli et terrae, ut non accipias uxorem filio meo de filiabus Chanaan, inter quos habito.
verses.english: He said to him, 'Swear an oath by the Lord, the God of the universe and the earth, that you will not choose a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I now live.

verses.latin: Sed ad terram et cognationem meam proficisceris, et inde accipies uxorem filio meo Isaac.
verses.english: Instead, you must go to my own country and to my own relatives, and there you will find a wife for my son, Isaac.'

verses.latin: Respondit servus: Si noluerit mulier venire mecum in terram hanc, num reducere debeo filium tuum ad locum, de quo existi?
verses.english: The servant replied, 'But what if the woman is unwilling to follow me back to this land? Must I then take your son back to the land you came from?'

verses.latin: Cave, inquit, ne unquam illuc reducas filium meum.
verses.english: Abraham responded, 'Under no circumstances are you to take my son back there!'

verses.latin: Dominus Deus caeli, qui tulit me de domo patris mei, et de terra nativitatis meae, qui locutus est mihi, et juravit dicens: Semini tuo dabo terram hanc:
verses.english: The Lord, the God of the universe, who took me from my father's house and from the land where I was born—He is the one who spoke to me and swore an oath, saying: 'I will give this land to your descendants.'

verses.latin: ipse mittet angelum suum ante te, et accipies inde uxorem filio meo.
verses.english: He himself will send His angel ahead of you, and you will successfully find a wife there for my son.

verses.latin: Sin autem mulier noluerit sequi te, innocens eris ab hoc juramento: tantum filium meum illuc non reducas.
verses.english: However, if the woman is unwilling to follow you, then you will be released from this oath. Just do not take my son back to that place.'

verses.latin: Subjecit ergo servus manum suam sub femore Abraham domini sui, et juravit illi super sermone hoc.
verses.english: So the servant placed his hand under the thigh of Abraham, his master, and swore an oath to him concerning this matter.

verses.latin: Tulitque decem camelos de grege domini sui, et de universis bonis ejus secum, profectusque est in Mesopotamiam, ad urbem Nachor.
