verses.latin: hoc est quod dixi Pharaoni: Deus ostendit tibi quæ mox sunt futura.
verses.english: 'This is what I have told Pharaoh: God has shown you what is soon to happen.'

verses.latin: Ecce septem anni venient, magnæ ubertatis in universa terra Aegypti:
verses.english: 'Behold, seven years are coming, years of great abundance throughout all the land of Egypt.'

verses.latin: quos sequentur septem alii anni tantæ sterilitatis, ut oblivioni tradatur omnis prior ubertas de terra Aegypti: consumptura est enim fames terram.
verses.english: 'These will be followed by seven other years of such severe famine that all the previous abundance in the land of Egypt will be completely forgotten. The famine will utterly consume the land.'

verses.latin: Et non residui erit ubertatis propter magnitudinem famis sequentis: quæ omnem terram consumet.
verses.english: 'There will be no remaining sign of the former abundance because of the severity of the famine that follows, which will utterly consume the entire land.'

verses.latin: Quod autem secundo somnio vidisti eandem rem: ad firmandum est sermonem a Deo, et velox executionis ejus effectus.
verses.english: 'The fact that you saw the same matter in a second dream means that the word is firmly established by God, and He will swiftly bring it to pass.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo provideat Pharao virum sapientem et industrium, et præficiat eum terræ Aegypti:
verses.english: 'Therefore, let Pharaoh now find a wise and discerning man and appoint him over the land of Egypt.'

verses.latin: qui constituat præpositos per singulas civitates: et quintam partem fructuum per septem annos ubertatis, qui jam venturi sunt, reponat in horrea.
verses.english: 'Let this man appoint overseers in every city to gather and store a fifth part of all the produce of the land of Egypt during the coming seven years of abundance.'

verses.latin: Omnemque frumenti copiam, quæ sufficiet annis famis, quinque, reponatur in urbibus, et custodiatur:
verses.english: 'Let all the surplus grain, which will be sufficient for the five years of famine, be stored in the cities and kept securely.'

verses.latin: et sit parata annis septem famis, quæ ventura est Aegypto, et non consumetur terra inopia.
verses.english: 'Let this grain be ready for the seven years of famine that will come upon Egypt, so that the land may not be ruined by scarcity.'

verses.latin: Placuit Pharaoni et cunctis ministris ejus consilium.
verses.english: Pharaoh and all his officials were pleased with this advice.

verses.latin: Locutusque est ad eos: Num invenire poterimus talem virum, qui spiritum Dei habeat in semetipso?
verses.english: Then Pharaoh said to his officials, 'Can we find anyone else like this man, in whom the Spirit of God is present?'

verses.latin: Dixit ergo ad Joseph: Quia Deus ostendit tibi omnia quæ locutus es, numquid potero reperire te prudentiorem et simili ratione?
verses.english: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, 'Since God has shown you all that you have spoken, surely I will not be able to find anyone wiser or with such discernment as you.'

verses.latin: Tu eris super domum meam, et ad tui oris imperium cunctus populus meus obedit: uno tantum regni solio te præcedam.
verses.english: 'You shall be in charge of my household, and all my people will obey your every command. Only in the royal throne itself will I be greater than you.'

verses.latin: Videns autem Jacob quod in Aegypto vendebantur alimenta, dixit filiis suis: Quid segnes estis?
verses.english: Jacob saw that grain and food were being sold in Egypt. He asked his sons, "Why are you just sitting here doing nothing?"

verses.latin: Audivi, inquit, quod alimenta venumdarentur in Aegypto: descendite, et emite nobis necessaria, ut possimus vivere, et non fame moriamur.
verses.english: He continued, "I have heard that food is available for purchase in Egypt. Go down there and buy what we need to survive, so that we do not die of starvation."

verses.latin: Descenderunt igitur fratres Joseph decem, ut emerent sibi frumenta de Aegypto.
verses.english: So ten of Joseph's brothers went down to Egypt to buy grain for themselves and their families.

verses.latin: Benjamin vero, fratrem Joseph minorem, noluit Jacob mittere cum fratribus suis, timens ne quid ei accideret in via discriminis.
verses.english: But Jacob did not want to send Benjamin, Joseph's younger brother, with his other brothers. He was afraid that something terrible might happen to him on the journey.

verses.latin: Ingressi sunt filii Israel cum aliis qui pergebant ut emerent, (terra enim Chanaan fame premebatur.)
verses.english: The sons of Israel arrived in Egypt along with many others who had also come to buy food, because the land of Canaan was suffering greatly from the famine.

verses.latin: Joseph autem erat princeps in terra Aegypti, et ipse vendebat frumenta populis. Cumque adorassent eum fratres sui, et procidissent proni in terram,
verses.english: Joseph, as it happened, was the governor of the entire land of Egypt, and he was the one selling grain to all the people. When his brothers came before him, they bowed down with their faces to the ground in reverence.

verses.latin: et vidisset eos, recordatus est somniorum, quae aliquando viderat. Et quasi alienos dura loquebatur ad illos, dicens: Unde venistis? Qui responderunt: De terra Chanaan, ut emamus necessaria vitae.
verses.english: Joseph saw them and immediately remembered the dreams he had once had about them. He spoke harshly to them, as if they were strangers, asking, "Where do you come from?" They replied, "From the land of Canaan, to buy necessities for life."

verses.latin: Cognovitque illos, et ipsi ignorabant.
verses.english: Joseph recognized them, but they did not recognize him.

verses.latin: Retentis paulisper, dixit: Exploratores estis: ut videatis infirma terrae hujus, venistis.
verses.english: He held them there for a short time and then said, "You are spies! You have come to find the vulnerable points of this land."

verses.latin: At illi responderunt: Non est ita, domine noster, sed servi tui venerunt ut emerent cibos.
verses.english: But they answered him, "No, my lord, that is not true. Your servants have only come to buy food."

verses.latin: Omnes filii viri unius sumus: pacifici. Non venimus ad hoc, ut quicquam mali faciamus.
verses.english: "We are all the sons of one man; we are honest people. We have not come here to do any harm."

verses.latin: Ait illis: An non? infirma terrae hujus scire voluistis.
verses.english: Joseph said to them, "No! You have indeed come to discover the vulnerable parts of this land."

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Duodecim servi tui sumus fratres, filii viri unius in terra Chanaan: minimus cum patre nostro est, alius non est super.
verses.english: They replied, "Your servants are twelve brothers, sons of one man in the land of Canaan. The youngest is currently with our father, and another brother is no longer with us."

verses.latin: Et Joseph, probans illos, ait: Hoc est quod dixi: Exploratores estis.
verses.english: Joseph, testing them, said, "This confirms what I said: You are spies!"

verses.latin: Per hanc rem probabimini: Salute Pharaonis, non egrediemini hinc, donec frater vester minimus veniat in his locis.
verses.english: "By this method, you will be tested. I swear by the life of Pharaoh himself, you will not leave this place until your youngest brother comes here."

verses.latin: Mittite ex vobis unum, et adducat eum: vos autem carcerem custodiamini, donec probentur quae dixistis, utrum vera an falsa sint.
verses.english: "Send one of you back to bring him here. The rest of you will be kept imprisoned until what you have said can be proven true or false."

verses.latin: Tradidit illos custodiae trium dierum.
verses.english: And so he held them in custody for three days.

verses.latin: In die autem tertio eduxit eos de carcere, et ait: Facite quae dixi, et vivetis: Deum enim timeo.
verses.english: On the third day, he brought them out of the prison and said to them, "Do this one thing, and you will live, for I fear God."

verses.latin: Si pacifici estis, frater vestrum unus ligetur in carcere: vos autem ire, et deferte frumenta quae emistis, in domos vestras:
verses.english: "If you truly are honest people, then let one of your brothers be kept bound in the prison. The rest of you may go and take the grain you have purchased back to your homes."

verses.latin: et fratrem vestrum minimum adducite ad me, ut probem sermones vestros, et non moriamini. Fecerunt ut dixerat.
verses.english: "Then bring your youngest brother to me so I can verify your claims. If you do this, you will not die." They did as he had instructed.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad invicem: Merito haec patimur, quia peccavimus in fratrem nostrum, videntes angustias animae illius, dum oraretur non audivimus. Idcirco venit super nos ista tribulatio.
verses.english: They spoke to each other, saying, "We truly deserve to suffer this, because we sinned against our brother Joseph. We saw the distress of his soul when he pleaded with us, but we refused to listen to him. That is why this tribulation has come upon us now."

verses.latin: Inter quos Ruben ait: Numquid non dixi vobis: Nolite peccare in puerum, et non audistis me? En sanguis ejus exquiritur.
verses.english: Reuben said to them, "Did I not tell you, 'Do not sin against the boy'? But you would not listen to me! Now, surely, the price for his blood is being demanded of us."

verses.latin: Nesciebant autem quod intelligeret Joseph, eo quod per interpretem loqueretur ad eos.
verses.english: They did not know that Joseph understood everything they were saying, because he was speaking to them through an interpreter.

verses.latin: Avertitque se paululum, et flevit. Et reversus locutus est ad eos: et comprehendens Simeon, ligavit eum coram illis.
verses.english: Joseph turned away from them for a moment and wept. Then he turned back and spoke to them. He took Simeon and had him bound in chains right there in front of their eyes.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Joseph ut implerent saccos eorum frumento, et reponerent pecunias singulorum in saccis suis, datis supra cibariis in viam: qui fecerunt ita.
verses.english: Joseph then gave orders for their sacks to be filled with grain. He also commanded that each man's money be secretly returned to his sack and that they be given provisions for their journey. His servants did exactly as he instructed.

verses.latin: At illi imponentes frumenta asinis suis, profecti sunt.
verses.english: So the brothers loaded the grain onto their donkeys and departed.

verses.latin: Apertoque unus est saccus ut daret jumento pabulum in diversorio, videt pecuniam in ore sacculi,
verses.english: As one of them opened his sack to feed his donkey at the lodging place, he saw his money right there at the mouth of the sack.

verses.latin: et dixit fratribus suis: Reddita est mihi pecunia mea, ecce habetur in sacco. Et obstupefacti turbatique sunt ad invicem, dicentes: Quid hoc est quod fecit nobis Deus?
verses.english: He cried out to his brothers, "My money has been returned to me! Look, it is right here in my sack!" They were astonished and troubled, asking each other, "What is this that God has done to us?"

verses.latin: Veneruntque ad Jacob patrem suum in terram Chanaan, narrantes ei omnia quæ acciderant sibi, dicentes:
verses.english: When they arrived back to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him everything that had happened to them, saying:

verses.latin: Locutus est nobis dominus terræ dure, ac putavit nos exploratores regionis.
verses.english: "The lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of being spies in his territory."

verses.latin: Cui respondimus: Pacifici sumus, nec ullis insidiamur.
verses.english: "We told him, 'We are honest men; we are not plotting against anyone.'"

verses.latin: Duodecim fratres sumus, filii patris unius: unus non est super, minimus cum patre nostro est in terra Chanaan.
verses.english: "We are twelve brothers, sons of one father. One of us is no longer living, and the youngest is currently with our father in the land of Canaan."

verses.latin: Qui ait: In hoc probabo quod pacifici sitis: unum de fratribus vestris dimittite apud me, et alimenta domibus vestris necesssaria sumite, et abite.
verses.english: "Then he said, 'By this I will prove that you are honest people: leave one of your brothers with me. Take the necessary food for your households and go on your way.'"

verses.latin: Et fratrem vestrum minimum adducite ad me, ut sciam quod non sitis exploratores, et hunc qui tenetur, recipere possitis, et de cetero libere mercari.
verses.english: "Then bring your youngest brother to me, so I can know that you are not spies. Then you can have your imprisoned brother back, and you will be free to trade in this land.'"

verses.latin: His dictis, cum effunderent saccos, invenit unusquisque fasciculos pecuniæ in sacco suo: et exterriti simul cum patre suo, expaverunt.
verses.english: As they were telling this, they emptied their sacks. And behold, each man found his own pouch of money inside his sack! They and their father were terrified when they saw this.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jacob: Absque liberis me fecistis: Joseph non est super, Simeon retentus est, et Benjamin auferetis. In me hæc omnia mala redundarunt.
verses.english: Jacob cried out, "You have left me without my children! Joseph is no more, Simeon has been kept from me, and now you want to take Benjamin away! All these misfortunes have fallen upon me!"

verses.latin: Cui respondit Ruben: Duos filios meos interfice, si non reduxero illum ad te: trade illum in manu mea, et ego eum reducam.
verses.english: Reuben responded to him, "You may kill my two sons if I do not bring Benjamin back to you. Entrust him into my care, and I myself will bring him back."

verses.latin: At ille: Non, inquit, descendet filius meus vobiscum: quia frater ejus mortuus est, et ipse solus superest: si quid ei universi fuerit in via hac in qua pergitis, deducetis canos meos cum dolore ad inferos.
verses.english: But Jacob insisted, "My son will not go down to Egypt with you. His brother Joseph is dead, and he is the only son of Rachel left to me. If any harm were to befall him on this journey you are making, you would bring my gray hairs down to the grave in sorrow."

verses.latin: Interea fames ingravescebat in terra;
verses.english: The famine continued to grow more severe in all the land.

verses.latin: cumque consumpsissent omnia, quae de Aegypto attulerant, dixit Jacob filiis suis: Revertimini, et emite nobis modicum escarum.
verses.english: After they had eaten all the grain they had brought back from Egypt, Jacob told his sons, "Go back to Egypt and buy a little more food for us."

verses.latin: Respondit Judas: Denuntiavit nobis vir ille sub jurejurando, dicens: Non videbitis faciem meam, nisi parvulum fratrem vestrum vobiscum duxeritis.
verses.english: Judah answered his father, "The man warned us with a solemn oath, saying, 'You will not see my face again unless your youngest brother is with you.'"

verses.latin: Si ergo vis mittere eum nobiscum, proficiscemur simul, et ememus tibi necessaria:
verses.english: "So if you are willing to send Benjamin with us, we will go down and buy food for you."

verses.latin: sin autem nolueris, non ibimus: quia, ut sæpe diximus, vir ille denuntiavit nobis, dicens: Non videbitis faciem meam, nisi parvulum fratrem vestrum vobiscum habueritis.
verses.english: "But if you refuse to send him, we will not go down, because, as we have told you many times, that man explicitly warned us, saying, 'You will not see my face unless your youngest brother is with you.'"

verses.latin: Dixit eis Israel: Mala me fecistis, eo quod indicastis illi alium quoque habere vos filium.
verses.english: Israel, also known as Jacob, said to them, "Why have you brought such trouble upon me by telling that man you had another son?"

verses.latin: At illi responderunt: Interrogavit nos homo per singula de progenie nostra, si pater viveret, si habere mus fratrem: et respondimus ei juxta id, quod sciscitabatur. Numquid scire poteramus, quod diceret: Adducite fratrem vestrum vobiscum?
verses.english: But they answered, "The man questioned us very carefully about our family lineage, asking if our father was still alive, and if we had another brother. We answered him exactly according to what he asked. How could we possibly know that he would demand, 'Bring your brother with you?'"

verses.latin: Judas quoque dixit patri suo: Mitte puerum mecum, ut proficiscamur, et possimus vivere, ne moriamur, tam nos, quam tu, et parvuli nostri.
verses.english: Judah also said to his father, "Send the young man with me, so that we can leave right away. Then we can all live and not die of starvation—not only us, but also you and our little children."

verses.latin: Ego spondeo pro puero, de manu mea require illius animam: nisi reduxero et statuero eum coram te, criminis reus ero in te omni tempore.
verses.english: "I will guarantee the young man's safety. Hold me personally responsible for his life. If I do not bring him back to you and present him before you, then I will bear the guilt forever."

verses.latin: Si non sic ægre prodissemus, jam secundo huc veniremus.
verses.english: "If we had not delayed so much, we could have already gone and come back a second time."

verses.latin: Igitur Israel, pater eorum, dixit eis: Si sic necesse est, facite quod vultis: sumite de optimis fructibus terræ in vasis vestris, et deferte viro munera, modicum resinæ, et mellis, et styracis, et myrrhæ, et terebinthi, et amygdalæ.
verses.english: So their father Israel said to them, "If it must be this way, then do what you must. Take some of the best produce of the land in your bags, and take a gift to the man: a little balm, a little honey, some gum tragacanth, some myrrh, some pistachios, and some almonds."

verses.latin: Pecuniam quoque duplicem ferte vobiscum, et eam quam invenistis in sacculis, reportate: ne forte per errorem factum sit.
verses.english: "Also, take double the amount of money with you, and take back the money that you found in your sacks. Perhaps it was put there by mistake."

verses.latin: Sed et fratrem vestrum assumite, et ite ad virum.
verses.english: "And take your brother Benjamin with you, and go back to the man."

verses.latin: Deus autem meus omnipotens faciat vobis patrem misericordem coram viro, et remittat vobiscum fratrem vestrum quem tenet, et hunc Benjamin. Ego vero quasi orbatus et absque liberis sum.
verses.english: "May my all-powerful God grant you mercy before the man, and may he send back your other brother, whom he is holding, along with this Benjamin. As for me, I feel as though I am already bereaved and childless."

verses.latin: Tulerunt ergo viri munera, et pecuniam duplicem, et Benjamin: et profecti sunt in Aegyptum, et steterunt coram Joseph.
verses.english: So the men took the gifts, and double the money, and Benjamin. They set off for Egypt and stood before Joseph.

verses.latin: Quos cum vidisset Joseph, et Benjamin simul, præcepit dispensatori domus suæ, dicens: Introduc viros domum, et occide victimas, et para cœnam: mecum est enim ut comedant meridie.
verses.english: When Joseph saw them with Benjamin, he instructed the steward of his house, saying, "Bring these men into the house. Slaughter an animal and prepare a feast, for they are to dine with me at noon."

verses.latin: Fecit ille, ut Joseph sibi imperaverat, et introduxit viros in domum.
verses.english: The steward did exactly as Joseph commanded him and brought the men into Joseph's house.

verses.latin: At illi, introducti, timuerunt, et dixerunt: Propter pecuniam, quam retulimus in prioribus saccis, introducti sumus, ut devolvant in nos calumniam, et violenter nos opprimant, et accipiant nos servos, et asinos nostros.
verses.english: But the men, once brought inside, were afraid. They said, "We have been brought in because of the money that was returned in our sacks the first time. They want to frame us and violently seize us, taking us and our donkeys as slaves."

verses.latin: Quam ob rem, accendentes ad dispensatorem domus,
verses.english: Therefore, they approached the steward of Joseph's house and spoke to him at the entrance.

verses.latin: loquuti sunt ad fores:
verses.english: (Continuing from the previous verse) "O sir, we really did come down here the first time to buy food."

verses.latin: Oramus, domine, prius descendimus ut emeremus escas: revertentesque ad deversorium, aperuimus saccos nostros, et invenimus pecuniam in ore saccorum: quam nunc eodem pondere reportavimus.
verses.english: "But when we returned to the inn and opened our sacks, we found each man's money right there at the mouth of his sack. We have now brought it back, exactly the same weight."

verses.latin: Sed et aliud attulimus, ut emamus necessaria: nescimus quis posuerit in saccis nostris.
verses.english: "We have also brought other money with us to buy more food. We truly do not know who put the money in our sacks the first time."

verses.latin: At ille respondit: Pacem habete, nolite timere: Deus vester, et Deus patris vestri, dedit vobis thesauros in saccis vestris. Nam et pecuniam, quam dedistis mihi, probatam ego habeo. Et eduxit ad eos Simeonem.
verses.english: But the steward replied, "Peace be with you. Do not be afraid. Your God, and the God of your father, must have given you treasure in your sacks. I assure you, I received your money the first time." Then he brought Simeon out to them.

verses.latin: Et introductis domum viris, attulit aquam, et laverunt pedes suos: deditque pabulatores asinis eorum.
verses.english: After he had brought the men into the house, he brought water for them to wash their feet and provided fodder for their donkeys.

verses.latin: Paraverunt autem munera, donec veniret Joseph in meridie: audierant enim quod ibi essent comesturi panem.
verses.english: They prepared their gifts until Joseph arrived at noon, for they had heard that they were to eat the meal there.

verses.latin: Ingressus est autem Joseph domum suam: obtuleruntque ei munera, tenentes in manibus suis: et adoraverunt eum proni in terram.
verses.english: When Joseph came into his house, they presented him with the gifts they held in their hands, and they bowed down before him, with their faces to the ground.

verses.latin: At ille, clementer eos salutans, interrogavit eos, dicens: Salvus est pater vester senex, de quo dixistis mihi? adhuc vivit?
verses.english: He greeted them kindly and asked, "Is your aged father, whom you spoke of to me, well? Is he still alive?"

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Sanus est servus tuus pater noster, adhuc vivit. Et incurvantes se, adoraverunt eum.
verses.english: They replied, "Your servant, our father, is well and still alive." Then they bowed down and prostrated themselves again before him.

verses.latin: Elevatis autem Joseph oculis, vidit Benjamin fratrem suum, uterinum filium matris suæ, et ait: Iste est frater vester parvulus, de quo dixistis mihi? Deus, inquit, propitius sit tibi, fili mi.
verses.english: And Joseph, looking up, saw his brother Benjamin, his own mother's son, and asked, "Is this your youngest brother, about whom you told me?" Then he added, "May God be gracious to you, my son."

verses.latin: Festinavit, et egressus est, quia commota fuerant viscera ejus super fratre suo, et eruperunt lacrimæ: intrabatque cubiculum, et flebat.
verses.english: Joseph hurried away and went into his private room, because his heart was deeply moved with tender affection for his brother, and he began to weep. He went into his chamber and wept there.

verses.latin: Lotique faciem suam, et egressus, continuit se, et ait: Ponite panes.
verses.english: After he had washed his face and composed himself, he came out and said, "Serve the food."

verses.latin: Cumque apposuissent ei seorsum, et illis seorsum, Aegyptiis quoque, qui simul vescebantur, seorsum: (neque enim poterant Aegyptii comedere cum Hebræis, abominatio est enim Aegyptiis tale convivium.)
verses.english: They served Joseph by himself, and his brothers by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves—because Egyptians could not eat with Hebrews, as such a shared meal was considered detestable to the Egyptians.

verses.latin: Sederunt autem coram eo, primogenitus juxta primogenitum, et minimus juxta minimum. Mirabantur omnes, et ad se invicem loquebantur.
verses.english: So the brothers were seated before Joseph, arranged from the eldest to the youngest. All of them were astonished, looking at each other in wonder.

verses.latin: Tollebatque escas de mensa sua, et dabat eis. Majorque pars cecidit Benjamin, ita ut quinque partibus ceteros excederet. Biberuntque, et inebriati sunt cum eo.
verses.english: Joseph then had portions of food taken from his own table and given to them. Benjamin's portion was five times larger than any of the others. And they drank and feasted joyfully with him.

verses.latin: Praecepit autem Joseph dispensatori domus suae, dicens: Imple saccos eorum frumento quantum possunt capere, et pone pecuniam singulorum in summitate sacci sui:
verses.english: Joseph then gave his house steward a command, saying: 'Fill their sacks with as much grain as they can carry, and put each man's money on top, in his sack.'

verses.latin: Scyphema vero meum argenteum, et pretium ejus, pones in ore sacci junioris.
verses.english: 'But my own silver cup, and the money for it, you are to put into the mouth of the youngest man’s sack.'

verses.latin: Qui cum mane surrexissent, et asinos suos onustassent, egressi sunt ex urbe.
verses.english: When they woke up in the morning and loaded their donkeys, they left the city.

verses.latin: Iamque progressis, et parvo intervallo viæ emenso, advocavit Joseph dispensatorem domus suae, et ait: Surge, persequere viros: et apprehensis dicito: Quare reddidistis malum pro bono?
verses.english: Now, after they had gone a short distance, Joseph called his house steward and said: 'Get up and pursue those men! When you catch them, ask: Why have you repaid good with evil?'

verses.latin: Scyphema quem furati estis, ipse est in quo bibit dominus meus, et in quo divinationem facit: pessimam rem fecistis.
verses.english: 'The cup you have stolen is the one my master drinks from and uses for divination. You have done a very wicked thing.'

verses.latin: Ille persequutus, apprehendit eos, et locutus est ad illos omnia verba, quæ jusserat.
verses.english: The steward pursued them, caught up, and said all the words Joseph had commanded him.

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Quare loquitur dominus noster sic, sicut servi tui? absit a nobis ut rem tantam fecerimus.
verses.english: They replied: 'Why does our lord speak to his servants this way? Far be it from us to do such a thing!'

verses.latin: Pecuniam, quam invenimus in summitate saccorum nostrorum, retulimus ad te de terra Chanaan: et quomodo possumus furari aut argentum, aut aurum, de domo domini tui?
verses.english: 'We brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money we found at the top of our sacks. How could we steal silver or gold from your master's house?'

verses.latin: Apud quemcumque fuerit inventum servorum tuorum scyphema, moriatur, et nos erimus servi domini nostri.
verses.english: 'If the cup is found with any of your servants, let that man die, and the rest of us will become your master's servants.'

verses.latin: Qui dixit: Fiat juxta vestram sententiam. Apud quemcumque fuerit inventum, ipse sit mihi servus: vos autem eritis innocentes.
verses.english: The steward replied: 'Let it be as you say. The man with whom it is found will become my servant, but you others will be innocent.'

verses.latin: Festinato igitur deposuerunt in terram saccos suos, et aperuerunt singuli.
verses.english: So they quickly lowered their sacks to the ground and each man opened his.

verses.latin: Quos scrutatus, a majore incipiens usque ad minimum, invenit scyphema in sacco Benjamin.
verses.english: The steward searched, starting with the oldest and going down to the youngest, and he found the cup in Benjamin’s sack.

verses.latin: Subito scissis vestimentis suis, reversique in oppidum, onustaverunt asinos.
verses.english: Immediately, they tore their clothes in grief, loaded their donkeys again, and returned to the city.

verses.latin: Iuda ergo et fratres ejus, introierunt domum Joseph, necdum illo egresso: et prostrati coram eo in terram
verses.english: So Judah and his brothers entered Joseph’s house while he was still there. They prostrated themselves before him on the ground.

verses.latin: ad quos ille ait: Cur sic agere voluistis? an ignoratis quia non sit similis mei ad conjecturandum?
verses.english: Joseph asked them: 'Why did you want to act this way? Do you not know that no one like me can divine what is hidden?'

verses.latin: Cui respondit Judas: Quid loquemur domino nostro? aut quid loqui poterimus? vel juste quid respondere? Deus invenit iniquitatem servorum tuorum: en nos omnes servi sumus domini nostri, et nos, et apud quem inventum est scyphema.
verses.english: Judah replied: 'What can we say to our lord? What can we speak? Or how can we respond justly? God has found the iniquity of your servants. Look, all of us are now servants of our lord, both we and the man with whom the cup was found.'

verses.latin: Cui Joseph respondit: Absit a me ut sic faciam: qui furatus est scyphema, ipse sit mihi servus: vos autem abite liberi ad patrem vestrum.
verses.english: Joseph answered: 'Far be it from me to do that! The man who stole the cup, he alone will be my servant. But you others, go up freely to your father.'

verses.latin: Accessit igitur ad eum Judas, et ait: Oro, domine mi, loquatur servus tuus verbum in auribus tuis, et ne irascaris famulo tuo, quoniam tu es sicut Pharao.
verses.english: Then Judah approached him and said: 'Please, my lord, let your servant speak a word in your hearing, and do not be angry with your servant, for you are as powerful as Pharaoh himself.'

verses.latin: Dominus meus interrogavit nos, dicens: Habetis patrem, aut fratrem?
verses.english: 'My lord asked us, saying: Do you have a father or a brother?'

verses.latin: Et respondimus ei: Est nobis pater senex, et puer parvulus, qui in senectute illius natus est: cujus frater mortuus est, et ipsum solum habet de matre sua, et hunc valde diligit.
verses.english: 'And we answered him: We have an aged father, and a young boy born to him in his old age. His brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother's children, and our father truly loves him.'

verses.latin: Dixistique servis tuis: Adducite eum ad me, et ego intuebor eum.
verses.english: 'You also said to your servants: Bring him down to me, so I may look at him.'

verses.latin: Respondimus: Non potest puer relinquere patrem suum: si enim reliquerit, morietur.
verses.english: 'We replied: The boy cannot leave his father. If he were to leave, his father would die.'

verses.latin: Et dixisti servis tuis: Nisi venerit frater vester minimus vobiscum, non videbitis amplius faciem meam.
verses.english: 'And you said to your servants: Unless your youngest brother comes with you, you will not see my face again.'

verses.latin: Cum ergo ascendissemus ad famulum tuum patrem nostrum, retulimus ei omnia quæ locutus est dominus meus.
verses.english: 'So when we went up to your servant, our father, we told him everything our lord had said.'

verses.latin: Et dixit pater noster: Revertimini, et emite nobis parum tritici.
verses.english: 'And our father said: Go back and buy us a little grain.'

verses.latin: Cui diximus: Non possumus ire: si frater noster minimus descenderit nobiscum, proficiscemur simul: alioquin absente eo, non audemus videre faciem viri.
verses.english: 'To which we said: We cannot go. If our youngest brother comes down with us, then we will go together. Otherwise, without him, we do not dare to see the man’s face.'

verses.latin: Ad quæ respondit pater: Vos scitis quod duos filios habuerim de uxore mea.
verses.english: 'To this our father replied: You yourselves know that I had two sons by my wife.'

verses.latin: Unus egressus est, et dixistis: Fera devoravit eum: et usque in præsentem diem nescitis ubi sit.
verses.english: 'One left, and you said: A wild beast devoured him. And until the present day, you do not know where he is.'

verses.latin: Hunc quoque si tuleritis, et aliquid ei in via contigerit, deducetis canos meos cum dolore ad inferos.
verses.english: 'If you also take this one, and anything happens to him on the journey, you will bring my gray hairs down to the grave in sorrow.'

verses.latin: Si igitur intravero ad servum tuum patrem nostrum, et puer non fuerit mecum, (cujus anima ex anima illius pendet)
verses.english: 'Therefore, if I go to your servant, our father, and the boy is not with me—whose very life is bound up with his father's—'

verses.latin: videntem subito puerum non esse, morietur, et deducent famuli tui canos ejus cum moerore ad inferos.
verses.english: 'when he suddenly sees that the boy is not there, he will die. And your servants will bring his gray hairs down to the grave in sorrow.'

verses.latin: Ego spopondi pro puero patri meo, dicens: Nisi reduxero eum, peccati reus ero patri meo cunctis diebus.
verses.english: 'I myself guaranteed the boy's safety to my father, saying: If I do not bring him back to you, I will be guilty of sin against my father for all my days.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur maneam obsecro ego servus tuus pro puero, in famulatu tuo, et puer ascendat cum fratribus suis.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, I beg you, let your servant remain here as a servant in your place, instead of the boy, and let the boy go up with his brothers.'

verses.latin: Non enim potero reverti ad patrem meum, absente puero, ne calamitatis videam, quæ oppressura est patrem meum.
verses.english: 'For I cannot return to my father without the boy, lest I see the calamity that would overcome my father.'

verses.latin: Ioseph non se poterat ultra continere coram circumstantibus: unde praecepit ut cunctis egredientibus, nullus alienus a suis in colloquio praesens adesset.
verses.english: Joseph could no longer control his emotions in front of everyone present. So, he ordered everyone to leave, so that no outsider would be there when he spoke with his family.

verses.latin: Elevavitque vocem cum fletu, audierunt Ægyptii, omnisque domus Pharaonis.
verses.english: Then Joseph cried out loudly, weeping, and the Egyptians heard it, and all of Pharaoh’s household heard it.

verses.latin: Et dixit fratribus suis: Ego sum Ioseph: adhuc vivit pater meus? Ad quem non poterant respondere territi.
verses.english: He said to his brothers, "I am Joseph. Is my father still alive?" But they could not answer him, because they were terrified.

verses.latin: Et ait fratribus suis: Accedite ad me. Et cum accessissent, ait: Ego sum Ioseph frater vester, quem vendidistis in Ægyptum.
verses.english: Then he said to his brothers, "Come closer to me." And when they came closer, he said, "I am Joseph, your brother, whom you sold into Egypt."

verses.latin: Nolite pavere, neque vobis durum videatur quod vendidistis me his regionibus: pro salute enim vestra misit me Deus ante vos in Ægyptum.
verses.english: Do not be distressed or blame yourselves for selling me into this region. God, in His divine plan, sent me ahead of you to preserve your lives.

verses.latin: Biennium est enim ex quo fames cœpit esse in terra: et adhuc quinque anni restant, quibus nec arari poterit, nec meti.
verses.english: For it has been two years since the famine began in this land, and there are still five more years to come during which neither plowing nor harvesting will be possible.

verses.latin: Misitque me Deus ante vos, ut reservemini super terram, et escas habeatis ad vivendum.
verses.english: God sent me ahead of you so that you might be preserved on the earth, and that you might have food to keep yourselves alive.

verses.latin: Non vestro consilio, sed Dei huc missus sum: qui fecit me quasi patrem Pharaonis, et dominum universæ domus ejus, ac principem in omni terra Ægypti.
verses.english: So it was not by your doing, but by God’s design, that I was sent here. He has made me like a father to Pharaoh, lord over his entire household, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Festinate, et ascendite ad patrem meum, et dicetis ei: Hæc dicit filius tuus Ioseph: Deus fecit me dominum universæ terræ Ægypti: veni ad me, ne moreris.
verses.english: Hurry, go up to my father and tell him: 'Your son Joseph says this: God has made me lord over all the land of Egypt. Come down to me; do not delay!'

verses.latin: Habitabis in terra Gessen: et eris juxta me tu, et filii tui, et filii filiorum tuorum, oves tuæ, et armenta tua, et cuncta quæ possides.
verses.english: You will live in the land of Goshen, and you will be near me—you, your children, your grandchildren, your sheep, your cattle, and everything you own.

verses.latin: Ibi te pascam (adhuc enim quinque anni sunt famis), ne et tu, et domus tua, et omnia quæ possides, egeant.
verses.english: There I will provide for you (for there are still five years of famine ahead), so that you, your household, and everything you own will not suffer want.

verses.latin: Ecce oculi vestri, et oculi fratris mei Beniamin, vident quod os meum loquatur vobis.
verses.english: Behold, your own eyes, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, see that it is my own mouth speaking to you.

verses.latin: Nuntiate patri meo universam gloriam meam, et cuncta quæ vidistis in Ægypto: festinate, et adducite eum ad me.
verses.english: Tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and everything you have seen. Hurry and bring him down to me.

verses.latin: Cumque corruisset super collum Beniamin fratris sui, flevit: et Beniamin pari modo super collum ejus ploravit.
verses.english: Then Joseph threw his arms around his brother Benjamin’s neck and wept; and Benjamin likewise wept upon his neck.

verses.latin: Osculatusque Ioseph omnes fratres suos, flevit super singulos: post hæc ausi sunt loqui ad eum.
verses.english: Joseph then kissed all his brothers and wept over each one of them. After this, his brothers finally dared to speak with him.

verses.latin: Auditumque est, et celebri sermone vulgatum in aula Pharaonis, quod venissent fratres Ioseph: et gavisus est Pharao, atque omnis familia ejus.
verses.english: News spread quickly through Pharaoh’s palace that Joseph’s brothers had arrived, and Pharaoh and all his officials were very pleased.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Ioseph: Præcipe fratribus tuis, ut onustis jumentis proficiscantur, et vadant in terram Chanaan:
verses.english: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, "Command your brothers to load their pack animals and set out for the land of Canaan."

verses.latin: tollantque inde patrem suum et cognationem, et veniant ad me: et dabo illis omnia bona Ægypti, ut vescantur medullis terræ.
verses.english: "Let them bring your father and all their relatives back here to me. I will give them all the best of Egypt, so they may enjoy the richness of the land."

verses.latin: Præcipe etiam, ut tollant plaustra de terra Ægypti sibi, et parvulis, ac conjugibus suis: et assumant patrem, et properent venire.
verses.english: "Also command them to take wagons from the land of Egypt for themselves, their little ones, and their wives, and to bring your father quickly."

verses.latin: Nec quidquam de supellectili vestra relinquatis: quia omnia bona Ægypti vestra erunt.
verses.english: "Do not worry about any of your belongings, because all the finest things in Egypt will be yours."

verses.latin: Fecerunt filii Israel ut eis fuerat imperatum. Deduxitque eis Ioseph plaustra, juxta Pharaonis imperium: et cibaria in via.
verses.english: The sons of Israel did as they were instructed. Joseph gave them wagons, according to Pharaoh’s command, and also provisions for their journey.

verses.latin: Omnibus quoque dedit singulas mutatorias vestes: Beniamin vero dedit trecentas argenti, et quinque mutatorias vestes.
verses.english: To each of them, he also gave a set of new clothes. But to Benjamin, he gave three hundred pieces of silver and five sets of new clothes.

verses.latin: Patri quoque misit asinos decem, qui portarent ex omnibus Ægypti bonis, et totidem asinas hordei, panum, et ciborum in itinere.
verses.english: He also sent his father ten donkeys loaded with the best products of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain, bread, and other food supplies for his journey.

verses.latin: Dimisit ergo fratres suos, et proficiscentibus ait: Ne irascamini in via.
verses.english: So he sent his brothers away, and as they departed, he told them, "Do not quarrel on the journey."

verses.latin: Qui conscendentes de Ægypto, venerunt in terram Chanaan ad patrem suum Iacob.
verses.english: So they went up from Egypt and arrived in the land of Canaan, to their father Jacob.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt ei, dicentes: Ioseph vivit, et ipse dominatur in omni terra Ægypti. Quo audito, quasi de gravi somno evigilans Iacob, non credidit eis.
verses.english: They told him, saying, "Joseph is alive! And he is the ruler over all the land of Egypt!" When Jacob heard this, it was as if he awoke from a deep sleep, and he did not believe them.

verses.latin: Referentibus vero cunctis sermonibus Ioseph, quos locutus eis, viderunt plaustra, et omnia quæ miserat, revixit spiritus ejus.
verses.english: But when they recounted all the words Joseph had spoken to them, and when he saw the wagons and all the supplies Joseph had sent, Jacob’s spirit was revived.

verses.latin: Et ait: Sufficit mihi si adhuc Ioseph filius meus vivit: vadam, et videbo illum antequam moriar.
verses.english: And Jacob said, "It is enough! My son Joseph is still alive! I will go and see him before I die."

verses.latin: Verse not found in Clementine Vulgate (Genesis 45).
verses.english: Verse not found in Clementine Vulgate (Genesis 45).
