verses.latin: Igitur profectus Israël cum omnibus quae habebat, venit ad Puteum juramenti: et caesis ibi victimis, invocavit Deum patris sui Isaac.
verses.english: So Israel set out with everything he owned. He came to the place called the Well of the Oath. There, he offered sacrifices and called upon the God of his father, Isaac.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Deus per visionem nocte: Jacob, Jacob. Qui respondit: Ecce adsum.
verses.english: And God spoke to him through a vision at night, saying, 'Jacob! Jacob!' And he answered, 'Here I am.'

verses.latin: Cui ait: Ego sum fortissimus Deus patris tui: noli timere, descende in Ægyptum, quia in gentem magnam faciam te ibi.
verses.english: God said to him, 'I am the Almighty God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down into Egypt, for there I will make you into a great nation.'

verses.latin: Ego descendam tecum in Ægyptum, et ego te inde reducam redeuntem: præsenteque Joseph claudetur os tuum.
verses.english: I myself will go down with you into Egypt, and I will surely bring you back from there. And Joseph himself will be there to close your eyes when you die.'

verses.latin: Surrexitque Jacob a Puteo juramenti: et tulerunt eum filii ejus cum parvulis et uxoribus suis in plaustris, quæ miserat pharao ad portandum senem:
verses.english: So Jacob rose up from the Well of the Oath. His sons then carried him, his children, and his wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to transport the old man.

verses.latin: et universam substantiam, quam possederat in terra Chanaan, et ipse, ac totus simul semen ejus, venit in Ægyptum:
verses.english: They also took all the possessions he had acquired in the land of Canaan. So Jacob and all his offspring together came into Egypt.

verses.latin: filii ejus, et nepotes, filiæ et pronepotes, cunctos ad Ægyptum secum duxit.
verses.english: His sons, his grandsons, his daughters, and his granddaughters—all of his offspring he brought with him to Egypt.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt autem nomina filiorum Israël, qui ingressi sunt in Ægyptum, ipse Jacob et liberi ejus. Primogenitus ejus Ruben.
verses.english: These are the names of the sons of Israel who went into Egypt: Jacob himself and his children. His firstborn was Reuben.

verses.latin: Filii Ruben: Henoch et Phallu et Hesron et Charmi.
verses.english: The sons of Reuben were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

verses.latin: Filii Simeon: Jamuel et Jamin et Ohad et Jachin et Sohar et Saul filius Chanaanitidis.
verses.english: The sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul—who was the son of a Canaanite woman.

verses.latin: Filii Levi: Gerson et Caath et Merari.
verses.english: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Filii Juda: Her et Onan et Sela et Phares et Zara. Mortui sunt autem Her et Onan in terra Chanaan. Natique sunt filii Phares: Hesron et Hamul.
verses.english: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah. However, Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan. The sons born to Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

verses.latin: Filii Issachar: Thola et Phua et Job et Semron.
verses.english: The sons of Issachar were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

verses.latin: Filii Zabulon: Sared et Elon et Jahelel.
verses.english: The sons of Zebulun were Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Liæ, quos genuit Jacob in Mesopotamia Syriæ, et Dina filiam ejus. Omnes animæ masculæ et feminæ triginta tres.
verses.english: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Mesopotamia of Syria, and Dinah was also his daughter. All the souls of males and females were thirty-three.

verses.latin: Filii Gad: Sephion et Haggi et Suni et Ezbon et Heri et Arodi et Areli.
verses.english: The sons of Gad were Zephon, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

verses.latin: Filii Aser: Jemne et Jesua et Jessui et Beria, Sarath quoque soror eorum. Filii Beriæ: Heber et Melchiel.
verses.english: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Their sister was Serah. The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Zelphæ, quam dedit Laban Liæ filiæ suæ, et hos genuit Jacob sedecim animas.
verses.english: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah. And these Jacob bore to her, a total of sixteen souls.

verses.latin: Filii Rachel uxoris Jacob: Joseph et Benjamin.
verses.english: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife, were Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Natique sunt Joseph filii in terra Ægypti, quos genuit ei Aseneth filia Putiphare sacerdotis Heliopoleos: Manasses et Ephraim.
verses.english: And sons were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of Heliopolis, bore to him: Manasseh and Ephraim.

verses.latin: Filii Benjamin: Bela et Becher et Asbel et Gera et Naaman et Ehi et Ros et Mophim et Ophim et Ared.
verses.english: The sons of Benjamin were Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Rachel, quos genuit Jacob: omnes animæ quatuordecim.
verses.english: These are the sons of Rachel, whom Jacob bore to her, all of them fourteen souls.

verses.latin: Filii Dan: Husim.
verses.english: The sons of Dan were Hushim.

verses.latin: Filii Nepthali: Jaziel et Guni et Jeser et Sallem.
verses.english: The sons of Naphtali were Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Balæ, quam dedit Laban Rachel filiæ suæ: et hos genuit Jacob, omnes animæ septem.
verses.english: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel. And Jacob bore these to her, all of them seven souls.

verses.latin: Omnes animæ, quæ ingressæ sunt cum Jacob in Ægyptum, et egressæ de femore ejus, absque uxoribus filiorum ejus, cunctæ sexaginta sex.
verses.english: All the souls who entered Egypt with Jacob, those who came from his loins, excluding his sons' wives, were sixty-six in total.

verses.latin: Filii autem Joseph, qui nati sunt ei in terra Ægypti, animæ duæ. Omnes animæ domus Jacob, quæ ingressæ sunt in Ægyptum, fuerunt septuaginta.
verses.english: As for Joseph's sons, who were born to him in the land of Egypt, there were two souls. All the souls of Jacob's household who entered Egypt were seventy in total.

verses.latin: Præmisit autem Judam ante se ad Joseph, ut nuntiaret ei, et ille occurreret ei in Gessen.
verses.english: Jacob sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph, to announce his coming and for Joseph to meet him in Goshen.

verses.latin: Junctoque curru Joseph, ascendit obviam patri suo in Gessen: quem statim ut vidit, irruit super collum ejus, et inter amplexus flevit.
verses.english: Joseph then harnessed his chariot and went up to meet his father in Goshen. As soon as he saw him, he rushed to embrace him, and wept while holding him.

verses.latin: Et dixit Israël ad Joseph: Jam lætus moriar, quia vidi faciem tuam, et superstitem te relinquo.
verses.english: And Israel said to Joseph, 'Now I will be glad to die, since I have seen your face, and I leave you alive and well.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Joseph ad fratres suos, et ad omnem patris sui domum: Ascendam, et nuntiabo Pharaoni, et dicam ei: Fratres mei, et domus patris mei, qui erant in terra Chanaan, venerunt ad me:
verses.english: Then Joseph said to his brothers and to all his father's household, 'I will go up and tell Pharaoh, and I will say to him: My brothers and my father's household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.'

verses.latin: et homines sunt pastores ovium, et pecua nutriunt: greges suos, et armenta, et omnia quæ habere potuerunt, adduxerunt secum.
verses.english: And these men are shepherds of sheep; they are keepers of livestock. They have brought their flocks, their herds, and everything they possess with them.

verses.latin: Cum igitur vocaverit vos Pharao, et interrogaverit: Quod est opus vestrum?
verses.english: So when Pharaoh calls you and asks, 'What is your occupation?'

verses.latin: respondebitis: Viri pastores fuimus ab infantia nostra usque in præsens, et nos et patres nostri. Hæc dicetis, ut habitare possitis in terra Gessen: omnes enim pastores abominantur Ægyptii.
verses.english: You shall answer: 'Your servants have been shepherds from our youth until now, both we and our fathers.' You must say this so that you may dwell in the land of Goshen, because all shepherds are an abomination to the Egyptians.

verses.latin: Venit igitur Ioseph et nuntiavit Pharaoni, dicens: Pater meus et fratres mei, oves eorum, et armenta, et cuncta quae possident, venerunt de terra Chanaan, et ecce consistunt in terra Gessen.
verses.english: Joseph then arrived and informed Pharaoh, saying, "My father and my brothers, with their sheep, their herds, and all their possessions, have come from the land of Canaan. Look, they are now settled in the land of Goshen."

verses.latin: Et de fratribus suis quinque viros statuit coram rege.
verses.english: And he presented five of his brothers before the king.

verses.latin: Quos ille interrogavit: Quod est opus vestrum? Responderunt: Pastores ovium sumus servi tui, et nos et patres nostri.
verses.english: Pharaoh asked them, "What is your work?" They answered, "Your servants are shepherds of sheep, both we and our fathers before us."

verses.latin: Addentes: Ut paremus in terra tua, venimus: non enim habent pascua greges famulorum tuorum in terra Chanaan, vehementer enim gravata est fames. Rogamus ergo te ut iubeas famulos tuos commorari in terra Gessen.
verses.english: They added, "We have come to live in your land, for your servants' flocks can find no pasture in Canaan because the famine is very severe. We therefore ask you to command your servants to settle in the land of Goshen."

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Pharao ad Ioseph: Pater tuus et fratres tui venerunt ad te.
verses.english: Pharaoh then said to Joseph, "Your father and your brothers have come to you."

verses.latin: Terra Ægypti in conspectu tuo est: in optimo loco fac eos habitare, et trade eis terram Gessen. Quod si noveris in eis esse viros industrios, constitue illos magistros pecorum meorum.
verses.english: The land of Egypt is before you. Make them live in the very best area, and give them the land of Goshen. And if you know there are any capable men among them, appoint them as overseers of my own livestock.

verses.latin: Adduxit autem Ioseph patrem suum Iacob, et statuit eum coram rege: cui benedicens.
verses.english: Joseph then brought his father Jacob and presented him before the king, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

verses.latin: Interrogavit illum Pharao: Quot sunt dies annorum vitae tuae?
verses.english: Pharaoh asked him, "How many are the days of the years of your life?"

verses.latin: Respondit Iacob: Dies peregrinationis meae centum triginta annorum sunt, parvi et mali, et non pervenerunt usque ad dies annorum patrum meorum in quibus peregrinati sunt.
verses.english: Jacob answered, "The days of my pilgrimage have been one hundred and thirty years. They have been few and difficult, and they have not reached the length of the years of my fathers' lives during which they sojourned."

verses.latin: Et benedicens regi exivit.
verses.english: And blessing the king again, he departed.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo Ioseph patri et fratribus suis possessionem in Ægypto, in optimis terrae locis, in terra Ramesses, sicut praeceperat Pharao.
verses.english: Joseph then gave his father and his brothers a possession in Egypt, in the very best places of the land, in the land of Rameses, just as Pharaoh had commanded.

verses.latin: Et alebat eos et omnem domum patris sui, praebens alimenta singulis.
verses.english: And he nourished them and his entire father's household, providing food for each one.

verses.latin: In omni terra panis deerat: et fames praevalebat in orbe terrarum, defeceratque Ægyptus et terra Chanaan propter inopiam ciborum.
verses.english: In all the land, bread was lacking, and the famine prevailed throughout the world. Both Egypt and the land of Canaan were failing due to the scarcity of food.

verses.latin: De quibus emit Ioseph omnem pecuniam Ægyptiorum et Chananæorum pro annonis quas coemebant: congregavitque eam in fisco regis.
verses.english: Joseph purchased all the money of the Egyptians and Canaanites from them in exchange for the grain they bought. And he gathered all that money into the king's treasury.

verses.latin: Cumque defecisset pecunia, venerunt universi Ægyptii ad Ioseph, dicentes: Da nobis cibos: quare morimur coram te, deficiente pecunia?
verses.english: When the money ran out, all the Egyptians came to Joseph, saying, "Give us food! Why should we die before you, now that our money has failed?"

verses.latin: Quibus ille respondit: Date pecora vestra, et dabo vobis cibos.
verses.english: He replied to them, "Give your livestock, and I will give you food."

verses.latin: Adduxerunt ergo pecora ad Ioseph: quibus et dabat alimenta in equis, et ovibus, et bobus, et asinis, et sustentavit eos anno illo pro commutatione pecorum.
verses.english: So they brought their livestock to Joseph. And he gave them food in exchange for their horses, sheep, cattle, and donkeys. He sustained them for that entire year by exchanging their livestock for food.

verses.latin: Veneruntque secundo anno, dicentes: Non celamus dominum nostrum, quia deficiente pecunia, et pecoribus ad te translatis, nihil est aliud quod habere possimus, nisi corpora nostra et terram nostram.
verses.english: They came again in the second year, saying, "We cannot hide from our lord that, with our money exhausted and our livestock transferred to you, we have nothing left to offer except our bodies and our land."

verses.latin: Cur ergo morimur te vidente, et nos et terra nostra? eme nos et terram nostram in cibis, et erimus regis servi, et ager noster: ut sementem facere possimus, et non moriamur, nec noster intereat ager.
verses.english: "Why should we die while you watch, both we and our land? Buy us and our land with food, and we and our fields will become servants of the king. Provide for us so that we can sow seed, and not die, nor our land become desolate."

verses.latin: Emit ergo Ioseph omnem terram Ægypti, vendentibus singulis possessiones suas prae magnitudine famis: subjugavitque eam Pharaoni.
verses.english: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt, as each person sold their possessions because of the severity of the famine. And he made it subject to Pharaoh.

verses.latin: Et cunctos populos transtulit in urbes, a finibus Ægypti usque ad extremos eius fines.
verses.english: And he moved all the people into the cities, from one end of Egypt to the other.

verses.latin: Exceptis sacerdotum terris, quae a rege datae fuerant eis: quibus et statuta cibaria singulis annis præbebantur, et idcirco non sunt compulsi vendere possessiones suas.
verses.english: The lands of the priests were exempt, for they had been given to them by the king. They also received a fixed allowance of food each year, and therefore they were not compelled to sell their possessions.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Ioseph ad populos: En ut cernitis, et vos et terram vestram emit Pharao: date vobis semina, et serite agros.
verses.english: Joseph then said to the people, "Look, as you see, Pharaoh has bought both you and your land. Take seeds for yourselves, and sow the fields."

verses.latin: Ut fruges collegissent, quintam partem regi dabitis: quatuor vero partes vobis remanebunt in sementem, et in cibum familiarum vestrarum et liberorum.
verses.english: When you gather the harvest, you will give a fifth part to the king. The four remaining parts will be yours for seed, and for food for your families and your children.

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Salus nostra in manu tua est: tantum aspiciat nos dominus noster, et laeti serviemus regi.
verses.english: They answered, "Our salvation is in your hands. May our lord only look favorably upon us, and we will gladly serve the king."

verses.latin: Ex eo igitur die et usque in præsentem diem, in universa terra Ægypti, regibus quinta pars persolvitur, excepto solo sacerdotali, quod liberum mansit.
verses.english: From that day until the present day, a fifth part is paid to the kings throughout all the land of Egypt, except for the land of the priests, which remained free.

verses.latin: Habitavit itaque Israël in Ægypto, in terra Gessen: et possedit eam, auxitque et multiplicavit nimis.
verses.english: So Israel lived in Egypt, in the land of Goshen. And they took possession of it, increased, and multiplied greatly.

verses.latin: Vixitque Iacob in terra Ægypti decem et septem annis: factique sunt omnes dies vitae illius, centum quadraginta septem annis.
verses.english: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt for seventeen years. So all the days of his life were one hundred and forty-seven years.

verses.latin: Appropinquante ergo tempore mortis eius, vocavit filium suum Ioseph, et dixit ad eum: Si inveni gratiam in conspectu tuo, pone manum tuam sub femore meo: ut facias mecum misericordiam et veritatem, ut non sepelias me in Ægypto:
verses.english: As the time of his death drew near, he called his son Joseph and said to him, "If I have found favor in your sight, put your hand under my thigh, that you may show me kindness and fidelity, and not bury me in Egypt.

verses.latin: Sed dormiam cum patribus meis, et auferas me de terra hac, et sepelias in sepulchro majorum meorum. Cui respondit Ioseph: Ego faciam quod iussisti.
verses.english: But let me rest with my fathers, and carry me out of this land, and bury me in the tomb of my ancestors." Joseph answered him, "I will do as you have commanded."

verses.latin: Et ille: Iura, inquit, mihi. Juravitque illi: et adoravit Israël Deum, conversus ad caput lectuli.
verses.english: And Jacob said, "Swear to me." And Joseph swore to him. Then Israel, turning towards the head of his bed, worshipped God.

verses.latin: His igitur transactis, nuntiatum est Joseph quod aegrotaret pater suus: qui assumptis duobus filiis suis Manasse et Ephraim, profectus est ad eum.
verses.english: After these things had happened, Joseph was told that his father, Jacob, was very ill. So he took his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim, and went to see him.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est seni: ecce, filius tuus Joseph venit ad te. Confortatusque Israel sedit in lectulo suo.
verses.english: And it was announced to the old man, Jacob: 'Look, your son Joseph is coming to you!' And Jacob, strengthening himself, sat up in his bed.

verses.latin: Et ait Joseph: Deus omnipotens apparuit mihi in Luza, quae est in terra Chanaan, benedixitque mihi,
verses.english: And Jacob said to Joseph: 'God Almighty appeared to me in Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,

verses.latin: et ait: Ego te augebo et multiplicabo, et faciam te in multitudinem populorum: daboque tibi terram hanc, et semini tuo post te in possessionem sempiternam.
verses.english: and said: 'I will make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will make you into a multitude of peoples. And I will give this land to you and to your descendants after you, as an eternal possession.'

verses.latin: Duo igitur filii tui, qui nati sunt tibi in terra Aegypti antequam huc venirem ad te, mei sunt: Ephraim et Manasses, sicut Ruben et Simeon, reputabuntur mihi.
verses.english: Now, your two sons who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you here, they are counted as my own. Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine, just as Reuben and Simeon are mine.

verses.latin: Ceteros vero quos genueris post illos, tui erunt, et nomine fratrum suorum vocabuntur in possessionibus suis.
verses.english: But the rest of your children whom you have had after them shall be yours, and they will be named after their brothers in their inheritances.

verses.latin: Revertente mihi de Mesopotamia, mortua est Rachel juxta me in terra Chanaan, in ipso itinere, venientibus mihi in Ephratha, et a parte viae modicum spatium supererat ut venirem Bethlehem. Ibi ergo sepelivi eam.
verses.english: When I was returning from Mesopotamia, Rachel died beside me in the land of Canaan, on the journey itself, as I was coming to Ephrath. There was only a short distance left on the road to reach Bethlehem. Therefore, I buried her there.

verses.latin: Videns autem Joseph filios suos, ait: Qui sunt isti?
verses.english: Now Jacob, seeing Joseph's sons, said: 'Who are these young men?'

verses.latin: Respondit illi: Filii mei sunt, quos dedit mihi Deus in his locis. Et ait: Affer illos ad me, ut benedicam eis.
verses.english: Joseph answered him: 'They are my sons, whom God has given me in this place.' And Jacob said: 'Bring them closer to me, so that I may bless them.'

verses.latin: Oculi autem Israel caligaverant prae senectute, et non poterat procul videre. Et applicitos sibi, deosculatus et amplexatus eos,
verses.english: Now, Jacob's eyes were dim because of his old age, and he could not see clearly from a distance. So he brought them close to himself, kissed and embraced them.

verses.latin: ait ad Joseph: Non sum fraudatus aspectu tuo: insuper et semen tuum ostendit mihi Deus.
verses.english: He said to Joseph: 'I thought I would never see your face again; but God has shown me even your descendants.'

verses.latin: Cumque transtulisset Joseph eos de gremio patris, adoravit pronus in terram.
verses.english: And when Joseph had moved his sons from their father's lap, he bowed down with his face to the ground.

verses.latin: Tulitque Ephraim in dextera sua, hoc est, ad sinistram Israel: Manassen vero in sinistra sua, ad dexteram patris, et applicuit ambos.
verses.english: And Joseph took Ephraim in his right hand, to place him at Jacob's left, and Manasseh in his left hand, to place him at Jacob's right, and brought both of them close to his father.

verses.latin: Qui extendens dexteram manum, posuit super caput Ephraim minoris fratris: sinistram autem manum super caput Manasse prioris, commutans manus.
verses.english: But Jacob, extending his right hand, placed it upon the head of Ephraim, the younger brother, and his left hand upon the head of Manasseh, the older brother, crossing his hands.

verses.latin: Benedixitque Joseph, et ait: Deus, in cujus conspectu ambulaverunt patres mei Abraham et Isaac, Deus qui pascit me ab adolescentia mea usque in praesentem diem:
verses.english: And he blessed Joseph, and said: 'May God, in whose presence my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked, the God who has fed me from my youth until this very day, bless them:

verses.latin: Angelus qui eruit me de cunctis malis, benedicat pueris istis: et invocetur super eos nomen meum, nomina quoque patrum meorum Abraham et Isaac: et crescant in multitudinem super terram.
verses.english: May the Angel who has redeemed me from all evils bless these boys. May my name be invoked upon them, and the names of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, too. And may they grow into a multitude upon the earth.'

verses.latin: Videns autem Joseph quod posuisset pater suus dexteram manum super caput Ephraim, graviter accepit: et apprehensam patris manum, voluit de capite Ephraim transferre ad caput Manasse,
verses.english: Now when Joseph saw that his father had placed his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, he was displeased. So he took hold of his father's hand, wishing to move it from Ephraim's head to Manasseh's head,

verses.latin: dicens: Noli ita, pater, quia hic est primogenitus: pone dexteram tuam super caput ejus.
verses.english: saying: 'Not like that, Father, because this one is the firstborn. Place your right hand upon his head.'

verses.latin: Qui renuens, ait: Scio, fili mi, scio: et iste quidem erit in populos, et multiplicabitur: sed frater ejus minor, major erit illo: et semen illius crescet in multitudinem gentium.
verses.english: But Jacob refused, saying: 'I know, my son, I know. He, Manasseh, will also become a people, and he will be multiplied. But his younger brother, Ephraim, will be greater than he, and his descendants will grow into a multitude of nations.'

verses.latin: Benedixitque eis in die illo, dicens: In te benedicetur Israel, atque dicetur: Faciat tibi Deus sicut Ephraim et sicut Manasse. Et posuit Ephraim ante Manassen.
verses.english: And he blessed them that day, saying: 'Through you, Israel will be blessed, and it will be said: 'May God make you like Ephraim and like Manasseh.'' And he placed Ephraim before Manasseh.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Joseph: Ecce ego morior, et erit Deus vobiscum, et reducet vos ad terram patrum vestrorum.
verses.english: Then Jacob said to Joseph: 'Behold, I am about to die. But God will be with you, and He will bring you back to the land of your fathers.'

verses.latin: Ego autem dabo tibi partem unam extra fratres tuos, quam tuli de manu Amorrhaei in gladio et arcu meo.
verses.english: 'Moreover, I am giving you one portion more than your brothers, which I took from the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.'

verses.latin: Vocavit autem Iacob filios suos, et ait illis: Congregamini, ut annuntiem vobis quae ventura sunt in novissimis diebus.
verses.english: Then Jacob called his sons to him, and he said to them: 'Gather around me, so I may tell you what will happen to you in the last days of history.'

verses.latin: Congregamini, et audite filii Iacob; audite Israel patrem vestrum.
verses.english: 'Gather around me and listen, you sons of Jacob; listen to Israel your father.'

verses.latin: Ruben, primogenitus meus, tu fortitudo mea, et principium doloris mei; prior in donis, major in imperio.
verses.english: 'Reuben, my firstborn, you were my strength, the first fruit of my vigor, excelling in dignity and in power.'

verses.latin: Effusus es sicut aquae, non crescas: quia ascendisti cubile patris tui, et maculasti stratum ejus.
verses.english: 'You were unstable, poured out like water; you shall no longer excel, for you went up to your father’s bed and defiled my couch.'

verses.latin: Simeon et Levi fratres: vasa iniquitatis arma eorum.
verses.english: 'Simeon and Levi are brothers, and their weapons are instruments of violence and injustice.'

verses.latin: In consilium eorum ne veniat anima mea, et in coetu illorum non sit gloria mea: quia in ira sua occiderunt virum, et in voluntate sua suffoderunt murum.
verses.english: 'May my soul never enter into their schemes, nor may my glory be united with their assembly, for in their rage, they killed men, and in their self-will, they destroyed walls (cities).'

verses.latin: Maledicta ira eorum, quia pertinax: et indignatio eorum, quia dura. Dividam eos in Jacob, et dispergam illos in Israel.
verses.english: 'Cursed be their anger, because it was fierce; and their indignation, because it was cruel. I will divide them throughout Jacob and disperse them within Israel.'

verses.latin: Juda, te laudabunt fratres tui: manus tua in cervicibus inimicorum tuorum, adorabunt te filii patris tui.
verses.english: 'Judah, your brothers shall praise you: your hand shall be on the necks of your enemies; the sons of your father shall bow down to you.'

verses.latin: Catulus leonis Juda: ad praedam, fili mi, ascendisti. Requiescens accubuisti ut leo, et quasi leaena, quem suscitabit?
verses.english: 'Judah is a lion's cub; you have gone up, my son, to seize the prey. You crouched down and lay like a lion, and like a lioness—who dares to rouse him?'

verses.latin: Non auferetur sceptrum de Juda, et dux de femore ejus, donec veniat qui mittendus est, et ipse erit expectatio gentium.
verses.english: 'The scepter shall not be taken away from Judah, nor a ruler from his descendants, until He comes for whom it is reserved, and He shall be the expectation of the nations (the Messiah).'

verses.latin: Ligabit ad vineam pullum suum, et ad vitem, o fili mi, asinam suam. Lavabit in vino stolam suam, et in sanguine uvae pallium suum.
verses.english: 'He shall tie his donkey's colt to the vine, and his donkey to the choicest vine. He will wash his robes in wine, and his garments in the blood of grapes, signifying abundant prosperity.'

verses.latin: Pulchriores oculi ejus vino, et dentes ejus lacte candidiores.
verses.english: 'His eyes are brighter (more sparkling) than wine, and his teeth whiter than milk (signifying health and beauty).'

verses.latin: Zabulon in littore maris habitabit, et in statione navium, pertingens usque ad Sidonem.
verses.english: 'Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore; he shall be a haven for ships, and his border shall reach as far as Sidon.'

verses.latin: Issachar asinus fortis, accubans inter terminos.
verses.english: 'Issachar is a strong donkey, lying down between two burdens (or territories).'

verses.latin: Vidit requiem quod esset bona, et terram quod optima: et supposito humero suo ad portandum, factus est tributarius.
verses.english: 'He saw that rest was good, and that the land was pleasant, so he bowed his shoulder to bear burdens, and became a servant (of tribute).'

verses.latin: Dan judicabit populum suum, sicut et alter unus de tribubus Israel.
verses.english: 'Dan shall judge his people, as one of the other tribes of Israel.'

verses.latin: Fiat Dan coluber in via, cerastes in semita, mordens ungulas equi, ut cadat ascensor ejus retrorsum.
verses.english: 'May Dan be a serpent by the way, a viper in the path, that bites the horse's heels so that its rider falls backward, acting with cunning and surprise.'

verses.latin: Salutare tuum exspectabo, Domine.
verses.english: 'I await your salvation, O Lord (a sudden prayer of Jacob).'

verses.latin: Gad, accinctus proeliabitur ante eum: et ipse succingetur retro.
verses.english: 'Gad, a troop shall press upon him (attack him), but he shall press upon their rear (or overcome them in the end).'

verses.latin: Aser, pinguis panis ejus, et praebebit delicias regibus.
verses.english: 'Asher, his bread shall be rich (or abundant and fertile), and he shall yield dainties (luxurious food) for kings.'

verses.latin: Nephthali, cervus emissus, dans eloquia pulchritudinis.
verses.english: 'Naphtali is a swift deer (or a hind let loose), uttering beautiful words (or giving good tidings).'

verses.latin: Filius accrescens Joseph, filius accrescens et decorus in aspectu: filiae discurrerunt super murum.
verses.english: 'Joseph is a fruitful son, a fruitful son by a spring, a beautiful young plant whose branches run over the wall (meaning his offspring will spread far).'

verses.latin: Exasperaverunt eum, et jurgati sunt, et inviderunt illi viri habentes sagittas:
verses.english: 'The archers provoked him, contended with him, and shot at him with bitter arrows (representing the malice of his enemies).'

verses.latin: Sedit in fortitudine arcus ejus, et dissoluta sunt vincula brachiorum, et manuum illius per potentem Jacob: inde pastor exortus est, lapis Israel.
verses.english: 'But his bow remained strong, and the strength of his arms was made firm by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob—from there came the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel (referring to God's protection of Joseph and a prophetic reference to Christ).'

verses.latin: Deus patris tui erit adjutor tuus, et Omnipotens benedicet tibi in benedictionibus caeli desuper, in benedictionibus abyssi deorsum, benedictionibus uberum et vulvae.
verses.english: 'The God of your father shall be your helper, and the Almighty shall bless you with blessings from the universe above (rain and dew), with blessings from the deep (springs and fertile ground) below, with blessings of the breasts and of the womb (fertility and numerous offspring).'

verses.latin: Benedictiones patris tui confortatae sunt super benedictiones patrum meorum: donec veniret desiderium collium aeternorum.
verses.english: 'The blessings of your father are stronger than the blessings of my fathers (forefathers), reaching even to the desired summits of the everlasting hills (representing lasting and abundant prosperity).'

verses.latin: Benjamin lupus rapax, mane comedet praedam, et vespere dividet spolia.
verses.english: 'Benjamin is a ravenous wolf; in the morning, he devours the prey, and in the evening, he divides the spoils (indicating a warlike and fierce tribe).'

verses.latin: Omnes hi in tribubus Israel duodecim: haec locutus est eis pater suus, benedicens unicuique secundum benedictionem suam.
verses.english: 'All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father spoke to them, blessing each one according to his own specific blessing (or prophecy).'

verses.latin: Et praecepit eis, dicens: Ego congregor ad populum meum: sepelite me cum patribus meis in spelunca duplici, quae est in agro Ephron Hethaei,
verses.english: And he charged them, saying: 'I am about to be gathered to my people (to die); bury me with my fathers in the double cave, which is in the field of Ephron the Hethite,'

verses.latin: juxta speluncam quae est in agro Machpela contra Mamre in terra Chanaan, quam emit Abraham cum agro a fratribus Hethaei in possessionem sepulchri.
verses.english: 'near the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, opposite Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham purchased, along with the field, from the sons of Heth, as a burial possession (a place of rest for the family).'

verses.latin: Ibi sepelierunt eum, et Saram uxorem ejus: ibi sepeliverunt Isaac, Rebeccam quoque uxorem illius: et ibi Lia humata est.
verses.english: 'There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there Leah was buried.'

verses.latin: Et expleta narratione praeceptorum, quibus filios instruebat, collegit pedes suos super lectulum, et obiit: et appositus est ad populum suum.
verses.english: When he had finished giving instructions to his sons, he drew his feet up onto the bed, and he died, and was gathered to his people (his ancestors who had passed on).

verses.latin: Videns autem Ioseph jacere patrem suum super faciem eius flevit, et osculatus est eum.
verses.english: Joseph saw his father was dead, and he fell upon his father's face, weeping and kissing him.

verses.latin: Praecepitque servis suis medicis ut aromatibus condirent patrem.
verses.english: Then he ordered his servants, the physicians, to embalm his father with spices.

verses.latin: Quibus iussis, implerunt munus. Transieruntque quadraginta dies, iste qui mos est cadaverum conditorum. Flevitque eum Aegyptus septuaginta diebus.
verses.english: After these orders, they completed the task. Forty days passed—this was the usual custom for embalmed bodies. And all of Egypt mourned for him for seventy days.

verses.latin: Et expleto luctu, locutus est Ioseph ad familiam pharaonis, dicens: Si inveni gratiam in conspectu vestro, loquimini ad pharaonem pro me:
verses.english: When the mourning period was finished, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s household, saying, "If I have found favor in your eyes, please speak to Pharaoh on my behalf:

verses.latin: Quod pater meus adiuravit me, dicens: Ecce morior: in sepulchro meo quod fodi mihi in terra Chanaan, illic sepelies me. Ascendam igitur, et sepeliam patrem meum, ac revertar.
verses.english: My father made me swear, saying, 'I am about to die. In my tomb, which I dug for myself in the land of Canaan, there you will bury me.' Therefore, I ask to go up and bury my father, and then I will return."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei pharao: Ascende, et sepeli patrem tuum sicut adiuratus es.
verses.english: Pharaoh said to him, "Go up and bury your father, as you have sworn to him."

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Ioseph ut sepeliret patrem suum: cum quo ierunt omnes senes domus pharaonis, cunctique maiores natu terrae Aegypti,
verses.english: So Joseph went up to bury his father. With him went all the elders of Pharaoh's household and all the leading elders of the land of Egypt,

verses.latin: Domus Ioseph cum fratribus suis, et omni cognatione, exceptis parvulis et gregibus atque armentis, quae dimiserant in terra Gessen.
verses.english: along with Joseph's household, his brothers, and all his relatives. Only their little children, their flocks, and their herds, which they had left in the land of Goshen, remained behind.

verses.latin: Habuerunt etiam in comitatu suo currus et equites, et facta est turba non modica.
verses.english: They also had chariots and horsemen in their procession, and it was a very great company.

verses.latin: Veneruntque ad Aream Atad, quae sita est trans Jordanem: ubi celebrantes exequias planctu magno atque vehementi, impleverunt septem dies.
verses.english: When they came to the Threshing Floor of Atad, which is located beyond the Jordan, they celebrated the funeral rites with great and intense lamentation, observing seven days of mourning there.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidissent habitatores terrae Chanaan, et ex more lugentes ait: Luctus magnus est hic Aegyptiis. Ob hanc causam, vocatum est nomen loci illius, Planctus Aegypti.
verses.english: When the inhabitants of the land of Canaan saw the mourning at the Threshing Floor of Atad, they said, "This is a profound mourning for the Egyptians." For this reason, the place was named Planctus Aegypti, which means 'Mourning of the Egyptians'.

verses.latin: Feceruntque filii Iacob sicut praeceperat eis.
verses.english: Thus, Jacob’s sons did just as he had commanded them.

verses.latin: Tuleruntque eum in terram Chanaan: et sepelierunt in spelunca Machpelah, quam emerat Abraham cum agro in possessionem sepulchri, a Ephron Hethaeo contra faciem Mamre.
verses.english: They carried him into the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave of Machpelah, which Abraham had bought from Ephron the Hittite, along with the field, as a burial possession facing Mamre.

verses.latin: Reversusque est Ioseph in Aegyptum cum fratribus suis, et omni comitatu, postquam sepelisset patrem suum.
verses.english: After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt with his brothers and all the company that had gone with him.

verses.latin: Quo defuncto, timentes fratres Ioseph, et mutuo colloquentes: Ne forte memor sit injuriae quam passus est, et reddat nobis malum omne quod fecimus.
verses.english: After their father's death, Joseph's brothers were afraid and said to one another, "What if Joseph still holds a grudge against us and repays us for all the harm we did to him?"

verses.latin: Mandaverunt ad eum dicentes: Pater tuus praecepit nobis cum adhuc viveret,
verses.english: So they sent a message to Joseph, saying, "Your father gave us this command before he died,

verses.latin: Ut diceremus tibi: Obsecro ut obliviscaris sceleris fratrum tuorum, et peccati quod fecerunt in te. Malum quidem, sed nunc deprecamur ut dimittas servis Dei patris tui, iniquitatem hanc. Quibus auditis, flevit Ioseph.
verses.english: 'Please forgive your brothers' wickedness and the sin they committed against you.' It was indeed evil, but now we implore you to forgive this iniquity, for we are the servants of your father’s God." When he heard these words, Joseph wept.

verses.latin: Veneruntque ad eum ipsi fratres sui, et proni in terram dixerunt: Servi tui sumus.
verses.english: Then his brothers themselves came to him, prostrating themselves on the ground, and said, "We are your servants."

verses.latin: Quibus ille respondit: Nolite timere: an Dei possumus resistere voluntati?
verses.english: Joseph answered them, "Do not be afraid. Am I in God’s place, to oppose His will?"

verses.latin: Vos cogitastis de me malum: et Deus vertit illud in bonum, ut exaltaret me sicut nunc videtis, et salvos faceret multos populos.
verses.english: You intended evil against me, but God turned it into good, so that He might exalt me as you see today, and save many people.

verses.latin: Nolite ergo timere, ego pascam vos et parvulos vestros. Consolatusque est eos, et blandis sermonibus allocutus.
verses.english: Therefore, do not be afraid. I will provide for you and your little children." So he comforted them and spoke to them with kind words.

verses.latin: Et habitavit cum eo in Aegypto, ipse et domus patris sui. Vixitque centum decem annis.
verses.english: So Joseph lived in Egypt, he and his father's household. He lived for one hundred and ten years.

verses.latin: Et vidit filios Ephraim usque ad tertiam generationem. Filii quoque Machir filii Manasse, nati sunt in femoribus Ioseph.
verses.english: He lived to see Ephraim's children of the third generation. The children of Machir, Manasseh's son, were also born and received into Joseph's family.

verses.latin: Quibus transactis, locutus est fratribus suis: Post mortem meam Deus visitabit vos, et ascendere vos faciet de terra hac ad terram quam juravit Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob.
verses.english: After these events, Joseph spoke to his brothers, saying, "After my death, God will certainly visit you and lead you out of this land to the land which He swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob."

verses.latin: Adiuravitque eos dicens: Deus visitabit vos, asportate ossa mea vobiscum de loco isto.
verses.english: And he made them swear, saying, "When God visits you, make sure you carry my bones with you from this place."

verses.latin: Mortuusque est, expleto vitae suae termino, centum decem annorum. Et conditus aromatibus, positus est in sarcophago in Aegypto.
verses.english: Then Joseph died, having completed the span of his life at one hundred and ten years old. And after he was embalmed with spices, he was placed in a sarcophagus in Egypt.
